THE WINDOW]192-the lighthouse the window

" Yes , of course , if it 's fine tomorrow , "[65-mrs. ramsay] said [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay . " But [you]193-her son 'll have to be up with the lark , "[65-mrs. ramsay] [she]65-mrs. ramsay added .

To [[her]65-mrs. ramsay son]193-her son these words conveyed an extraordinary joy , as if it were settled , the expedition were bound to take place , and the wonder to which [he]193-her son had looked forward , for years and years it seemed , was , after a night 's darkness and a day 's sail , within touch . Since [he]193-her son belonged , even at the age of six , to that great clan which can not keep this feeling separate from that , but must let future prospects , with [their]194-their joys and sorrows , cloud what is actually at hand , since to [such people even in earliest childhood]195-such people even in earliest childhood any turn in the wheel of sensation has the power to crystallise and transfix the moment upon which its gloom or radiance rests , [James Ramsay]66-james , sitting on the floor cutting out pictures from the illustrated catalogue of [the Army and Navy stores]196-the army and navy stores , endowed the picture of a refrigerator , as [[his]66-james mother]197-his mother spoke , with heavenly bliss . It was fringed with joy . The wheelbarrow , the lawnmower , the sound of poplar trees , leaves whitening before rain , rooks cawing , brooms knocking , dresses rustling - all these were so coloured and distinguished in [his]66-james mind that [he]66-james had already [his]66-james private code , [his]66-james secret language , though [he]66-james appeared the image of stark and uncompromising severity , with [his]66-james high forehead and [his]66-james fierce blue eyes , impeccably candid and pure , frowning slightly at the sight of human frailty , so that [[his]66-james mother]197-his mother , watching [him]66-james guide [his]66-james scissors neatly round the refrigerator , imagined [him]66-james all red and ermine on the Bench or directing a stern and momentous enterprise in some crisis of public affairs .

" But , "[199-his father] said [[his]66-james father]199-his father , stopping in front of [the drawing - room]200-the drawing - room window , " it wo n't be fine . "[199-his father]

Had there been an axe handy , a poker , or any weapon that would have gashed a hole in [[his]66-james father]199-his father 's breast and killed [him]199-his father , there and then , [James]66-james would have seized it . Such were the extremes of emotion that [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay excited in [[his]67-mr. ramsay children]202-his children 's breasts by [his]67-mr. ramsay mere presence ; standing , as now , lean as a knife , narrow as the blade of one , grinning sarcastically , not only with the pleasure of disillusioning [[his]67-mr. ramsay son]203-his son and casting ridicule upon [[his]67-mr. ramsay wife]204-his wife , who was ten thousand times better in every way than [he]67-mr. ramsay was [James]66-james thought , but also with some secret conceit at [his]67-mr. ramsay own accuracy of judgement . What [he]67-mr. ramsay said was true . It was always true . [He]67-mr. ramsay was incapable of untruth ; never tampered with a fact ; never altered a disagreeable word to suit the pleasure or convenience of [any mortal being]205-any mortal being , least of all of [[his]67-mr. ramsay own children]206-his own children , who , sprung from [his]67-mr. ramsay loins , should be aware from childhood that life is difficult ; facts uncompromising ; and the passage to [that fabled land]207-that fabled land where [our]208-our brightest hopes are extinguished , [our]208-our frail barks founder in darkness here [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay would straighten [his]67-mr. ramsay back and narrow [his]67-mr. ramsay little blue eyes upon the horizon , one that needs , above all , courage , truth , and the power to endure .

" But it may be fine - [I]65-mrs. ramsay expect it will be fine , "[65-mrs. ramsay] said [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay , making some little twist of the reddish brown stocking [she]65-mrs. ramsay was knitting , impatiently . If [she]65-mrs. ramsay finished it tonight , if [they]209-they did go to [the Lighthouse]210-the lighthouse after all , it was to be given to [the Lighthouse keeper for [[his]67-mr. ramsay little boy]212-his little boy , who was threatened with a tuberculous hip ; together with a pile of old magazines , and some tobacco , indeed , whatever [she]65-mrs. ramsay could find lying about , not really wanted , but only littering [the room]213-the room , to give [those poor fellows , who must be bored to death sitting all day with nothing to do but polish the lamp and trim the wick]214-those poor fellows , who must be bored to death sitting all day with nothing to do but polish the lamp and trim the wick and rake about on [their]214-those poor fellows , who must be bored to death sitting all day with nothing to do but polish the lamp and trim the wick scrap of garden , something to amuse [them]214-those poor fellows , who must be bored to death sitting all day with nothing to do but polish the lamp and trim the wick]211-the lighthouse keeper for his little boy , who was threatened with a tuberculous hip ; together with a pile of old magazines , and some tobacco , indeed , whatever she could find lying about , not really wanted , but only littering the room , to give those poor fellows , who must be bored to death sitting all day with nothing to do but polish the lamp and trim the wick and rake about on their scrap of garden , something to amuse them . For how would [you]215-you like to be shut up for a whole month at a time , and possibly more in stormy weather , upon a rock the size of a tennis lawn ? [she]65-mrs. ramsay would ask ; and to have no letters or newspapers , and to see [nobody]216-nobody ; if [you]215-you were married , not to see [[your]215-you wife]217-your wife , not to know how [[your]215-you children]218-your children were , - if [they]218-your children were ill , if [they]218-your children had fallen down and broken [their]218-your children legs or arms ; to see the same dreary waves breaking week after week , and then a dreadful storm coming , and the windows covered with spray , and birds dashed against the lamp , and [the whole place]219-the whole place rocking , and not be able to put [your]215-you nose out of doors for fear of being swept into [the sea]220-the sea ? How would [you]215-you like that ? [she]65-mrs. ramsay asked , addressing [herself]65-mrs. ramsay particularly to [[her]65-mrs. ramsay daughters]221-her daughters . So [she]65-mrs. ramsay added , rather differently , one must take [them]221-her daughters whatever comforts [one]222-one can .

" It 's due west , "[223-the atheist] said [the atheist]223-the atheist [Tansley]68-charles tansley , holding [his]68-charles tansley bony fingers spread so that the wind blew through [them]224-them , for [he]68-charles tansley was sharing [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay 's evening walk up and down , up and down [the terrace]225-the terrace . That is to say , the wind blew from the worst possible direction for landing at [the Lighthouse]210-the lighthouse . Yes , [he]68-charles tansley did say disagreeable things , [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay admitted ; it was odious of [him]68-charles tansley to rub this in , and make [James]66-james still more disappointed ; but at the same time , [she]65-mrs. ramsay would not let [them]227-they laugh at [him]68-charles tansley . " [The atheist]223-the atheist , "[227-they] [they]227-they called [him]68-charles tansley ; " [the little atheist]2703-the little atheist . "[69-rose] [Rose]69-rose mocked [him]68-charles tansley ; [Prue]70-prue mocked [him]68-charles tansley ; [Andrew]71-andrew , [Jasper]72-jasper , [Roger]73-roger mocked [him]68-charles tansley ; even [old Badger]74-old badger without a tooth in [his]74-old badger head had bit [him]68-charles tansley , for being as [Nancy]75-nancy put it [the hundred and tenth young man]228-the hundred and tenth young man to chase [them]227-they all the way up to [the Hebrides]229-the hebrides when it was ever so much nicer to be alone .

" Nonsense , "[65-mrs. ramsay] said [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay , with great severity . Apart from the habit of exaggeration which [they]227-they had from [her]65-mrs. ramsay , and from the implication which was true that [she]65-mrs. ramsay asked [too many people]230-too many people to stay , and had to lodge some in [the town]231-the town , [she]65-mrs. ramsay could not bear incivility to [[her]65-mrs. ramsay guests]232-her guests , to [young men in particular , who were poor as churchmice]233-young men in particular , who were poor as churchmice , " exceptionally able , "[234-her husband] [[her]65-mrs. ramsay husband]234-her husband said , [[his]234-her husband great admirers]235-his great admirers , and come [there]236-there for a holiday . Indeed , [she]65-mrs. ramsay had the whole of [the other sex]237-the other sex under [her]65-mrs. ramsay protection ; for reasons [she]65-mrs. ramsay could not explain , for [their]227-they chivalry and valour , for the fact that [they]227-they negotiated treaties , ruled [India]1-india , controlled finance ; finally for an attitude towards [herself]65-mrs. ramsay which [no woman]238-no woman could fail to feel or to find agreeable , something trustful , childlike , reverential ; which [an old woman]239-an old woman could take from [a young man without loss of dignity]240-a young man without loss of dignity , and woe betide [the girl]241-the girl - pray Heaven it was [none of [[her]239-an old woman daughters]221-her daughters]242-none of her daughters ! - [who did not feel the worth of it , and all that it]244-who did not feel the worth of it , and all that it implied , to the marrow of [her]239-an old woman bones !

[She]65-mrs. ramsay turned with severity upon [Nancy]75-nancy . [He]245-he had not chased [them]221-her daughters , [she]65-mrs. ramsay said . [He]245-he had been asked .

[They]221-her daughters must find a way out of it all . There might be some simpler way , some less laborious way , [she]65-mrs. ramsay sighed . When [she]65-mrs. ramsay looked in the glass and saw [her]65-mrs. ramsay hair grey , [her]65-mrs. ramsay cheek sunk , at fifty , [she]65-mrs. ramsay thought , possibly [she]65-mrs. ramsay might have managed things better - [[her]65-mrs. ramsay husband]234-her husband ; money ; [his]245-he books . But for [her]65-mrs. ramsay own part [she]65-mrs. ramsay would never for a single second regret [her]65-mrs. ramsay decision , evade difficulties , or slur over duties . [She]65-mrs. ramsay was now formidable to behold , and it was only in silence , looking up from [their]221-her daughters plates , after [she]65-mrs. ramsay had spoken so severely about [Charles Tansley]68-charles tansley , that [[her]65-mrs. ramsay daughters]221-her daughters , [Prue]70-prue , [Nancy]75-nancy , [Rose]69-rose - could sport with infidel ideas which [they]221-her daughters had brewed for [themselves]221-her daughters of a life different from [hers]65-mrs. ramsay ; in [Paris]2-paris , perhaps ; a wilder life ; not always taking care of [some man or other]248-some man or other ; for there was in all [their]221-her daughters minds a mute questioning of deference and chivalry , of [the Bank of [England]4-england]3-the bank of england and [the Indian Empire]249-the indian empire , of ringed fingers and lace , though to [them]221-her daughters all there was something in this of the essence of beauty , which called out the manliness in [their]221-her daughters girlish hearts , and made [them]221-her daughters , as [they]221-her daughters sat at table beneath [[their]221-her daughters mother]250-their mother 's eyes , honour [her]65-mrs. ramsay strange severity , [her]65-mrs. ramsay extreme courtesy , like [a queen]251-a queen 's raising from the mud to wash [a beggar]252-a beggar 's dirty foot , when [she]65-mrs. ramsay admonished [them]221-her daughters so very severely about [that wretched atheist who had chased [them]221-her daughters]253-that wretched atheist who had chased them - or , speaking accurately , been invited to stay with [them]221-her daughters - in [the Isle of [Skye]5-skye]254-the isle of skye .

" There 'll be no landing at [the Lighthouse]210-the lighthouse tomorrow , "[68-charles tansley] said [Charles Tansley]68-charles tansley , clapping [his]68-charles tansley hands together as [he]68-charles tansley stood at the window with [[her]65-mrs. ramsay husband]234-her husband . Surely , [he]68-charles tansley had said enough . [She]65-mrs. ramsay wished [they]256-they would both leave [her]65-mrs. ramsay and [James]66-james alone and go on talking . [She]65-mrs. ramsay looked at [him]68-charles tansley . [He]68-charles tansley was such [a miserable specimen]257-a miserable specimen , [the children]258-the children said , all humps and hollows . [He]68-charles tansley could n't play cricket ; [he]68-charles tansley poked ; [he]68-charles tansley shuffled . [He]68-charles tansley was [a sarcastic brute]259-a sarcastic brute , [Andrew]71-andrew said . [They]258-the children knew what [he]68-charles tansley liked best - to be for ever walking up and down , up and down , with [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay , and saying who had won this , who had won that , who was [a " first rate man]2705-a " first rate man "[2705-a " first rate man] at [Latin verses]6-latin verses , who was " brilliant but [I]2705-a " first rate man think fundamentally unsound , "[2705-a " first rate man] who was undoubtedly [the " ablest fellow in [Balliol]7-balliol , "[2705-a " first rate man] who had buried [his]68-charles tansley light temporarily at [Bristol]8-bristol or [Bedford]9-bedford]260-the " ablest fellow in balliol , " who had buried his light temporarily at bristol or bedford , but was bound to be heard of later when [his]68-charles tansley Prolegomena , of which [Mr. Tansley]76-mr. tansley had the first pages in proof with [him]76-mr. tansley if [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay would like to see [them]261-them , to some branch of mathematics or philosophy saw the light of day . That was what [they]258-the children talked about .

[She]262-she could not help laughing [herself]262-she sometimes . [She]262-she said , the other day , something about " waves mountains high . "[262-she] Yes , said [Charles Tansley]68-charles tansley , it was a little rough . " Are n't [you]76-mr. tansley drenched to the skin ? "[262-she] [she]262-she had said . " Damp , not wet through , "[76-mr. tansley] said [Mr. Tansley]76-mr. tansley , pinching [his]76-mr. tansley sleeve , feeling [his]76-mr. tansley socks .

But it was not that [they]258-the children minded , [the children]258-the children said . It was not [his]76-mr. tansley face ; it was not [his]76-mr. tansley manners . It was [him]76-mr. tansley - [his]76-mr. tansley point of view . When [they]258-the children talked about something interesting , [people]264-people , music , history , anything , even said it was a fine evening so why not sit out of doors , then what [they]258-the children complained of about [Charles Tansley]68-charles tansley was that until [he]68-charles tansley had turned the whole thing round and made it somehow reflect [himself]68-charles tansley and disparage [them]258-the children - [he]68-charles tansley was not satisfied . And [he]68-charles tansley would go to picture galleries [they]258-the children said , and [he]68-charles tansley would ask [one]222-one , did one like [his]68-charles tansley tie ? God knows , said [Rose]69-rose , [one]222-one did not .

Disappearing as stealthily as stags from the dinner - table directly the meal was over , [the eight sons and daughters of [Mr.]268-mr. and [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay]267-the eight sons and daughters of mr. and mrs. ramsay sought [[their]267-the eight sons and daughters of mr. and mrs. ramsay bedrooms]269-their bedrooms , [their]267-the eight sons and daughters of mr. and mrs. ramsay fastness in [a house where there was no other privacy to debate anything]270-a house where there was no other privacy to debate anything , everything ; [Tansley]68-charles tansley 's tie ; the passing of the Reform Bill ; sea birds and butterflies ; [people]264-people ; while the sun poured into [those attics]272-those attics , which a plank alone separated from each other so that every footstep could be plainly heard and [the Swiss girl]273-the swiss girl sobbing for [[[her]273-the swiss girl father]274-her father who was dying of cancer in [a valley of [the Grisons]10-the grisons]276-a valley of the grisons]275-her father who was dying of cancer in a valley of the grisons , and lit up bats , flannels , straw hats , ink - pots , paint - pots , beetles , and the skulls of small birds , while it drew from the long frilled strips of seaweed pinned to the wall a smell of salt and weeds , which was in the towels too , gritty with sand from bathing .

Strife , divisions , difference of opinion , prejudices twisted into the very fibre of being , oh , that [they]277-they should begin so early , [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay deplored . [They]277-they were so critical , [[her]65-mrs. ramsay children]278-her children . [They]277-they talked such nonsense . [She]65-mrs. ramsay went from [the dining - room]279-the dining - room , holding [James]66-james by the hand , since [he]66-james would not go with [the others]280-the others . It seemed to [her]65-mrs. ramsay such nonsense - inventing differences , when [people]264-people , heaven knows , were different enough without that . The real differences , [she]65-mrs. ramsay thought , standing by the drawing - room window , are enough , quite enough . [She]65-mrs. ramsay had in mind at the moment , rich and poor , high and low ; the great in birth receiving from [her]65-mrs. ramsay , half grudging , some respect , for had [she]65-mrs. ramsay not in [her]65-mrs. ramsay veins the blood of [that very noble , if slightly mythical , Italian house]282-that very noble , if slightly mythical , italian house , whose daughters , scattered about [English drawing - rooms in the nineteenth century]283-english drawing - rooms in the nineteenth century , had lisped so charmingly , had stormed so wildly , and all [her]65-mrs. ramsay wit and [her]65-mrs. ramsay bearing and [her]65-mrs. ramsay temper came from [them]277-they , and not from the sluggish English , or the cold Scotch ; but more profoundly , [she]65-mrs. ramsay ruminated the other problem , of [rich and poor]284-rich and poor , and the things [she]65-mrs. ramsay saw with [her]65-mrs. ramsay own eyes , weekly , daily , here or in [London]11-london , when [she]65-mrs. ramsay visited [this widow]285-this widow , or [that struggling wife in person with a bag on [her]65-mrs. ramsay arm]286-that struggling wife in person with a bag on her arm , and a note - book and pencil with which [she]65-mrs. ramsay wrote down in columns carefully ruled for the purpose wages and spendings , employment and unemployment , in the hope that thus [she]65-mrs. ramsay would cease to be [a private woman whose charity was half a sop to [her]65-mrs. ramsay own indignation]287-a private woman whose charity was half a sop to her own indignation , half a relief to [her]65-mrs. ramsay own curiosity , and become what with [her]65-mrs. ramsay untrained mind [she]65-mrs. ramsay greatly admired , [an investigator]288-an investigator , elucidating the social problem .

Insoluble questions [they]289-they were , it seemed to [her]65-mrs. ramsay , standing there , holding [James]66-james by the hand . [He]66-james had followed [her]65-mrs. ramsay into [the drawing - room]200-the drawing - room , [that young man]291-that young man [they]292-they laughed at ; [he]66-james was standing by the table , fidgeting with something , awkwardly , feeling [himself]66-james out of things , as [she]65-mrs. ramsay knew without looking round . [They]289-they had all gone - [the children]258-the children ; [Minta Doyle]77-minta and [Paul Rayley]78-paul ; [Augustus Carmichael]79-augustus carmichael ; [[her]65-mrs. ramsay husband]234-her husband - [they]289-they had all gone . So [she]65-mrs. ramsay turned with a sigh and said , " Would it bore [you]234-her husband to come with [me]65-mrs. ramsay , [Mr. Tansley]76-mr. tansley ? "[65-mrs. ramsay]

[She]65-mrs. ramsay had a dull errand in [the town]231-the town ; [she]65-mrs. ramsay had a letter or two to write ; [she]65-mrs. ramsay would be ten minutes perhaps ; [she]65-mrs. ramsay would put on [her]65-mrs. ramsay hat . And , with [her]65-mrs. ramsay basket and [her]65-mrs. ramsay parasol , there [she]65-mrs. ramsay was again , ten minutes later , giving out a sense of being ready , of being equipped for a jaunt , which , however , [she]65-mrs. ramsay must interrupt for a moment , as [they]296-they passed [the tennis lawn]297-the tennis lawn , to ask [Mr. Carmichael]80-mr. carmichael , who was basking with [his]80-mr. carmichael yellow cat 's eyes ajar , so that like a cat 's they seemed to reflect the branches moving or the clouds passing , but to give no inkling of any inner thoughts or emotion whatsoever , if [he]80-mr. carmichael wanted anything .

For [they]296-they were making the great expedition , [she]65-mrs. ramsay said , laughing . [They]296-they were going to [the town]231-the town . " Stamps , writing - paper , tobacco ? "[65-mrs. ramsay] [she]65-mrs. ramsay suggested , stopping by [his]80-mr. carmichael side . But no , [he]80-mr. carmichael wanted nothing . [His]80-mr. carmichael hands clasped themselves over [his]80-mr. carmichael capacious paunch , [his]80-mr. carmichael eyes blinked , as if [he]80-mr. carmichael would have liked to reply kindly to these blandishments [she]65-mrs. ramsay was seductive but a little nervous but could not , sunk as [he]80-mr. carmichael was in a grey - green somnolence which embraced [them]296-they all , without need of words , in a vast and benevolent lethargy of well - wishing ; all [the house]299-the house ; all [the world]300-the world ; [all the people in]301-all the people in [it]299-the house , for [he]80-mr. carmichael had slipped into [his]80-mr. carmichael glass at lunch a few drops of something , which accounted , [the children]258-the children thought , for the vivid streak of canary - yellow in moustache and beard that were otherwise milk white . No , nothing , [he]80-mr. carmichael murmured .

[He]80-mr. carmichael should have been [a great philosopher]303-a great philosopher , said [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay , as [they]304-they went down [the road]305-the road to [the fishing village]306-the fishing village , but [he]80-mr. carmichael had made an unfortunate marriage . Holding [her]65-mrs. ramsay black parasol very erect , and moving with an indescribable air of expectation , as if [she]65-mrs. ramsay were going to meet [some one round the corner]307-some one round the corner , [she]65-mrs. ramsay told the story ; an affair at [Oxford]12-oxford with [some girl]308-some girl ; an early marriage ; poverty ; going to [India]1-india ; translating a little poetry " very beautifully , [I]65-mrs. ramsay believe , "[65-mrs. ramsay] being willing to teach [the boys]309-the boys Persian or [Hindustanee]81-hindustanee , but what really was the use of that ? - and then lying , as [they]258-the children saw [him]80-mr. carmichael , on [the lawn]310-the lawn .

It flattered [him]80-mr. carmichael ; snubbed as [he]80-mr. carmichael had been , it soothed [him]80-mr. carmichael that [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay should tell [him]80-mr. carmichael this . [Charles Tansley]68-charles tansley revived . Insinuating , too , as [she]65-mrs. ramsay did the greatness of [man]311-man 's intellect , even in its decay , the subjection of [all wives]312-all wives - not that [she]65-mrs. ramsay blamed [the girl]241-the girl , and the marriage had been happy enough , [she]65-mrs. ramsay believed - to [[their]258-the children husband]314-their husband 's labours , [she]65-mrs. ramsay made [him]80-mr. carmichael feel better pleased with [himself]80-mr. carmichael than [he]80-mr. carmichael had done yet , and [he]80-mr. carmichael would have liked , had [they]258-the children taken [a cab]315-a cab , for example , to have paid the fare . As for [her]65-mrs. ramsay little bag , might [he]80-mr. carmichael not carry that ? No , no , [she]65-mrs. ramsay said , [she]65-mrs. ramsay always carried THAT [herself]65-mrs. ramsay . [She]65-mrs. ramsay did too . Yes , [he]80-mr. carmichael felt that in [her]65-mrs. ramsay . [He]80-mr. carmichael would like [her]65-mrs. ramsay to see [him]80-mr. carmichael , gowned and hooded , walking in a procession . [A fellowship]316-a fellowship , [a professorship]317-a professorship , [he]80-mr. carmichael felt capable of anything and saw [himself]80-mr. carmichael - but what was [she]65-mrs. ramsay looking at ? At [a man pasting a bill]318-a man pasting a bill . The vast flapping sheet flattened itself out , and each shove of the brush revealed fresh legs , hoops , horses , glistening reds and blues , beautifully smooth , until half the wall was covered with the advertisement of [a circus]319-a circus ; [a hundred horsemen]320-a hundred horsemen , twenty performing seals , lions , tigers ... " Let [us]2707-us all go ! "[65-mrs. ramsay] [she]65-mrs. ramsay cried , moving on , as if [all those riders]322-all those riders and horses had filled [her]65-mrs. ramsay with childlike exultation and made [her]65-mrs. ramsay forget [her]65-mrs. ramsay pity .

" Let [us]2707-us all go to [the circus]2708-the circus . "[80-mr. carmichael] No . [He]80-mr. carmichael could not say it right . [He]80-mr. carmichael could not feel it right . But why not ? "[80-mr. carmichael] [He]80-mr. carmichael [himself]80-mr. carmichael had paid [his]80-mr. carmichael own way since [he]80-mr. carmichael was thirteen . "[65-mrs. ramsay] For the great plateful of blue water was before [her]65-mrs. ramsay ; [the hoary Lighthouse]356-the hoary lighthouse , distant , austere , in the midst ; and on the right , as far as the eye could see , fading and falling , in soft low pleats , the green sand dunes with the wild flowing grasses on them , which always seemed to be running away into [some moon country]357-some moon country , uninhabited of [men]358-men .

That was the view , [she]65-mrs. ramsay said , stopping , growing greyer - eyed , that [[her]65-mrs. ramsay husband]234-her husband loved .

[She]65-mrs. ramsay paused a moment . But now , [she]65-mrs. ramsay said , [artists]360-artists had come [here]361-here . Since [Mr. Paunceforte]83-mr. paunceforte had been [there]236-there , three years before , all the pictures were like that , [she]65-mrs. ramsay said , green and grey , with lemon - coloured [sailing - boats]364-sailing - boats , and [pink women on [the beach]366-the beach]365-pink women on the beach .

But [[her]65-mrs. ramsay grandmother 's friends]367-her grandmother 's friends , [she]65-mrs. ramsay said , glancing discreetly as [they]367-her grandmother 's friends passed , took the greatest pains ; first [they]367-her grandmother 's friends mixed [their]367-her grandmother 's friends own colours , and then [they]367-her grandmother 's friends ground them , and then [they]367-her grandmother 's friends put damp cloths to keep them moist .

So [Mr. Tansley]76-mr. tansley supposed [she]65-mrs. ramsay meant [him]76-mr. tansley to see that [that man]368-that man 's picture was skimpy , was that what [one]222-one said ? Under the influence of that extraordinary emotion which had been growing all the walk , had begun in [the garden]371-the garden when [he]76-mr. tansley had wanted to take [her]65-mrs. ramsay bag , had increased in [the town]231-the town when [he]76-mr. tansley had wanted to tell [her]65-mrs. ramsay everything about [himself]76-mr. tansley , [he]76-mr. tansley was coming to see [himself]76-mr. tansley , and everything [he]76-mr. tansley had ever known gone crooked a little . It was awfully strange .

There [he]76-mr. tansley stood in [the parlour of [the poky little house where [she]65-mrs. ramsay had taken [him]76-mr. tansley]374-the poky little house where she had taken him , waiting for [her]65-mrs. ramsay]373-the parlour of the poky little house where she had taken him , waiting for her , while [she]65-mrs. ramsay went [upstairs]375-upstairs a moment to see [a woman]376-a woman . [She]65-mrs. ramsay was fifty at least ; [she]65-mrs. ramsay had [eight children]383-eight children . " Perhaps [you]234-her husband will wake up and find the sun shining and the birds singing , "[65-mrs. ramsay] [she]65-mrs. ramsay said compassionately , smoothing [the little boy]390-the little boy 's hair , for [[her]65-mrs. ramsay husband]234-her husband , with [his]234-her husband caustic saying that it would not be fine , had dashed [his]234-her husband spirits [she]65-mrs. ramsay could see . This going to [the Lighthouse]210-the lighthouse was a passion of [his]234-her husband , [she]65-mrs. ramsay saw , and then , as if [[her]65-mrs. ramsay husband]234-her husband had not said enough , with [his]234-her husband caustic saying that it would not be fine tomorrow , [this odious little man]394-this odious little man went and rubbed it in all over again .

" Perhaps it will be fine tomorrow , "[65-mrs. ramsay] [she]65-mrs. ramsay said , smoothing [his]234-her husband hair .

All [she]65-mrs. ramsay could do now was to admire the refrigerator , and turn the pages of the Stores list in the hope that [she]65-mrs. ramsay might come upon something like a rake , or a mowing - machine , which , with its prongs and its handles , would need the greatest skill and care in cutting out . [All these young men]395-all these young men parodied [[her]65-mrs. ramsay husband]234-her husband , [she]65-mrs. ramsay reflected ; [he]234-her husband said it would rain ; [they]395-all these young men said it would be a positive tornado .

But here , as [she]65-mrs. ramsay turned the page , suddenly [her]65-mrs. ramsay search for the picture of a rake or a mowing - machine was interrupted . The gruff murmur , irregularly broken by the taking out of pipes and the putting in of pipes which had kept on assuring [her]65-mrs. ramsay , though [she]65-mrs. ramsay could not hear what was said as [she]65-mrs. ramsay sat in the window which opened on [the terrace]225-the terrace , that [the men]398-the men were happily talking ; this sound , which had lasted now half an hour and had taken its place soothingly in the scale of sounds pressing on top of [her]65-mrs. ramsay , such as the tap of balls upon bats , the sharp , sudden bark now and then , " How 's that ? How 's that ? "[258-the children] of [the children]258-the children playing cricket , had ceased ; so that the monotonous fall of the waves on [the beach]366-the beach , which for the most part beat a measured and soothing tattoo to [her]65-mrs. ramsay thoughts and seemed consolingly to repeat over and over again as [she]65-mrs. ramsay sat with [the children]258-the children the words of some old cradle song , murmured by nature , " [I]258-the children am guarding [you]258-the children - [I]258-the children am [your]258-the children support , "[258-the children] but at other times suddenly and unexpectedly , especially when [her]65-mrs. ramsay mind raised itself slightly from the task actually in hand , had no such kindly meaning , but like a ghostly roll of drums remorselessly beat the measure of life , made one think of the destruction of [the island]402-the island and [its]402-the island engulfment in [the sea]220-the sea , and warned [her]65-mrs. ramsay whose day had slipped past in one quick doing after another that it was all ephemeral as a rainbow - this sound which had been obscured and concealed under the other sounds suddenly thundered hollow in [her]65-mrs. ramsay ears and made [her]65-mrs. ramsay look up with an impulse of terror .

[They]398-the men had ceased to talk ; that was the explanation . Falling in one second from the tension which had gripped [her]65-mrs. ramsay to the other extreme which , as if to recoup [her]65-mrs. ramsay for [her]65-mrs. ramsay unnecessary expense of emotion , was cool , amused , and even faintly malicious , [she]65-mrs. ramsay concluded that poor [Charles Tansley]68-charles tansley had been shed . That was of little account to [her]65-mrs. ramsay . If [[her]65-mrs. ramsay husband]234-her husband required sacrifices and indeed [he]234-her husband did [she]65-mrs. ramsay cheerfully offered up to [him]234-her husband [Charles Tansley]68-charles tansley , who had snubbed [[her]65-mrs. ramsay little boy]405-her little boy .

One moment more , with [her]65-mrs. ramsay head raised , [she]65-mrs. ramsay listened , as if [she]65-mrs. ramsay waited for some habitual sound , some regular mechanical sound ; and then , hearing something rhythmical , half said , half chanted , beginning in [the garden]371-the garden , as [[her]65-mrs. ramsay husband]234-her husband beat up and down [the terrace]225-the terrace , something between a croak and a song , [she]65-mrs. ramsay was soothed once more , assured again that all was well , and looking down at the book on [her]65-mrs. ramsay knee found the picture of a pocket knife with six blades which could only be cut out if [James]66-james was very careful .

Suddenly a loud cry , as of [a sleep - walker , half roused , something about

Stormed at with shot and shell

sung out]409-a sleep - walker , half roused , something about stormed at with shot and shell sung out with the utmost intensity in [her]65-mrs. ramsay ear , made [her]65-mrs. ramsay turn apprehensively to see if [anyone]410-anyone had heard [him]66-james . Only [Lily Briscoe]86-lily , [she]65-mrs. ramsay was glad to find ; and that did not matter . But the sight of [the girl standing on the edge of the lawn painting]411-the girl standing on the edge of the lawn painting reminded [her]65-mrs. ramsay ; [she]65-mrs. ramsay was supposed to be keeping [her]65-mrs. ramsay head as much in the same position as possible for [Lily]86-lily 's picture . [Lily]86-lily 's picture ! [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay smiled . With [her]65-mrs. ramsay little Chinese eyes and [her]65-mrs. ramsay puckered - up face , [she]65-mrs. ramsay would never marry ; [one]222-one could not take [her]65-mrs. ramsay painting very seriously ; [she]65-mrs. ramsay was [an independent little creature]413-an independent little creature , and [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay liked [her]65-mrs. ramsay for it ; so , remembering [her]65-mrs. ramsay promise , [she]65-mrs. ramsay bent [her]65-mrs. ramsay head .

4

Indeed , [he]414-he almost knocked [her]65-mrs. ramsay easel over , coming down upon [her]65-mrs. ramsay with [his]414-he hands waving shouting out , " Boldly [we]2713-we rode and well , "[414-he] but , mercifully , [he]414-he turned sharp , and rode off , to die gloriously [she]65-mrs. ramsay supposed upon [the heights of [Balaclava]14-balaclava]415-the heights of balaclava . Never was [anybody]416-anybody at once so ridiculous and so alarming . But so long as [he]414-he kept like that , waving , shouting , [she]65-mrs. ramsay was safe ; [he]414-he would not stand still and look at [her]65-mrs. ramsay picture . And that was what [Lily Briscoe]86-lily could not have endured . Even while [she]65-mrs. ramsay looked at the mass , at the line , at the colour , at [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay sitting in the window with [James]66-james , [she]65-mrs. ramsay kept a feeler on [her]65-mrs. ramsay surroundings lest [some one]386-some one should creep up , and suddenly [she]65-mrs. ramsay should find [her]65-mrs. ramsay picture looked at . But now , with all [her]65-mrs. ramsay senses quickened as they were , looking , straining , till the colour of the wall and the jacmanna beyond burnt into [her]65-mrs. ramsay eyes , [she]65-mrs. ramsay was aware of [someone]418-someone coming out of [the house]299-the house , coming towards [her]65-mrs. ramsay ; but somehow divined , from the footfall , [William Bankes]87-william bankes , so that though [her]65-mrs. ramsay brush quivered , [she]65-mrs. ramsay did not , as [she]65-mrs. ramsay would have done had it been [Mr. Tansley]76-mr. tansley , [Paul Rayley]78-paul , [Minta Doyle]77-minta , or practically [anybody else]420-anybody else , turn [her]65-mrs. ramsay canvas upon the grass , but let it stand . [William Bankes]87-william bankes stood beside [her]65-mrs. ramsay .

[They]421-they had [rooms in [the village]423-the village]422-rooms in the village , and so , walking in , walking out , parting late on door - mats , had said little things about the soup , about [the children]258-the children , about one thing and another which made [them]421-they allies ; so that when [he]87-william bankes stood beside [her]65-mrs. ramsay now in [his]87-william bankes judicial way [he]87-william bankes was old enough to be [[her]65-mrs. ramsay father]274-her father too , [a botanist]426-a botanist , [a widower , smelling of soap]427-a widower , smelling of soap , very scrupulous and clean [she]65-mrs. ramsay just stood there . [He]87-william bankes just stood there . [Her]65-mrs. ramsay shoes were excellent , [he]87-william bankes observed . [They]428-they allowed the toes [their]428-they natural expansion . Lodging in [the same house]429-the same house with [her]65-mrs. ramsay , [he]87-william bankes had noticed too , how orderly [she]65-mrs. ramsay was , up before breakfast and off to paint , [he]87-william bankes believed , alone : poor , presumably , and without the complexion or the allurement of [Miss Doyle]88-miss doyle certainly , but with a good sense which made [her]65-mrs. ramsay in [his]87-william bankes eyes superior to [that young lady]430-that young lady . Now , for instance , when [Ramsay]66-james bore down on [them]431-them , shouting , gesticulating , [Miss Briscoe]89-miss briscoe , [he]66-james felt certain , understood .

[Some one]386-some one had blundered .

[Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay glared at [them]431-them . [He]66-james glared at [them]431-them without seeming to see [them]431-them . That did make [them]431-them both vaguely uncomfortable . Together [they]431-them had seen a thing [they]431-them had not been meant to see . [They]431-them had encroached upon a privacy . So , [Lily]86-lily thought , it was probably an excuse of [his]87-william bankes for moving , for getting out of earshot , that made [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes almost immediately say something about its being chilly and suggested taking a stroll . [She]86-lily would come , yes . But it was with difficulty that [she]86-lily took [her]86-lily eyes off [her]86-lily picture .

The jacmanna was bright violet ; the wall staring white . [She]86-lily would not have considered it honest to tamper with the bright violet and the staring white , since [she]86-lily saw [them]433-them like that , fashionable though it was , since [Mr. Paunceforte]83-mr. paunceforte 's visit , to see everything pale , elegant , semitransparent . Then beneath the colour there was the shape . [She]86-lily could see it all so clearly , so commandingly , when [she]86-lily looked : it was when [she]86-lily took [her]86-lily brush in hand that the whole thing changed . It was in that moment 's flight between the picture and [her]86-lily canvas that the demons set on [her]86-lily who often brought [her]86-lily to the verge of tears and made this passage from conception to work as dreadful as any down a dark passage for [a child]381-a child . Such [she]86-lily often felt [herself]86-lily - struggling against terrific odds to maintain [her]86-lily courage ; to say : " But this is what [I]86-lily see ; this is what [I]86-lily see , "[86-lily] and so to clasp some miserable remnant of [her]86-lily vision to [her]86-lily breast , which a thousand forces did [their]435-their best to pluck from [her]86-lily . And it was then too , in that chill and windy way , as [she]86-lily began to paint , that there forced [themselves]436-themselves upon [her]86-lily other things , [her]86-lily own inadequacy , [her]86-lily insignificance , keeping house for [[her]86-lily father]274-her father off [the Brompton Road]438-the brompton road , and had much ado to control [her]86-lily impulse to fling [herself]86-lily thank Heaven [she]86-lily had always resisted so far at [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay 's knee and say to [her]86-lily - but what could [one]222-one say to [her]86-lily ? " [I]222-one 'm in love with [you]86-lily ? "[222-one] No , that was not true . " [I]86-lily 'm in love with this all , "[86-lily] waving [her]86-lily hand at the hedge , at [the house]299-the house , at [the children]258-the children . It was absurd , it was impossible . So now [she]86-lily laid [her]86-lily brushes neatly in the box , side by side , and said to [William Bankes]87-william bankes :

" It suddenly gets cold . The sun seems to give less heat , "[86-lily] [she]86-lily said , looking about [her]86-lily , for it was bright enough , the grass still a soft deep green , [the house]299-the house starred in [its]299-the house greenery with purple passion flowers , and rooks dropping cool cries from the high blue . But something moved , flashed , turned a silver wing in the air . It was September after all , the middle of September , and past six in the evening . So off [they]443-they strolled down [the garden]371-the garden in the usual direction , past [the tennis lawn]297-the tennis lawn , past the pampas grass , to that break in the thick hedge , guarded by red hot pokers like brasiers of clear burning coal , between which the blue waters of [the bay]446-the bay looked bluer than ever .

[They]443-they came [there]236-there regularly every evening drawn by some need . It was as if the water floated off and set sailing thoughts which had grown stagnant on [dry land]448-dry land , and gave to [their]443-they bodies even some sort of physical relief . First , the pulse of colour flooded [the bay]446-the bay with blue , and the heart expanded with it and the body swam , only the next instant to be checked and chilled by the prickly blackness on the ruffled waves . Then , up behind the great black rock , almost every evening spurted irregularly , so that [one]222-one had to watch for it and it was a delight when it came , a fountain of white water ; and then , while [one]222-one waited for that , [one]222-one watched , on [the pale semicircular beach]453-the pale semicircular beach , wave after wave shedding again and again smoothly , a film of mother of pearl .

[They]443-they both smiled , standing there . [They]443-they both felt a common hilarity , excited by the moving waves ; and then by the swift cutting race of [a sailing boat]454-a sailing boat , which , having sliced a curve in [the bay]446-the bay , stopped ; shivered ; let its sails drop down ; and then , with a natural instinct to complete the picture , after this swift movement , [both of [them]443-they]456-both of them looked at [the dunes far away]457-the dunes far away , and instead of merriment felt come over [them]443-they some sadness - because the thing was completed partly , and partly because distant views seem to outlast by a million years [Lily]86-lily thought [the gazer]458-the gazer and to be communing already with a sky which beholds [an earth entirely at rest]459-an earth entirely at rest .

Looking at [the far sand hills]460-the far sand hills , [William Bankes]87-william bankes thought of [Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay : thought of [a road in [Westmorland]15-westmorland]461-a road in westmorland , thought of [Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay striding along [a road]462-a road by [himself]67-mr. ramsay hung round with that solitude which seemed to be [his]67-mr. ramsay natural air . But this was suddenly interrupted , [William Bankes]87-william bankes remembered and this must refer to some actual incident , by a hen , straddling [her]463-her wings out in protection of a covey of little chicks , upon which [Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay , stopping , pointed [his]67-mr. ramsay stick and said " Pretty - pretty , "[67-mr. ramsay] an odd illumination in to [his]87-william bankes heart , [Bankes]87-william bankes had thought it , which showed [his]87-william bankes simplicity , [his]87-william bankes sympathy with humble things ; but it seemed to [him]87-william bankes as if [their]464-their friendship had ceased , there , on [that stretch of road]465-that stretch of road . After that , [Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay had married . After that , what with one thing and another , the pulp had gone out of [their]464-their friendship . Whose fault it was [he]87-william bankes could not say , only , after a time , repetition had taken the place of newness . It was to repeat that [they]464-their met . But in this dumb colloquy with [the sand dunes]466-the sand dunes [he]87-william bankes maintained that [his]87-william bankes affection for [Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay had in no way diminished ; but there , like the body of [a young man laid up in peat for a century]467-a young man laid up in peat for a century , with the red fresh on [his]467-a young man laid up in peat for a century lips , was [his]87-william bankes friendship , in its acuteness and reality , laid up across [the bay]446-the bay among [the sandhills]469-the sandhills .

[He]87-william bankes was anxious for the sake of this friendship and perhaps too in order to clear [himself]87-william bankes in [his]87-william bankes own mind from the imputation of having dried and shrunk - for [Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay lived in a welter of [children]325-children , whereas [Bankes]87-william bankes was childless and [a widower]471-a widower - [he]87-william bankes was anxious that [Lily Briscoe]86-lily should not disparage [Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay [a great man in [his]87-william bankes own way]472-a great man in his own way yet should understand how things stood between [them]473-their . Begun long years ago , [their]473-their friendship had petered out on [a Westmorland road]474-a westmorland road , where the hen spread [her]475-her wings before [[her]475-her chicks]476-her chicks ; after which [Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay had married , and [their]473-their paths lying different ways , there had been , certainly for [no one]477-no one 's fault , some tendency , when [they]473-their met , to repeat .

Yes . That was it . [He]87-william bankes finished . [He]87-william bankes turned from the view . And , turning to walk back the other way , up [the drive]478-the drive , [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes was alive to things which would not have struck [him]90-mr. bankes had not [those sandhills]479-those sandhills revealed to [him]90-mr. bankes the body of [his]90-mr. bankes friendship lying with the red on its lips laid up in peat - for instance , [Cam]91-cam , [the little girl]480-the little girl , [[Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay 's youngest daughter]481-ramsay 's youngest daughter . [She]91-cam was picking [Sweet Alice]85-elsie on [the bank]482-the bank . [She]91-cam was wild and fierce . [She]91-cam would not " give a flower to [the gentleman]2714-the gentleman "[483-the nursemaid] as [the nursemaid]483-the nursemaid told [her]91-cam . No ! no ! no ! [she]91-cam would not ! [She]91-cam clenched [her]91-cam fist . [She]91-cam stamped . And [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes felt aged and saddened and somehow put into the wrong by [her]91-cam about [his]90-mr. bankes friendship . [He]90-mr. bankes must have dried and shrunk .

[The Ramsays]82-the ramsays were not rich , and it was a wonder how [they]82-the ramsays managed to contrive it all . [Eight children]383-eight children ! To feed [eight children]383-eight children on philosophy ! Here was another of [them]82-the ramsays , [Jasper]72-jasper this time , strolling past , to have a shot at a bird , [he]90-mr. bankes said , nonchalantly , swinging [Lily]86-lily 's hand like a pump - handle as [he]90-mr. bankes passed , which caused [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes to say , bitterly , how [SHE]86-lily was a favourite . [He]90-mr. bankes called [them]82-the ramsays privately after [the Kings and Queens of [England]4-england]487-the kings and queens of england ; [Cam the Wicked]92-cam the wicked , [James the Ruthless]93-james , [Andrew the Just]71-andrew , [Prue the Fair]94-prue - for [Prue]94-prue would have beauty , [he]90-mr. bankes thought , how could [she]94-prue help it ? - and [Andrew]71-andrew brains . [They]82-the ramsays gave [him]90-mr. bankes something - [William Bankes]87-william bankes acknowledged that ; it would have been pleasant if [Cam]91-cam had stuck a flower in [his]90-mr. bankes coat or clambered over [his]90-mr. bankes shoulder , as over [[her]91-cam father]274-her father 's , to look at a picture of [Vesuvius]16-vesuvius in eruption ; but [they]82-the ramsays had also , [[his]90-mr. bankes old friends]491-his old friends could not but feel , destroyed something . What would [a stranger]492-a stranger think now ? What did [this Lily Briscoe]86-lily think ? Could one help noticing that habits grew on [him]90-mr. bankes ? eccentricities , weaknesses perhaps ? It was astonishing that [a man of [his]90-mr. bankes intellect]493-a man of his intellect could stoop so low as [he]90-mr. bankes did - but that was too harsh a phrase - could depend so much as [he]90-mr. bankes did upon [people]264-people 's praise .

" Oh , but , "[86-lily] said [Lily]86-lily , " think of [his]90-mr. bankes work ! "[86-lily]

Whenever [she]86-lily " thought of [his]90-mr. bankes work "[86-lily] [she]86-lily always saw clearly before [her]86-lily a large kitchen table . It was [Andrew]71-andrew 's doing . [She]86-lily asked [him]90-mr. bankes what [[his]90-mr. bankes father]199-his father 's books were about . " Subject and object and the nature of reality , "[71-andrew] [Andrew]71-andrew had said . And when [she]86-lily said [Heavens]95-heavens , [she]86-lily had no notion what that meant . " Think of a kitchen table then , "[90-mr. bankes] [he]90-mr. bankes told [her]86-lily , " when [you]86-lily 're not [there]236-there . "[90-mr. bankes]

So now [she]86-lily always saw , when [she]86-lily thought of [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay 's work , a scrubbed kitchen table . It lodged now in the fork of a pear tree , for [they]496-they had reached [the orchard]497-the orchard . And with a painful effort of concentration , [she]86-lily focused [her]86-lily mind , not upon the silver - bossed bark of the tree , or upon its fish - shaped leaves , but upon a phantom kitchen table , one of those scrubbed board tables , grained and knotted , whose virtue seems to have been laid bare by years of muscular integrity , which stuck there , its four legs in air . Naturally , if [one]222-one 's days were passed in this seeing of angular essences , this reducing of lovely evenings , with all their flamingo clouds and blue and silver to a white deal four - legged table and it was a mark of [the finest minds to do so]499-the finest minds to do so , naturally one could not be judged like [an ordinary person]500-an ordinary person .

[Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes liked [her]86-lily for bidding [him]90-mr. bankes " think of [his]90-mr. bankes work . "[90-mr. bankes] [He]90-mr. bankes had thought of it , often and often . Times without number , [he]90-mr. bankes had said , " [Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay is one of [those men who do [their]2717-those men who do their best work before they are forty best work before [they]2717-those men who do their best work before they are forty are forty]2717-those men who do their best work before they are forty . "[90-mr. bankes] [He]90-mr. bankes had made a definite contribution to philosophy in one little book when [he]90-mr. bankes was only five and twenty ; what came after was more or less amplification , repetition . But the number of [men who make a definite contribution to anything whatsoever]501-men who make a definite contribution to anything whatsoever is very small , [he]90-mr. bankes said , pausing by the pear tree , well brushed , scrupulously exact , exquisitely judicial . Suddenly , as if the movement of [his]90-mr. bankes hand had released it , the load of [her]86-lily accumulated impressions of [him]90-mr. bankes tilted up , and down poured in a ponderous avalanche all [she]86-lily felt about [him]90-mr. bankes . That was one sensation . Then up rose in a fume the essence of [his]90-mr. bankes being . That was another . [She]86-lily felt [herself]86-lily transfixed by the intensity of [her]86-lily perception ; it was [his]90-mr. bankes severity ; [his]90-mr. bankes goodness . [I]0-i respect [you]90-mr. bankes [she]86-lily addressed silently [him]90-mr. bankes in person in every atom ; [you]90-mr. bankes are not vain ; [you]90-mr. bankes are entirely impersonal ; [you]90-mr. bankes are finer than [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay ; [you]90-mr. bankes are [the finest human being]502-the finest human being that [I]0-i know ; [you]90-mr. bankes have [neither wife]503-neither wife nor [child]504-child without any sexual feeling , [she]86-lily longed to cherish that loneliness , [you]90-mr. bankes live for science involuntarily , sections of potatoes rose before [her]86-lily eyes ; praise would be an insult to [you]90-mr. bankes ; [generous , pure - hearted , heroic man]505-generous , pure - hearted , heroic man ! But simultaneously , [she]86-lily remembered how [he]67-mr. ramsay had brought [a valet]506-a valet all the way up [here]361-here ; objected to dogs on chairs ; would prose for hours until [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay slammed out of [the room]213-the room about salt in vegetables and the iniquity of [English cooks]509-english cooks .

How then did it work out , all this ? How did [one]222-one judge [people]264-people , think of [them]264-people ? How did [one]222-one add up this and that and conclude that it was liking [one]222-one felt or disliking ? And to those words , what meaning attached , after all ? Standing now , apparently transfixed , by the pear tree , impressions poured in upon [her]86-lily of [those two men]514-those two men , and to follow [her]86-lily thought was like following a voice which speaks too quickly to be taken down by one 's pencil , and the voice was [her]86-lily own voice saying without prompting undeniable , everlasting , contradictory things , so that even the fissures and humps on the bark of the pear tree were irrevocably fixed there for eternity . [You]90-mr. bankes have greatness , [she]86-lily continued , but [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay has none of it . [He]67-mr. ramsay is petty , selfish , vain , egotistical ; [he]67-mr. ramsay is spoilt ; [he]67-mr. ramsay is [a tyrant]515-a tyrant ; [he]67-mr. ramsay wears [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay to death ; but [he]67-mr. ramsay has what [you]90-mr. bankes [she]86-lily addressed [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes have not ; a fiery unworldliness ; [he]90-mr. bankes knows nothing about trifles ; [he]90-mr. bankes loves dogs and [[his]90-mr. bankes children]202-his children . [He]90-mr. bankes has eight . [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes has none . Did [he]90-mr. bankes not come down in two coats the other night and let [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay trim [his]90-mr. bankes hair into a pudding basin ? All of this danced up and down , like a company of gnats , each separate but all marvellously controlled in an invisible elastic net - danced up and down in [Lily]86-lily 's mind , in and about the branches of the pear tree , where still hung in effigy the scrubbed kitchen table , symbol of [her]86-lily profound respect for [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay 's mind , until [her]86-lily thought which had spun quicker and quicker exploded of its own intensity ; [she]86-lily felt released ; a shot went off close at hand , and there came , flying from its fragments , frightened , effusive , tumultuous , a flock of starlings .

" [Jasper]72-jasper ! "[90-mr. bankes] said [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes . [They]517-they turned the way the starlings flew , over [the terrace]225-the terrace . Following the scatter of swift - flying birds in the sky [they]517-they stepped through the gap in the high hedge straight into [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay , who boomed tragically at [them]517-they , " [Some one]386-some one had blundered ! "[67-mr. ramsay]

[His]67-mr. ramsay eyes , glazed with emotion , defiant with tragic intensity , met [theirs]517-they for a second , and trembled on the verge of recognition ; but then , raising [his]67-mr. ramsay hand , half - way to [his]67-mr. ramsay face as if to avert , to brush off , in an agony of peevish shame , [their]517-they normal gaze , as if [he]67-mr. ramsay begged [them]517-they to withhold for a moment what [he]67-mr. ramsay knew to be inevitable , as if [he]67-mr. ramsay impressed upon [them]517-they [his]67-mr. ramsay own child - like resentment of interruption , yet even in the moment of discovery was not to be routed utterly , but was determined to hold fast to something of this delicious emotion , this impure rhapsody of which [he]67-mr. ramsay was ashamed , but in which [he]67-mr. ramsay revelled - [he]67-mr. ramsay turned abruptly , slammed [his]67-mr. ramsay private door on [them]517-they ; and , [Lily Briscoe]86-lily and [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes , looking uneasily up into the sky , observed that the flock of starlings which [Jasper]72-jasper had routed with [his]72-jasper gun had settled on the tops of the elm trees .

" And even if it is n't fine tomorrow , "[65-mrs. ramsay] said [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay , raising [her]65-mrs. ramsay eyes to glance at [William Bankes]87-william bankes and [Lily Briscoe]86-lily as [they]517-they passed , " it will be another day . And now , "[65-mrs. ramsay] [she]65-mrs. ramsay said , thinking that [Lily]86-lily 's charm was [her]86-lily Chinese eyes , aslant in [her]86-lily white , puckered little face , but it would take [a clever man]519-a clever man to see it , " and now stand up , and let [me]519-a clever man measure [your]93-james leg , "[519-a clever man] for [they]517-they might go to [the Lighthouse]210-the lighthouse after all , and [she]65-mrs. ramsay must see if the stocking did not need to be an inch or two longer in the leg .

[Smiling]96-smiling , for it was an admirable idea , that had flashed upon [her]65-mrs. ramsay this very second - [William]87-william bankes and [Lily]86-lily should marry - [she]65-mrs. ramsay took the heather - mixture stocking , with its criss - cross of steel needles at the mouth of it , and measured it against [James]93-james 's leg .

" [[My]65-mrs. ramsay dear]2719-my dear , stand still , "[65-mrs. ramsay] [she]65-mrs. ramsay said , for in [his]93-james jealousy , not liking to serve as measuring block for [[the Lighthouse keeper]521-the lighthouse keeper 's little boy]522-the lighthouse keeper 's little boy , [James]93-james fidgeted purposely ; and if [he]93-james did that , how could [she]65-mrs. ramsay see , was it too long , was it too short ? [she]65-mrs. ramsay asked .

[She]65-mrs. ramsay looked up - what demon possessed [him]93-james , [[her]65-mrs. ramsay youngest]523-her youngest , [her]65-mrs. ramsay cherished ? - and saw [the room]213-the room , saw the chairs , thought them fearfully shabby . [Their]525-their entrails , as [Andrew]71-andrew said the other day , were all over the floor ; but then what was the point , [she]65-mrs. ramsay asked , of buying good chairs to let [them]525-their spoil up here all through the winter when [the house]299-the house , with only [one old woman]527-one old woman to see to [it]299-the house , positively dripped with wet ? Never mind , the rent was precisely twopence half - penny ; [the children]258-the children loved it ; it did [[her]65-mrs. ramsay husband]234-her husband good to be three thousand , or if [she]65-mrs. ramsay must be accurate , three hundred miles from [[his]234-her husband libraries]530-his libraries and [his]234-her husband lectures and [[his]234-her husband disciples]531-his disciples ; and there was room for [visitors]532-visitors . [Mats]533-mats , [camp beds]534-camp beds , crazy ghosts of chairs and tables whose [London]11-london life of service was done - [they]525-their did well enough [here]361-here ; and a photograph or two , and books . Books , [she]65-mrs. ramsay thought , grew of [themselves]536-they . [She]65-mrs. ramsay never had time to read them . Alas ! even the books that had been given [her]65-mrs. ramsay and inscribed by the hand of [the poet]537-the poet [himself]537-the poet : " For [her]65-mrs. ramsay whose wishes must be obeyed "[537-the poet] ... " The happier Helen of [our]2720-our days "[65-mrs. ramsay] ... disgraceful to say , [she]65-mrs. ramsay had never read them . And [Croom]97-croom on the Mind and [Bates]98-bates on [the Savage Customs of [Polynesia]18-polynesia]17-the savage customs of polynesia " [[My]65-mrs. ramsay dear]2719-my dear , stand still , "[65-mrs. ramsay] [she]65-mrs. ramsay said - neither of those could one send to [the Lighthouse]210-the lighthouse . At a certain moment , [she]65-mrs. ramsay supposed , [the house]299-the house would become so shabby that something must be done . If [they]536-they could be taught to wipe [their]536-they feet and not bring [the beach]366-the beach in with [them]536-they - that would be something . [Crabs]99-crabs , [she]65-mrs. ramsay had to allow , if [Andrew]71-andrew really wished to dissect them , or if [Jasper]72-jasper believed that [one]222-one could make soup from seaweed , [one]222-one could not prevent it ; or [Rose]69-rose 's objects - shells , reeds , stones ; for [they]536-they were gifted , [[her]69-rose children]278-her children , but all in quite different ways . And the result of it was , [she]65-mrs. ramsay sighed , taking in [the whole room]544-the whole room from floor to ceiling , as [she]65-mrs. ramsay held the stocking against [James]93-james 's leg , that things got shabbier and got shabbier summer after summer . The mat was fading ; the wall - paper was flapping . [You]545-you could n't tell any more that those were roses on it . Still , if every door in [a house]546-a house is left perpetually open , and no lockmaker in [the whole of [Scotland]19-scotland]547-the whole of scotland can mend a bolt , things must spoil . What was the use of flinging a green Cashemere shawl over the edge of a picture frame ? In two weeks it would be the colour of pea soup . But it was the doors that annoyed [her]65-mrs. ramsay ; every door was left open . [She]65-mrs. ramsay listened . The drawing - room door was open ; the hall door was open ; it sounded as if the bedroom doors were open ; and certainly the window on [the landing]548-the landing was open , for that [she]65-mrs. ramsay had opened [herself]65-mrs. ramsay . "[65-mrs. ramsay] [[Her]65-mrs. ramsay father]274-her father was dying there , [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay knew . [He]274-her father was leaving [them]549-them fatherless . Never did [anybody]416-anybody look so sad . Bitter and black , half - way down , in the darkness , in the shaft which ran from the sunlight to the depths , perhaps a tear formed ; a tear fell ; the waters swayed this way and that , received it , and were at rest . Never did [anybody]416-anybody look so sad .

But was it nothing but looks , [people]264-people said ? What was there behind it - [her]241-the girl beauty and splendour ? Had [he]274-her father blown [his]274-her father brains out , [they]264-people asked , had [he]274-her father died the week before [they]562-they were married - [some other , earlier lover , of whom rumours]563-some other , earlier lover , of whom rumours reached one ? How did [he]234-her husband know ? [she]241-the girl asked . The wind often changed .

The extraordinary irrationality of [her]241-the girl remark , the folly of [women]600-women 's minds enraged [him]234-her husband . [He]234-her husband stamped [his]234-her husband foot on the stone step . " Damn [you]241-the girl , "[234-her husband] [he]234-her husband said . But what had [she]241-the girl said ? Simply that it might be fine tomorrow . So it might .

Not with the barometer falling and the wind due west .

To pursue truth with such astonishing lack of consideration for [other people]332-other people 's feelings , to rendthe thin veils of civilization so wantonly , so brutally , was to [her]241-the girl so horrible an outrage of human decency that , without replying , dazed and blinded , [she]241-the girl bent [her]241-the girl head as if to let the pelt of jagged hail , the drench of dirty water , bespatter [her]241-the girl unrebuked . There was nothing to be said .

" [Some one]386-some one had blundered , "[234-her husband] [he]234-her husband said again , striding off , up and down [the terrace]225-the terrace .

[He]234-her husband was safe , [he]234-her husband was restored to [his]234-her husband privacy . It was a splendid mind . For if thought is like the keyboard of a piano , divided into so many notes , or like the alphabet is ranged in twenty - six letters all in order , then [his]234-her husband splendid mind had no sort of difficulty in running over those letters one by one , firmly and accurately , until it had reached , say , the letter Q. [He]234-her husband reached Q. [Very few people in [the whole of [England]4-england]628-the whole of england]627-very few people in the whole of england ever reach Q. Still , if [he]234-her husband could reach R it would be something . Here at least was Q. [He]234-her husband dug [his]234-her husband heels in at Q. Q [he]234-her husband was sure of . "[234-her husband] [He]234-her husband braced [himself]234-her husband . [He]234-her husband clenched [himself]234-her husband .

Qualities that would have saved [[a ship]633-a ship 's company]634-a ship 's company exposed on [a broiling sea]635-a broiling sea with six biscuits and a flask of water - endurance and justice , foresight , devotion , skill , came to [his]234-her husband help . R is then - what is [R]105-r ?

R -

The lizard 's eye flickered once more . The veins on [his]234-her husband forehead bulged . The geranium in the urn became startlingly visible and , displayed among its leaves , [he]234-her husband could see , without wishing it , that old , that obvious distinction between the two classes of [men]358-men ; on the one hand the steady goers of superhuman strength who , plodding and persevering , repeat the whole alphabet in order , twenty - six letters in all , from start to finish ; on the other the gifted , [the inspired who , miraculously , lump all the letters together in one flash - the way of genius]643-the inspired who , miraculously , lump all the letters together in one flash - the way of genius . [He]234-her husband had not genius ; [he]234-her husband laid no claim to that : but [he]234-her husband had , or might have had , the power to repeat every letter of the alphabet from A to Z accurately in order . Meanwhile , [he]234-her husband stuck at Q. On , then , on to R.

Feelings that would not have disgraced [a leader who , now that the snow has begun to fall and the mountain top]644-a leader who , now that the snow has begun to fall and the mountain top is covered in mist , knows that [he]644-a leader who , now that the snow has begun to fall and the mountain top must lay [himself]644-a leader who , now that the snow has begun to fall and the mountain top down and die before morning comes , stole upon [him]644-a leader who , now that the snow has begun to fall and the mountain top , paling the colour of [his]644-a leader who , now that the snow has begun to fall and the mountain top eyes , giving [him]644-a leader who , now that the snow has begun to fall and the mountain top , even in the two minutes of [his]644-a leader who , now that the snow has begun to fall and the mountain top turn on [the terrace]225-the terrace , the bleached look of withered old age .
