7

But [[his]659-the hero son]203-his son hated [him]659-the hero . [He]203-his son hated [him]659-the hero for coming up to [them]664-them , for stopping and looking down on [them]664-them ; [he]203-his son hated [him]659-the hero for interrupting [them]664-them ; [he]203-his son hated [him]659-the hero for the exaltation and sublimity of [his]659-the hero gestures ; for the magnificence of [his]659-the hero head ; for [his]659-the hero exactingness and egotism for there [he]659-the hero stood , commanding [them]664-them to attend to [him]659-the hero but most of all [he]659-the hero hated the twang and twitter of [[his]659-the hero father]199-his father 's emotion which , vibrating round them , disturbed the perfect simplicity and good sense of [his]659-the hero relations with [[his]659-the hero mother]197-his mother . By looking fixedly at the page , [he]659-the hero hoped to make [him]659-the hero move on ; by pointing [his]659-the hero finger at a word , [he]659-the hero hoped to recall [[his]659-the hero mother]197-his mother 's attention , which , [he]659-the hero knew angrily , wavered instantly [[his]659-the hero father]199-his father stopped . But , no . Nothing would make [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay move on . There [he]67-mr. ramsay stood , demanding sympathy .

[Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay , who had been sitting loosely , folding [[her]65-mrs. ramsay son]193-her son in [her]65-mrs. ramsay arm , braced [herself]65-mrs. ramsay , and , half turning , seemed to raise [herself]65-mrs. ramsay with an effort , and at once to pour erect into the air a rain of energy , a column of spray , looking at the same time animated and alive as if all [her]65-mrs. ramsay energies were being fused into force , burning and illuminating quietly though [she]65-mrs. ramsay sat , taking up [her]65-mrs. ramsay stocking again , and into this delicious fecundity , this fountain and spray of life , the fatal sterility of [the male]670-the male plunged itself , like a beak of brass , barren and bare . [He]67-mr. ramsay wanted sympathy . [He]67-mr. ramsay was [a failure]671-a failure , [he]67-mr. ramsay said . [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay flashed [her]65-mrs. ramsay needles . [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay repeated , never taking [his]67-mr. ramsay eyes from [her]65-mrs. ramsay face , that [he]67-mr. ramsay was [a failure]671-a failure . [She]65-mrs. ramsay blew the words back at [him]67-mr. ramsay . " [Charles Tansley]68-charles tansley ... "[65-mrs. ramsay] [she]65-mrs. ramsay said . But [he]67-mr. ramsay must have more than that . It was sympathy [he]67-mr. ramsay wanted , to be assured of [his]67-mr. ramsay genius , first of all , and then to be taken within the circle of life , warmed and soothed , to have [his]67-mr. ramsay senses restored to [him]67-mr. ramsay , [his]67-mr. ramsay barrenness made furtile , and [all the rooms of [the house]299-the house]673-all the rooms of the house made full of life - [the drawing - room]200-the drawing - room ; behind [the drawing - room]200-the drawing - room [the kitchen]677-the kitchen ; above [the kitchen]677-the kitchen [the bedrooms]679-the bedrooms ; and beyond them [the nurseries]680-the nurseries ; [they]680-the nurseries must be furnished , [they]680-the nurseries must be filled with life .

[Charles Tansley]68-charles tansley thought [him]67-mr. ramsay [the greatest metaphysician of the time]681-the greatest metaphysician of the time , [she]65-mrs. ramsay said . But [he]67-mr. ramsay must have more than that . [He]67-mr. ramsay must have sympathy . [He]67-mr. ramsay must be assured that [he]67-mr. ramsay too lived in the heart of life ; was needed ; not only [here]361-here , but all over [the world]300-the world . Flashing [her]65-mrs. ramsay needles , confident , upright , [she]65-mrs. ramsay created [drawing - room]684-drawing - room and [kitchen]685-kitchen , set them all aglow ; bade [him]67-mr. ramsay take [his]67-mr. ramsay ease there , go in and out , enjoy [himself]67-mr. ramsay . [She]65-mrs. ramsay laughed , [she]65-mrs. ramsay knitted . Standing between [her]65-mrs. ramsay knees , very stiff , [James]93-james felt all [her]65-mrs. ramsay strength flaring up to be drunk and quenched by the beak of brass , the arid scimitar of [the male]670-the male , which smote mercilessly , again and again , demanding sympathy .

[He]93-james was [a failure]671-a failure , [he]93-james repeated . Well , look then , feel then . Flashing [her]65-mrs. ramsay needles , glancing round about [her]65-mrs. ramsay , out of the window , into [the room]213-the room , at [James]93-james [himself]93-james , [she]65-mrs. ramsay assured [him]93-james , beyond a shadow of a doubt , by [her]65-mrs. ramsay laugh , [her]65-mrs. ramsay poise , [her]65-mrs. ramsay competence as [a nurse]689-a nurse carrying a light across [a dark room]690-a dark room assures [a fractious child]691-a fractious child , that it was real ; [the house]299-the house was full ; [the garden]371-the garden blowing . If [he]93-james put implicit faith in [her]65-mrs. ramsay , nothing should hurt [him]93-james ; however deep [he]93-james buried [himself]93-james or climed high , not for a second should [he]93-james find [himself]93-james without [her]65-mrs. ramsay . So boasting of [her]65-mrs. ramsay capacity to surround and protect , there was scarcely a shell of [herself]65-mrs. ramsay left for [her]65-mrs. ramsay to know [herself]65-mrs. ramsay by ; all was so lavished and spent ; and [James]93-james , as [he]93-james stood stiff between [her]65-mrs. ramsay knees , felt [her]65-mrs. ramsay rise in a rosy - flowered fruit tree laid with leaves and dancing boughs into which the beak of brass , the arid scimitar of [[his]93-james father]199-his father , [the egotistical man]695-the egotistical man , plunged and smote , demanding sympathy .

Filled with [her]65-mrs. ramsay words , like [a child who drops off satisfied]696-a child who drops off satisfied , [he]93-james said , at last , looking at [her]65-mrs. ramsay with humble gratitude , restored , renewed , that [he]93-james would take a turn ; [he]93-james would watch [the children]258-the children playing cricket . [He]93-james went .

Immediately , [Mrs. Ramsey]108-mrs. ramsey seemed to fold [herself]108-mrs. ramsey together , one petal closed in another , and the whole fabric fell in exhaustion upon itself , so that [she]108-mrs. ramsey had only strength enough to move [her]108-mrs. ramsey finger , in exquisite abandonment to exhaustion , across the page of [Grimm]109-grimm 's fairy story , while there throbbed through [her]108-mrs. ramsey , like a pulse in a spring which has expanded to its full width and now gently ceases to beat , the rapture of successful creation .

Every throb of this pulse seemed , as [he]93-james walked away , to enclose [her]108-mrs. ramsey and [[her]108-mrs. ramsey husband]234-her husband , and to give to each that solace which two different notes , one high , one low , struck together , seem to give each other as they combine . Yet as the resonance died , and [she]108-mrs. ramsey turned to the Fairy Tale again , [Mrs. Ramsey]108-mrs. ramsey felt not only exhausted in body afterwards , not at the time , [she]108-mrs. ramsey always felt this but also there tinged [her]108-mrs. ramsey physical fatigue some faintly disagreeable sensation with another origin . Not that , as [she]108-mrs. ramsey read aloud the story of [[the Fisherman]699-the fisherman 's Wife]700-the fisherman 's wife , [she]108-mrs. ramsey knew precisely what it came from ; nor did [she]108-mrs. ramsey let [herself]108-mrs. ramsey put into words [her]108-mrs. ramsey dissatisfaction when [she]108-mrs. ramsey realized , at the turn of the page when [she]108-mrs. ramsey stopped and heard dully , ominously , a wave fall , how it came from this : [she]108-mrs. ramsey did not like , even for a second , to feel finer than [[her]108-mrs. ramsey husband]234-her husband ; and further , could not bear not being entirely sure , when [she]108-mrs. ramsey spoke to [him]234-her husband , of the truth of what [she]108-mrs. ramsey said . [Universities]110-universities and [people]264-people wanting [him]234-her husband , lectures and books and [their]264-people being of the highest importance - all that [she]108-mrs. ramsey did not doubt for a moment ; but it was [their]264-people relation , and [his]234-her husband coming to [her]108-mrs. ramsey like that , openly , so that [any one]703-any one could see , that discomposed [her]108-mrs. ramsey ; for then [people]264-people said [he]234-her husband depended on [her]108-mrs. ramsey , when [they]264-people must know that of the two [he]234-her husband was infinitely the more important , and what [she]108-mrs. ramsey gave [the world]300-the world , in comparison with what [he]234-her husband gave , negligable . But then again , it was the other thing too - not being able to tell [him]234-her husband the truth , being afraid , for instance , about the greenhouse roof and the expense it would be , fifty pounds perhaps to mend it ; and then about [his]234-her husband books , to be afraid that [he]234-her husband might guess , what [she]108-mrs. ramsey a little suspected , that [his]234-her husband last book was not quite [his]234-her husband best book [she]108-mrs. ramsey gathered that from [William Bankes]87-william bankes ; and then to hide small daily things , and [the children]258-the children seeing it , and the burden it laid on [them]258-the children - all this diminished the entire joy , the pure joy , of the two notes sounding together , and let the sound die on [her]108-mrs. ramsey ear now with a dismal flatness .

A shadow was on the page ; [she]108-mrs. ramsey looked up . It was [Augustus Carmichael]79-augustus carmichael shuffling past , precisely now , at the very moment when it was painful to be reminded of the inadequacy of human relationships , that the most perfect was flawed , and could not bear the examination which , loving [[her]108-mrs. ramsey husband]234-her husband , with [her]108-mrs. ramsey instinct for truth , [she]108-mrs. ramsey turned upon it ; when it was painful to feel [herself]108-mrs. ramsey convicted of unworthiness , and impeded in [her]108-mrs. ramsey proper function by these lies , these exaggerations , - it was at this moment when [she]108-mrs. ramsey was fretted thus ignobly in the wake of [her]108-mrs. ramsey exaltation , that [Mr. Carmichael]80-mr. carmichael shuffled past , in [his]80-mr. carmichael yellow slippers , and [some demon in [her]108-mrs. ramsey]708-some demon in her made it necessary for [her]108-mrs. ramsey to call out , as [he]80-mr. carmichael passed ,

" Going indoors [Mr. Carmichael]80-mr. carmichael ? "[108-mrs. ramsey]

8

[He]80-mr. carmichael said nothing . [He]80-mr. carmichael took opium . [The children]258-the children said [he]80-mr. carmichael had stained [his]80-mr. carmichael beard yellow with it . Perhaps . What was obvious to [her]108-mrs. ramsey was that [the poor man]710-the poor man was unhappy , came to [them]258-the children every year as an escape ; and yet every year [she]108-mrs. ramsey felt the same thing ; [he]80-mr. carmichael did not trust [her]108-mrs. ramsey . [She]108-mrs. ramsey said , " [I]108-mrs. ramsey am going to [the town]231-the town . Shall [I]108-mrs. ramsey get [you]80-mr. carmichael stamps , paper , tobacco ? "[108-mrs. ramsey] and [she]108-mrs. ramsey felt [him]80-mr. carmichael wince . [He]80-mr. carmichael did not trust [her]108-mrs. ramsey . It was [[his]80-mr. carmichael wife]204-his wife 's doing . [She]108-mrs. ramsey remembered that iniquity of [[his]80-mr. carmichael wife]204-his wife 's towards [him]80-mr. carmichael , which had made [her]108-mrs. ramsey turn to steel and adamant there , in [the horrible little room in [St John 's Wood]21-st john 's wood]713-the horrible little room in st john 's wood , when with [her]108-mrs. ramsey own eyes [she]108-mrs. ramsey had seen [that odious woman]714-that odious woman turn [him]80-mr. carmichael out of [the house]299-the house . [He]80-mr. carmichael was unkempt ; [he]80-mr. carmichael dropped things on [his]80-mr. carmichael coat ; [he]80-mr. carmichael had the tiresomeness of [an old man with nothing in the world to do]716-an old man with nothing in the world to do ; and [she]108-mrs. ramsey turned [him]80-mr. carmichael out of [the room]213-the room . [She]108-mrs. ramsey said , in [her]108-mrs. ramsey odious way , " Now , [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay and [I]108-mrs. ramsey want to have a little talk together , "[108-mrs. ramsey] and [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay could see , as if before [her]108-mrs. ramsey eyes , the innumerable miseries of [his]80-mr. carmichael life . Had [he]80-mr. carmichael money enough to buy tobacco ? Did [he]80-mr. carmichael have to ask [her]108-mrs. ramsey for it ? half a crown ? eighteenpence ? Oh , [she]108-mrs. ramsey could not bear to think of the little indignities [she]108-mrs. ramsey made [him]80-mr. carmichael suffer . And always now why , [she]108-mrs. ramsey could not guess , except that it came probably from that woman somehow [he]80-mr. carmichael shrank from [her]108-mrs. ramsey . [He]80-mr. carmichael never told [her]108-mrs. ramsey anything . But what more could [she]108-mrs. ramsey have done ? There was [a sunny room]718-a sunny room given up to [him]80-mr. carmichael . [The children]258-the children were good to [him]80-mr. carmichael . Never did [she]108-mrs. ramsey show a sign of not wanting [him]80-mr. carmichael . [She]108-mrs. ramsey went out of [her]108-mrs. ramsey way indeed to be friendly . Do [you]720-you want stamps , do [you]720-you want tobacco ? Here 's a book [you]720-you might like and so on . And after all - after all here insensibly [she]108-mrs. ramsey drew [herself]108-mrs. ramsey together , physically , the sense of [her]108-mrs. ramsey own beauty becoming , as it did so seldom , present to [her]108-mrs. ramsey after all , [she]108-mrs. ramsey had not generally any difficulty in making [[people]264-people like [her]108-mrs. ramsey]722-people like her ; for instance , [George Manning]111-george manning ; [Mr. Wallace]112-mr. wallace ; famous as [they]264-people were , [they]264-people would come to [her]108-mrs. ramsey of an evening , quietly , and talk alone over [her]108-mrs. ramsey fire . [She]108-mrs. ramsey bore about with [her]108-mrs. ramsey , [she]108-mrs. ramsey could not help knowing it , the torch of [her]108-mrs. ramsey beauty ; [she]108-mrs. ramsey carried it erect into [any room that [she]108-mrs. ramsey entered]723-any room that she entered ; and after all , veil it as [she]108-mrs. ramsey might , and shrink from the monotony of bearing that it imposed on [her]108-mrs. ramsey , [her]108-mrs. ramsey beauty was apparent . [She]108-mrs. ramsey had been admired . [She]108-mrs. ramsey had been loved . [She]108-mrs. ramsey had entered [rooms where [mourners]725-mourners sat]724-rooms where mourners sat . Tears had flown in [her]108-mrs. ramsey presence . [Men]358-men , and [women]600-women too , letting go to the multiplicity of things , had allowed [themselves]728-themselves with [her]108-mrs. ramsey the relief of simplicity . It injured [her]108-mrs. ramsey that [he]358-men should shrink . It hurt [her]108-mrs. ramsey . And yet not cleanly , not rightly . That was what [she]108-mrs. ramsey minded , coming as it did on top of [her]108-mrs. ramsey discontent with [[her]108-mrs. ramsey husband]234-her husband ; the sense [she]108-mrs. ramsey had now when [Mr. Carmichael]80-mr. carmichael shuffled past , just nodding to [her]108-mrs. ramsey question , with a book beneath [his]80-mr. carmichael arm , in [his]80-mr. carmichael yellow slippers , that [she]108-mrs. ramsey was suspected ; and that all this desire of [hers]108-mrs. ramsey to give , to help , was vanity . For [her]108-mrs. ramsey own self - satisfaction was it that [she]108-mrs. ramsey wished so instinctively to help , to give , that [people]264-people might say of [her]108-mrs. ramsey , " O [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay ! dear [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay ... [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay , of course ! "[264-people] and need [her]108-mrs. ramsey and send for [her]108-mrs. ramsey and admire [her]108-mrs. ramsey ? Was it not secretly this that [she]108-mrs. ramsey wanted , and therefore when [Mr. Carmichael]80-mr. carmichael shrank away from [her]108-mrs. ramsey , as [he]80-mr. carmichael did at this moment , making off to some corner where [he]80-mr. carmichael did acrostics endlessly , [she]108-mrs. ramsey did not feel merely snubbed back in [her]108-mrs. ramsey instinct , but made aware of the pettiness of some part of [her]108-mrs. ramsey , and of human relations , how flawed [they]731-they are , how despicable , how self - seeking , at [their]731-they best . Shabby and worn out , and not presumably [her]108-mrs. ramsey cheeks were hollow , [her]108-mrs. ramsey hair was white any longer a sight that filled the eyes with joy , [she]108-mrs. ramsey had better devote [her]108-mrs. ramsey mind to the story of [the Fisherman]699-the fisherman and [[his]699-the fisherman Wife]204-his wife and so pacify that bundle of sensitiveness [none of [[her]108-mrs. ramsey children]278-her children]734-none of her children was as sensitive as [he]699-the fisherman was , [[her]108-mrs. ramsey son]193-her son [James]93-james .

" [The man]2733-the man 's heart grew heavy , "[108-mrs. ramsey] [she]108-mrs. ramsey read aloud , " and [he]2733-the man would not go . [He]2733-the man said to [himself]2733-the man , ' It is not right , ' and yet [he]2733-the man went . And when [he]2733-the man came to [the sea]220-the sea the water was quite purple and dark blue , and grey and thick , and no longer so green and yellow , but it was still quiet . And [he]2733-the man stood there and said - "[108-mrs. ramsey]

[Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay could have wished that [[her]65-mrs. ramsay husband]234-her husband had not chosen that moment to stop . Why had [he]234-her husband not gone as [he]234-her husband said to watch [the children]258-the children playing cricket ? But [he]234-her husband did not speak ; [he]234-her husband looked ; [he]234-her husband nodded ; [he]234-her husband approved ; [he]234-her husband went on . [He]234-her husband slipped , seeing before [him]234-her husband that hedge which had over and over again rounded some pause , signified some conclusion , seeing [[his]234-her husband wife]204-his wife and [child]504-child , seeing again the urns with the trailing of red geraniums which had so often decorated processes of thought , and bore , written up among [their]258-the children leaves , as if they were scraps of paper on which [one scribbles notes in the rush of reading]741-one scribbles notes in the rush of reading - [he]234-her husband slipped , seeing all this , smoothly into speculation suggested by an article in THE TIMES about the number of Americans who visit [[Shakespeare]107-shakespeare 's house]742-shakespeare 's house every year . If [Shakespeare]107-shakespeare had never existed , [he]234-her husband asked , would [the world]300-the world have differed much from what it is today ? Does the progress of civilization depend upon [great men]744-great men ? Is the lot of [the average human being]745-the average human being better now than in the time of [the Pharaohs]746-the pharaohs ? Is the lot of [the average human being]745-the average human being , however , [he]234-her husband asked [himself]234-her husband , the criterion by which [we]748-we judge the measure of civilization ? Possibly not . Possibly the greatest good requires the existence of [a slave class]749-a slave class . [The liftman]750-the liftman in [the Tube]751-the tube is an eternal necessity . The thought was distasteful to [him]234-her husband . [He]234-her husband tossed [his]234-her husband head . To avoid it , [he]234-her husband would find some way of snubbing the predominance of the arts . [He]234-her husband would argue that [the world]300-the world exists for [the average human being]745-the average human being ; that the arts are merely a decoration imposed on the top of human life ; [they]754-they do not express it . Nor is [Shakespeare]107-shakespeare necessary to it . Not knowing precisely why it was that [he]234-her husband wanted to disparage [Shakespeare]107-shakespeare and come to the rescue of [the man who stands eternally in the door of [the lift]756-the lift]755-the man who stands eternally in the door of the lift , [he]234-her husband picked a leaf sharply from the hedge . All this would have to be dished up for [the young men]757-the young men at Cardiff next month , [he]234-her husband thought ; here , on [[his]234-her husband terrace]758-his terrace , [he]234-her husband was merely foraging and picnicking [he]234-her husband threw away the leaf that [he]234-her husband had picked so peevishly like [a man who reaches from [his]234-her husband horse to pick a bunch of roses]759-a man who reaches from his horse to pick a bunch of roses , or stuffs [his]234-her husband pockets with nuts as [he]234-her husband ambles at [his]234-her husband ease through [the lanes and fields of [a country]761-a country known to [him]234-her husband from boyhood]760-the lanes and fields of a country known to him from boyhood . It was all familiar ; this turning , that stile , that cut across [the fields]762-the fields . Hours [he]234-her husband would spend thus , with [his]234-her husband pipe , of an evening , thinking up and down and in and out of [the old familiar lanes]763-the old familiar lanes and [commons]764-commons , which were all stuck about with the history of that campaign there , the life of [this statesman]765-this statesman here , with poems and with anecdotes , with figures too , [this thinker]766-this thinker , [that soldier]767-that soldier ; all very brisk and clear ; but at length [the lane]768-the lane , [the field]769-the field , the common , the fruitful nut - tree and the flowering hedge led [him]234-her husband on to that further turn of [the road]305-the road where [he]234-her husband dismounted always , tied [his]234-her husband horse to a tree , and proceeded on foot alone . [He]234-her husband reached the edge of [the lawn]310-the lawn and looked out on [the bay beneath]772-the bay beneath .

It was [his]234-her husband fate , [his]234-her husband peculiarity , whether [he]234-her husband wished it or not , to come out thus on [a spit of land which the sea]773-a spit of land which the sea is slowly eating away , and there to stand , like a desolate sea - bird , alone . It was [his]234-her husband power , [his]234-her husband gift , suddenly to shed all superfluities , to shrink and diminish so that [he]234-her husband looked barer and felt sparer , even physically , yet lost none of [his]234-her husband intensity of mind , and so to stand on [his]234-her husband little ledge facing the dark of human ignorance , how [we]774-we know nothing and [the sea]220-the sea eats away the ground [we]774-we stand on - that was [his]234-her husband fate , [his]234-her husband gift . But having thrown away , when [he]234-her husband dismounted , all gestures and fripperies , all trophies of nuts and roses , and shrunk so that not only fame but even [his]234-her husband own name was forgotten by [him]234-her husband , kept even in that desolation a vigilance which spared no phantom and luxuriated in no vision , and it was in this guise that [he]234-her husband inspired in [William Bankes]87-william bankes intermittently and in [Charles Tansley]68-charles tansley obsequiously and in [[his]234-her husband wife]204-his wife now , when [she]204-his wife looked up and saw [him]234-her husband standing at the edge of [the lawn]310-the lawn , profoundly , reverence , and pity , and gratitude too , as a stake driven into the bed of [a channel upon which the gulls perch and the waves beat inspires in [merry boat]779-merry boat]778-a channel upon which the gulls perch and the waves beat inspires in merry boat - loads a feeling of gratitude for the duty it is taking upon [itself]780-itself of marking the channel out there in the floods alone .

" But [the father of eight children]2735-the father of eight children has no choice . "[234-her husband] Muttering half aloud , so [he]234-her husband broke off , turned , sighed , raised [his]234-her husband eyes , sought the figure of [[his]234-her husband wife]204-his wife reading stories to [[his]234-her husband little boy]212-his little boy , filled [his]234-her husband pipe . [He]234-her husband turned from the sight of human ignorance and human fate and the sea eating the ground [we]783-we stand on , which , had [he]234-her husband been able to contemplate it fixedly might have led to something ; and found consolation in trifles so slight compared with the august theme just now before [him]234-her husband that [he]234-her husband was disposed to slur that comfort over , to deprecate it , as if to be caught happy in [a world of misery]784-a world of misery was for [an honest man the most despicable of crimes]785-an honest man the most despicable of crimes . It was true ; [he]234-her husband was for the most part happy ; [he]234-her husband had [[his]234-her husband wife]204-his wife ; [he]234-her husband had [[his]234-her husband children]202-his children ; [he]234-her husband had promised in six weeks ' time to talk ' some nonsense " to [the young men of [Cardiff]22-cardiff]2736-the young men of cardiff about [Locke]113-locke , [Hume]114-hume , [Berkeley]115-berkeley , and the causes of the French Revolution . But this and [his]234-her husband pleasure in it , [his]234-her husband glory in the phrases [he]234-her husband made , in the ardour of youth , in [[his]234-her husband wife]204-his wife 's beauty , in the tributes that reached [him]234-her husband from [Swansea]23-swansea , [Cardiff]22-cardiff , [Exeter]24-exeter , [Southampton]25-southampton , [Kidderminster]26-kidderminster , [Oxford]12-oxford , [Cambridge]27-cambridge - all had to be deprecated and concealed under the phrase "[234-her husband] talking nonsense , " because , in effect , [he]234-her husband had not done the thing [he]234-her husband might have done . It was a disguise ; it was the refuge of [a man afraid to own [his]234-her husband own feelings]2738-a man afraid to own his own feelings , who could not say , This is what [I]234-her husband like - this is what [I]234-her husband am ; and rather pitiable and distasteful to [William Bankes]87-william bankes and [Lily Briscoe]86-lily , who wondered why such concealments should be necessary ; why [he]789-a cropper needed always praise ; why so brave [a man in thought]2739-a man in thought should be so timid in life ; how strangely [he]789-a cropper was venerable and laughable at one and the same time .[234-her husband]

Teaching and preaching is beyond human power , [Lily]86-lily suspected . [She]86-lily was putting away [her]86-lily things . If [you]788-you are exalted [you]788-you must somehow come [a cropper]789-a cropper . [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay gave [him]789-a cropper what [he]789-a cropper asked too easily . Then the change must be so upsetting , [Lily]86-lily said . [He]789-a cropper comes in from [his]789-a cropper books and finds [us]790-us all playing games and talking nonsense . Imagine what a change from the things [he]789-a cropper thinks about , [she]86-lily said .

[He]789-a cropper was bearing down upon [them]790-us . Now [he]789-a cropper stopped dead and stood looking in silence at [the sea]220-the sea . Now [he]789-a cropper had turned away again .

9

Yes , [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes said , watching [him]789-a cropper go . It was a thousand pities . [Lily]86-lily had said something about [his]789-a cropper frightening [her]86-lily - [he]789-a cropper changed from one mood to another so suddenly . Yes , said [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes , it was a thousand pities that [Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay could not behave a little more like [other people]332-other people . For [he]789-a cropper liked [Lily Briscoe]86-lily ; [he]789-a cropper could discuss [Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay with [her]86-lily quite openly . It was for that reason , [he]90-mr. bankes said , that [the young do n't]793-the young do n't read [Carlyle]116-carlyle . A crusty old grumbler who lost [his]116-carlyle temper if the porridge was cold , why should [he]116-carlyle preach to [us]794-us ? was what [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes understood that [young people]795-young people said nowadays . It was a thousand pities if [you]796-you thought , as [he]90-mr. bankes did , that [Carlyle]116-carlyle was one of [the great teachers of mankind]797-the great teachers of mankind . [Lily]86-lily was ashamed to say that [she]86-lily had not read [Carlyle]116-carlyle since [she]86-lily was at [school]798-school . But in [her]86-lily opinion [one]222-one liked [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay all the better for thinking that if [his]67-mr. ramsay little finger ached [the whole world]800-the whole world must come to an end . It was not THAT [she]86-lily minded . For who could be deceived by [him]67-mr. ramsay ? [He]67-mr. ramsay asked [you]796-you quite openly to flatter [him]67-mr. ramsay , to admire [him]67-mr. ramsay , [his]67-mr. ramsay little dodges deceived [nobody]216-nobody . What [she]86-lily disliked was [his]67-mr. ramsay narrowness , [his]67-mr. ramsay blindness , [she]86-lily said , looking after [him]67-mr. ramsay .

" A bit of a hypocrite ? "[90-mr. bankes] [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes suggested , looking too at [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay 's back , for was [he]90-mr. bankes not thinking of [his]90-mr. bankes friendship , and of [Cam]91-cam refusing to give [him]67-mr. ramsay a flower , and of [all those boys]802-all those boys and [girls]803-girls , and [[his]67-mr. ramsay own house]804-his own house , full of comfort , but , since [[his]67-mr. ramsay wife]204-his wife 's death , quiet rather ? Of course , [he]90-mr. bankes had [his]90-mr. bankes work ... All the same , [he]90-mr. bankes rather wished [Lily]86-lily to agree that [Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay was , as [he]90-mr. bankes said , " a bit of [a hypocrite]2740-a hypocrite . "[90-mr. bankes]

[Lily Briscoe]86-lily went on putting away [her]86-lily brushes , looking up , looking down . Looking up , there [he]67-mr. ramsay was - [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay - advancing towards [them]806-them , swinging , careless , oblivious , remote . [A bit of a hypocrite]807-a bit of a hypocrite ? [she]86-lily repeated . Oh , no - [the most sincere of [men]358-men]808-the most sincere of men , the truest here [he]67-mr. ramsay was , the best ; but , looking down , [she]86-lily thought , [he]67-mr. ramsay is absorbed in [himself]67-mr. ramsay , [he]67-mr. ramsay is tyrannical , [he]67-mr. ramsay is unjust ; and kept looking down , purposely , for only so could [she]86-lily keep steady , staying with [the Ramsays]82-the ramsays . Directly one looked up and saw [them]82-the ramsays , what [she]86-lily called " being in love "[86-lily] flooded [them]82-the ramsays . [They]82-the ramsays became part of that unreal but penetrating and exciting universe which is [the world]300-the world seen through the eyes of love . The sky stuck to [them]82-the ramsays ; the birds sang through them . And , what was even more exciting , [she]86-lily felt , too , as [she]86-lily saw [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay bearing down and retreating , and [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay sitting with [James]93-james in the window and the cloud moving and the tree bending , how life , from being made up of little separate incidents which [one lived one by one]811-one lived one by one , became curled and whole like a wave which bore one up and threw one down with it , there , with a dash on [the beach]366-the beach .

[Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes expected [her]86-lily to answer . And [she]86-lily was about to say something criticizing [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay , how [she]86-lily was alarming , too , in [her]86-lily way , high - handed , or words to that effect , when [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes made it entirely unnecessary for [her]86-lily to speak by [his]90-mr. bankes rapture . For such it was considering [his]90-mr. bankes age , turned sixty , and [his]90-mr. bankes cleanliness and [his]90-mr. bankes impersonality , and the white scientific coat which seemed to clothe [him]90-mr. bankes . For [him]90-mr. bankes to gaze as [Lily]86-lily saw [him]90-mr. bankes gazing at [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay was a rapture , equivalent , [Lily]86-lily felt , to the loves of [dozens of [young men]814-young men]813-dozens of young men and perhaps [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay had never excited the loves of [dozens of young men]813-dozens of young men . It was love , [she]86-lily thought , pretending to move [her]86-lily canvas , distilled and filtered ; love that never attempted to clutch its object ; but , like the love which mathematicians bear [their]816-their symbols , or poets [their]816-their phrases , was meant to be spread over [the world]300-the world and become part of the human gain . So it was indeed . [The world]300-the world by all means should have shared it , could [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes have said why [that woman]819-that woman pleased [him]90-mr. bankes so ; why the sight of [her]819-that woman reading a fairy tale to [[her]819-that woman boy]820-her boy had upon [him]90-mr. bankes precisely the same effect as the solution of a scientific problem , so that [he]90-mr. bankes rested in contemplation of it , and felt , as [he]90-mr. bankes felt when [he]90-mr. bankes had proved something absolute about the digestive system of plants , that barbarity was tamed , the reign of chaos subdued .

Such a rapture - for by what other name could one call it ? - made [Lily Briscoe]86-lily forget entirely what [she]86-lily had been about to say . It was nothing of importance ; something about [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay . It paled beside this " rapture , "[65-mrs. ramsay] this silent stare , for which [she]86-lily felt intense gratitude ; for nothing so solaced [her]86-lily , eased [her]86-lily of the perplexity of life , and miraculously raised its burdens , as this sublime power , this heavenly gift , and [one]222-one would no more disturb it , while it lasted , than break up the shaft of sunlight , lying level across the floor .

That [people]264-people should love like this , that [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes should feel this for [Mrs. Ramsey]108-mrs. ramsey [she]86-lily glanced at [him]90-mr. bankes musing was helpful , was exalting . [She]86-lily wiped one brush after another upon a piece of old rag , menially , on purpose . [She]86-lily took shelter from the reverence which covered [all women]823-all women ; [she]86-lily felt [herself]86-lily praised . Let [him]90-mr. bankes gaze ; [she]86-lily would steal a look at [her]86-lily picture .

[She]86-lily could have wept . It was bad , it was bad , it was infinitely bad ! [She]86-lily could have done it differently of course ; the colour could have been thinned and faded ; the shapes etherealised ; that was how [Paunceforte]83-mr. paunceforte would have seen it . But then [she]86-lily did not see it like that . [She]86-lily saw the colour burning on a framework of steel ; the light of a butterfly 's wing lying upon the arches of [a cathedral]824-a cathedral . Of all that only a few random marks scrawled upon the canvas remained . And it would never be seen ; never be hung even , and there was [Mr. Tansley]76-mr. tansley whispering in [her]86-lily ear , " [Women]600-women ca n't paint , [women]600-women ca n't write ... "[76-mr. tansley]

[She]86-lily now remembered what [she]86-lily had been going to say about [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay . [She]86-lily did not know how [she]86-lily would have put it ; but it would have been something critical . [She]86-lily had been annoyed the other night by some highhandedness . Looking along the level of [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes 's glance at [her]86-lily , [she]86-lily thought that [no woman]238-no woman could worship [another woman]826-another woman in the way [he]90-mr. bankes worshipped ; [they]827-they could only seek shelter under the shade which [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes extended over [them]827-they both . Looking along [his]90-mr. bankes beam [she]86-lily added to it [her]86-lily different ray , thinking that [she]86-lily was unquestionably the loveliest of [people]264-people bowed over [her]86-lily book ; the best perhaps ; but also , different too from the perfect shape which [one]222-one saw there . But why different , and how different ? [she]86-lily asked [herself]86-lily , scraping [her]86-lily palette of all those mounds of blue and green which seemed to [her]86-lily like clods with no life in them now , yet [she]86-lily vowed , [she]86-lily would inspire [them]830-them , force [them]830-them to move , flow , do [her]86-lily bidding tomorrow . How did [she]86-lily differ ? What was the spirit in [her]86-lily , the essential thing , by which , had [you]831-you found a crumpled glove in the corner of a sofa , [you]831-you would have known it , from its twisted finger , [hers]86-lily indisputably ? [She]86-lily was like a bird for speed , an arrow for directness . [She]86-lily was willful ; [she]86-lily was commanding of course , [Lily]86-lily reminded [herself]86-lily , [I]0-i am thinking of [her]86-lily relations with [women]600-women , and [I]0-i am much younger , [an insignificant person]833-an insignificant person , living off [the Brompton Road]28-the brompton road . [She]86-lily opened [bedroom]834-bedroom windows . [She]86-lily shut doors . So [she]86-lily tried to start the tune of [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay in [her]86-lily head . Arriving late at night , with a light tap on [one]222-one 's bedroom door , wrapped in an old fur coat for the setting of [her]86-lily beauty was always that - hasty , but apt , [she]86-lily would enact again whatever it might be - [Charles Tansley]68-charles tansley losing [his]68-charles tansley umbrella ; [Mr. Carmichael]80-mr. carmichael snuffling and sniffing ; [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes saying , " The vegetable salts are lost . "[90-mr. bankes] All this [she]86-lily would adroitly shape ; even maliciously twist ; and , moving over to the window , in pretence that [she]86-lily must go , - it was dawn , [she]86-lily could see the sun rising , - half turn back , more intimately , but still always laughing , insist that [she]86-lily must , [Minta]77-minta must , [they]836-they all must marry , since in [the whole world]800-the whole world whatever laurels might be tossed to [her]86-lily but [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay cared not a fig for [her]65-mrs. ramsay painting , or triumphs won by [her]65-mrs. ramsay probably [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay had had [her]65-mrs. ramsay share of those , and here [she]65-mrs. ramsay saddened , darkened , and came back to [her]65-mrs. ramsay chair , there could be no disputing this : [an unmarried woman]838-an unmarried woman [she]65-mrs. ramsay lightly took [her]65-mrs. ramsay hand for a moment , [an unmarried woman]838-an unmarried woman has missed the best of life . [The house]299-the house seemed full of [children]325-children sleeping and [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay listening ; shaded lights and regular breathing .

Oh , but , [Lily]86-lily would say , there was [[her]86-lily father]274-her father ; [[her]86-lily home]843-her home ; even , had [she]86-lily dared to say it , [her]86-lily painting . But all this seemed so little , so virginal , against the other . Yet , as the night wore on , and white lights parted the curtains , and even now and then some bird chirped in [the garden]371-the garden , gathering a desperate courage [she]86-lily would urge [her]86-lily own exemption from the universal law ; plead for it ; [she]86-lily liked to be alone ; [she]86-lily liked to be [herself]86-lily ; [she]86-lily was not made for that ; and so have to meet a serious stare from eyes of unparalleled depth , and confront [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay 's simple certainty and [she]86-lily was childlike now that [[her]86-lily dear]845-her dear [Lily]86-lily , [[her]86-lily little Brisk]846-her little brisk , was [a fool]847-a fool . Then , [she]86-lily remembered , [she]86-lily had laid [her]86-lily head on [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay 's lap and laughed and laughed and laughed , laughed almost hysterically at the thought of [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay presiding with immutable calm over destinies which [she]86-lily completely failed to understand . There [she]86-lily sat , simple , serious . [She]86-lily had recovered [her]86-lily sense of [her]86-lily now - this was the glove 's twisted finger . But into what [sanctuary]848-sanctuary had [one penetrated]849-one penetrated ? [Lily Briscoe]86-lily had looked up at last , and there was [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay , unwitting entirely what had caused [her]65-mrs. ramsay laughter , still presiding , but now with every trace of wilfulness abolished , and in its stead , something clear as the space which the clouds at last uncover - the little space of sky which sleeps beside the moon .

Was it wisdom ? Was it knowledge ? Was it , once more , the deceptiveness of beauty , so that [all one]850-all one 's perceptions , half way to truth , were tangled in a golden mesh ? or did [she]86-lily lock up within [her]86-lily some secret which certainly [Lily Briscoe]86-lily believed [people]264-people must have for [the world]300-the world to go on at all ? [Every one]853-every one could not be as helter skelter , hand to mouth as [she]853-every one was . But if [they]853-every one knew , could [they]853-every one tell [one]222-one what [they]853-every one knew ? Sitting on the floor with [her]86-lily arms round [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay 's knees , close as [she]86-lily could get , smiling to think that [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay would never know the reason of that pressure , [she]86-lily imagined how in [the chambers of the mind]855-the chambers of the mind and heart of [the woman who was , physically , touching [her]86-lily]856-the woman who was , physically , touching her , were stood , like the treasures in [the tombs of [kings]858-kings]857-the tombs of kings , tablets bearing sacred inscriptions , which if one could spell them out , would teach one everything , but they would never be offered openly , never made public . What art was there , known to love or cunning , by which one pressed through into [those secret chambers]859-those secret chambers ? What device for becoming , like waters poured into one jar , inextricably the same , one with the object [one]222-one adored ? Could the body achieve , or the mind , subtly mingling in the intricate passages of the brain ? or the heart ? Could loving , as [people]264-people called it , make [her]86-lily and [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay one ? for it was not knowledge but unity that [she]86-lily desired , not inscriptions on tablets , nothing that could be written in any language known to [men]358-men , but intimacy itself , which is knowledge , [she]86-lily had thought , leaning [her]86-lily head on [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay 's knee .

Nothing happened . Nothing ! Nothing ! as [she]86-lily leant [her]86-lily head against [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay 's knee . And yet , [she]86-lily knew knowledge and wisdom were stored up in [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay 's heart . How , then , [she]86-lily had asked [herself]86-lily , did one know one thing or another thing about [people]264-people , sealed as [they]264-people were ? Only like a bee , [drawn by some sweetness or sharpness in the air intangible to touch or taste]864-drawn by some sweetness or sharpness in the air intangible to touch or taste , one haunted the dome - shaped hive , ranged the wastes of the air over [the countries of [the world]300-the world]865-the countries of the world alone , and then haunted the hives with [their]264-people murmurs and [their]264-people stirrings ; the hives , which were [people]264-people . [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay rose . [Lily]86-lily rose . [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay went . For days there hung about [her]86-lily , as after a dream some subtle change is felt in [the person one]868-the person one has dreamt of , more vividly than anything [she]86-lily said , the sound of murmuring and , as [she]86-lily sat in the wicker arm - chair in the drawing - room window [she]86-lily wore , to [Lily]86-lily 's eyes , an august shape ; the shape of a dome .

[This ray]869-this ray passed level with [[Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes 's ray]870-mr. bankes 's ray straight to [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay sitting reading there with [James]93-james at [her]65-mrs. ramsay knee . But now while [she]65-mrs. ramsay still looked , [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes had done . [He]90-mr. bankes had put on [his]90-mr. bankes spectacles . [He]90-mr. bankes had stepped back . [He]90-mr. bankes had raised [his]90-mr. bankes hand . [He]90-mr. bankes had slightly narrowed [his]90-mr. bankes clear blue eyes , when [Lily]86-lily , rousing [herself]86-lily , saw what [he]90-mr. bankes was at , and winced like a dog who sees a hand raised to strike it . [She]86-lily would have snatched [her]86-lily picture off the easel , but [she]86-lily said to [herself]86-lily , One must . [She]86-lily braced [herself]86-lily to stand the awful trial of [some one]386-some one looking at [her]86-lily picture . One must , [she]86-lily said , one must . And if it must be seen , [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes was less alarming than another . But that any other eyes should see the residue of [her]86-lily thirty - three years , the deposit of each day 's living mixed with something more secret than [she]86-lily had ever spoken or shown in the course of all those days was an agony . At the same time it was immensely exciting .

Nothing could be cooler and quieter . Taking out a pen - knife , [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes tapped the canvas with the bone handle . What did [she]86-lily wish to indicate by the triangular purple shape , " just there "[86-lily] ? [he]90-mr. bankes asked .

It was [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay reading to [James]93-james , [she]65-mrs. ramsay said . [She]65-mrs. ramsay knew [his]90-mr. bankes objection - that [no one]477-no one could tell it for a human shape . But [she]65-mrs. ramsay had made no attempt at likeness , [she]65-mrs. ramsay said . For what reason had [she]65-mrs. ramsay introduced [them]873-them then ? [he]90-mr. bankes asked . Why indeed ? - except that if there , in that corner , it was bright , here , in this , [she]65-mrs. ramsay felt the need of darkness . Simple , obvious , commonplace , as it was , [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes was interested . [Mother]339-mother and [child]504-child then - objects of universal veneration , and in this case [the mother]876-the mother was famous for [her]876-the mother beauty - might be reduced , [he]90-mr. bankes pondered , to a purple shadow without irreverence .

But the picture was not of them , [she]65-mrs. ramsay said . Or , not in [his]90-mr. bankes sense . There were other senses too in which one might reverence them . By a shadow here and a light there , for instance . [Her]65-mrs. ramsay tribute took that form if , as [she]65-mrs. ramsay vaguely supposed , a picture must be a tribute . [A mother]877-a mother and [child]504-child might be reduced to a shadow without irreverence . A light here required a shadow there . [He]90-mr. bankes considered . [He]90-mr. bankes was interested . [He]90-mr. bankes took it scientifically in complete good faith . The truth was that all [his]90-mr. bankes prejudices were on the other side , [he]90-mr. bankes explained . The largest picture in [his]90-mr. bankes drawing - room , which [painters]879-painters had praised , and valued at a higher price than [he]90-mr. bankes had given for it , was of the cherry trees in blossom on [the banks of [the Kennet]29-the kennet]880-the banks of the kennet . [He]90-mr. bankes had spent [his]90-mr. bankes honeymoon on [the banks of [the Kennet]29-the kennet]880-the banks of the kennet , [he]90-mr. bankes said . [Lily]86-lily must come and see that picture , [he]90-mr. bankes said . But now - [he]90-mr. bankes turned , with [his]90-mr. bankes glasses raised to the scientific examination of [her]86-lily canvas . The question being one of the relations of masses , of lights and shadows , which , to be honest , [he]90-mr. bankes had never considered before , [he]90-mr. bankes would like to have it explained - what then did [she]86-lily wish to make of it ? And [he]90-mr. bankes indicated the scene before [them]882-them . [She]86-lily looked . [She]86-lily could not show [him]90-mr. bankes what [she]86-lily wished to make of it , could not see it even [herself]86-lily , without a brush in [her]86-lily hand . [She]86-lily took up once more [her]86-lily old painting position with the dim eyes and the absent - minded manner , subduing all [her]86-lily impressions as [a woman]376-a woman to something much more general ; becoming once more under the power of that vision which [she]86-lily had seen clearly once and must now grope for among hedges and [houses]884-houses and [mothers]885-mothers and [children]325-children - [her]86-lily picture . It was a question , [she]86-lily remembered , how to connect this mass on the right hand with that on the left . [She]86-lily might do it by bringing the line of the branch across so ; or break the vacancy in the foreground by an object James perhaps so . But the danger was that by doing that the unity of the whole might be broken . [She]86-lily stopped ; [she]86-lily did not want to bore [him]90-mr. bankes ; [she]86-lily took the canvas lightly off the easel .

But it had been seen ; it had been taken from [her]86-lily . [This man]887-this man had shared with [her]86-lily something profoundly intimate . And , thanking [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay for it and [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay for it and the hour and [the place]888-the place , crediting [the world]300-the world with a power which [she]86-lily had not suspected - that one could walk away down [that long gallery]890-that long gallery not alone any more but arm in arm with [somebody]335-somebody - the strangest feeling in [the world]300-the world , and the most exhilarating - [she]86-lily nicked the catch of [her]86-lily paint - box to , more firmly than was necessary , and the nick seemed to surround in a circle forever the paint - box , [the lawn]310-the lawn , [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes , and [that wild villain]894-that wild villain , [Cam]91-cam , dashing past .

10

For [Cam]91-cam grazed the easel by an inch ; [she]86-lily would not stop for [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes and [Lily Briscoe]86-lily ; though [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes , who would have liked [a daughter of [his]90-mr. bankes own]895-a daughter of his own , held out [his]90-mr. bankes hand ; [she]86-lily would not stop for [[her]86-lily father]274-her father , whom [she]86-lily grazed also by an inch ; nor for [[her]86-lily mother]897-her mother , who called " [Cam]91-cam ! [I]897-her mother want [you]91-cam a moment ! "[897-her mother] as [she]86-lily dashed past . [She]86-lily was off like a bird , bullet , or arrow , impelled by what desire , shot by whom , at what directed , who could say ? What , what ? [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay pondered , watching [her]86-lily . It might be a vision - of a shell , of a wheelbarrow , of [a fairy kingdom on the far side of the hedge]898-a fairy kingdom on the far side of the hedge ; or it might be the glory of speed ; [no one]477-no one knew . But when [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay called " [Cam]91-cam ! "[65-mrs. ramsay] a second time , the projectile dropped in mid career , and [Cam]91-cam came lagging back , pulling a leaf by the way , to [[her]91-cam mother]897-her mother .

What was [she]86-lily dreaming about , [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay wondered , seeing [her]86-lily engrossed , as [she]86-lily stood there , with some thought of [her]86-lily own , so that [she]86-lily had to repeat the message twice - ask [Mildred]117-mildred if [Andrew]71-andrew , [Miss Doyle]88-miss doyle , and [Mr. Rayley]118-mr. rayley have come back ? - The words seemed to be dropped into a well , where , if the waters were clear , they were also so extraordinarily distorting that , even as they descended , [one]222-one saw [them]902-them twisting about to make Heaven knows what pattern on the floor of [the child]903-the child 's mind . What message would [Cam]91-cam give [the cook]904-the cook ? [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay wondered . And indeed it was only by waiting patiently , and hearing that there was [an old woman in [the kitchen]677-the kitchen with very red cheeks , drinking soup out of a basin]905-an old woman in the kitchen with very red cheeks , drinking soup out of a basin , that [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay at last prompted that parrot - like instinct which had picked up [Mildred]117-mildred 's words quite accurately and could now produce them , if one waited , in a colourless singsong . [Minta Doyle]77-minta and [Paul Rayley]78-paul had not come back then . That could only mean , [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay thought , one thing . [Andrew]71-andrew - even [[her]924-she husband]234-her husband admitted that [his]234-her husband gift for mathematics was extraordinary . And [Nancy]75-nancy and [Roger]73-roger , [they]932-they were both wild creatures now , scampering about over [the country]912-the country all day long . As for [Rose]69-rose , [her]69-rose mouth was too big , but [she]69-rose had a wonderful gift with [her]69-rose hands . If [they]934-they had charades , [Rose]69-rose made the dresses ; made everything ; liked best arranging tables , flowers , anything . [She]69-rose did not like it that [Jasper]72-jasper should shoot birds ; but it was only a stage ; [they]934-they all went through stages . Still , it was true . [They]934-they were happier now than [they]934-they would ever be again . A tenpenny tea set made [Cam]91-cam happy for days . Then the door sprang open and in [they]934-they came , fresh as roses , staring , wide awake , as if this coming into [the dining - room]279-the dining - room after breakfast , which [they]934-they did every day of [their]934-they lives , was a positive event to [them]934-they , and so on , with one thing after another , all day long , until [she]69-rose went up to say good - night to [them]934-they , and found [them]934-they netted in [their]934-they cots like birds among cherries and raspberries , still making up stories about some little bit of rubbish - something [they]934-they had heard , something [they]934-they had picked up in [the garden]371-the garden . [They]934-they all had [their]934-they little treasures ... And so [she]69-rose went down and said to [[her]69-rose husband]234-her husband , Why must [they]934-they grow up and lose it all ? Never will [they]934-they be so happy again . And [he]234-her husband was angry . Why take such a gloomy view of life ? [he]234-her husband said . It is not sensible . For it was odd ; and [she]69-rose believed it to be true ; that with all [his]234-her husband gloom and desperation [he]234-her husband was happier , more hopeful on the whole , than [she]69-rose was . Less exposed to human worries - perhaps that was it . [He]234-her husband had always [his]234-her husband work to fall back on . Not that [she]69-rose [herself]69-rose was " pessimistic , "[234-her husband] as [he]234-her husband accused [her]69-rose of being . Only [she]69-rose thought life - and a little strip of time presented itself to [her]69-rose eyes - [her]69-rose fifty years . There it was before [her]69-rose - life . Life , [she]69-rose thought - but [she]69-rose did not finish [her]69-rose thought . [She]69-rose took a look at life , for [she]69-rose had a clear sense of it there , something real , something private , which [she]69-rose shared neither with [[her]69-rose children]278-her children nor with [[her]69-rose husband]234-her husband . A sort of transaction went on between [them]945-them , in which [she]69-rose was on one side , and life was on another , and [she]69-rose was always trying to get the better of it , as it was of [her]69-rose ; and sometimes [they]945-them parleyed when [she]69-rose sat alone ; there were , [she]69-rose remembered , great reconciliation scenes ; but for the most part , oddly enough , [she]69-rose must admit that [she]69-rose felt this thing that [she]69-rose called life terrible , hostile , and quick to pounce on [you]946-you if [you]946-you gave it a chance . There were eternal problems : suffering ; death ; [the poor]947-the poor . There was always [a woman dying of cancer even here]948-a woman dying of cancer even here . And yet [she]69-rose had said to [all these children]949-all these children , [You]949-all these children shall go through it all . To [eight people]950-eight people [she]69-rose had said relentlessly that and the bill for the greenhouse would be fifty pounds . For that reason , knowing what was before [them]950-eight people - love and ambition and being wretched alone in dreary places - [she]69-rose had often the feeling , Why must [they]950-eight people grow up and lose it all ? And then [she]69-rose said to [herself]69-rose , brandishing [her]69-rose sword at life , Nonsense . [They]950-eight people will be perfectly happy . And here [she]69-rose was , [she]69-rose reflected , feeling life rather sinister again , making [Minta]77-minta marry [Paul Rayley]78-paul ; because whatever [she]69-rose might feel about [her]69-rose own transaction , [she]69-rose had had experiences which need not happen to every one [she]69-rose did not name them to [herself]69-rose ; [she]69-rose was driven on , too quickly [she]69-rose knew , almost as if it were an escape for [her]69-rose too , to say that [people]264-people must marry ; [people]264-people must have [children]325-children .

Was [she]69-rose wrong in this , [she]69-rose asked [herself]69-rose , reviewing [her]69-rose conduct for the past week or two , and wondering if [she]69-rose had indeed put any pressure upon [Minta]77-minta , who was only twenty - four , to make up [her]77-minta mind . [She]69-rose was uneasy . Had [she]69-rose not laughed about it ? Was [she]69-rose not forgetting again how strongly [she]69-rose influenced [people]264-people ? Marriage needed - oh , all sorts of qualities the bill for [the greenhouse]955-the greenhouse would be fifty pounds ; one - [she]69-rose need not name it - that was essential ; the thing [she]69-rose had with [[her]69-rose husband]234-her husband . Had [they]957-they that ?

" Then [he]234-her husband put on [his]234-her husband trousers and ran away like [a madman]2786-a madman , "[69-rose] [she]69-rose read . " But outside a great storm was raging and blowing so hard that [he]234-her husband could scarcely keep [his]234-her husband feet ; [houses]884-houses and trees toppled over , [the mountains]2722-the mountains trembled , rocks rolled into [the sea]220-the sea , the sky was pitch black , and it thundered and lightened , and [the sea]220-the sea came in with black waves as high as [church towers]2791-church towers and [mountains]2792-mountains , and all with white foam at the top . "[69-rose]

[She]69-rose turned the page ; there were only a few lines more , so that [she]69-rose would finish the story , though it was past bed - time . It was getting late . The light in [the garden]371-the garden told [her]69-rose that ; and the whitening of the flowers and something grey in the leaves conspired together , to rouse in [her]69-rose a feeling of anxiety . What it was about [she]69-rose could not think at first . Then [she]69-rose remembered ; [Paul]78-paul and [Minta]77-minta and [Andrew]71-andrew had not come back . [She]69-rose summoned before [her]69-rose again the little group on [the terrace in front of [the hall]914-the hall door]959-the terrace in front of the hall door , standing looking up into the sky . [Andrew]71-andrew had [his]71-andrew net and basket . That meant [he]71-andrew was going to catch crabs and things . That meant [he]71-andrew would climb out on to a rock ; [he]71-andrew would be cut off . Or coming back single file on one of those little paths above the cliff one of them might slip . [He]71-andrew would roll and then crash . It was growing quite dark .

But [she]69-rose did not let [her]69-rose voice change in the least as [she]69-rose finished the story , and added , shutting the book , and speaking the last words as if [she]69-rose had made them up [herself]69-rose , looking into [James]93-james 's eyes : " And there [they]2793-they are living still at this very time . "[69-rose]

" And that 's the end , "[69-rose] [she]69-rose said , and [she]69-rose saw in [his]93-james eyes , as the interest of the story died away in them , something else take its place ; something wondering , pale , like the reflection of a light , which at once made [him]93-james gaze and marvel . Turning , [she]69-rose looked across [the bay]446-the bay , and there , sure enough , coming regularly across the waves first two quick strokes and then one long steady stroke , was the light of [the Lighthouse]210-the lighthouse . [It]210-the lighthouse had been lit .

In a moment [he]93-james would ask [her]69-rose , " Are [we]963-we going to [the Lighthouse]210-the lighthouse ? "[93-james] And [she]69-rose would have to say , " No : not tomorrow ; [[your]93-james father]2795-your father says not . "[69-rose] Happily , [Mildred]117-mildred came in to fetch [them]963-we , and the bustle distracted [them]963-we . But [he]93-james kept looking back over [his]93-james shoulder as [Mildred]117-mildred carried [him]93-james out , and [she]69-rose was certain that [he]93-james was thinking , [we]963-we are not going to [the Lighthouse]210-the lighthouse tomorrow ; and [she]69-rose thought , [he]93-james will remember that all [his]93-james life .

11

No , [she]69-rose thought , putting together some of the pictures [he]93-james had cut out - a refrigerator , a mowing machine , [a gentleman in evening dress]965-a gentleman in evening dress - [children]325-children never forget . For this reason , it was so important what [one]222-one said , and what [one]222-one did , and it was a relief when [they]963-we went to bed . For now [she]69-rose need not think about [anybody]416-anybody . [She]69-rose could be [herself]69-rose , by [herself]69-rose . And that was what now [she]69-rose often felt the need of - to think ; well , not even to think . To be silent ; to be alone . All the being and the doing , expansive , glittering , vocal , evaporated ; and [one]222-one shrunk , with a sense of solemnity , to being oneself , a wedge - shaped core of darkness , something invisible to [others]971-others . Although [she]69-rose continued to knit , and sat upright , it was thus that [she]69-rose felt [herself]69-rose ; and [this self]972-this self having shed its attachments was free for the strangest adventures . When life sank down for a moment , the range of experience seemed limitless . And to [everybody]973-everybody there was always this sense of unlimited resources , [she]69-rose supposed ; one after another , [she]69-rose , [Lily]86-lily , [Augustus Carmichael]79-augustus carmichael , must feel , [our]974-us apparitions , the things [you]975-you know [us]974-us by , are simply childish . Beneath it is all dark , it is all spreading , it is unfathomably deep ; but now and again [we]974-us rise to the surface and that is what [you]975-you see [us]974-us by . [Her]69-rose horizon seemed to [her]69-rose limitless . There were all the places [she]69-rose had not seen ; [the Indian plains]976-the indian plains ; [she]69-rose felt [herself]69-rose pushing aside the thick leather curtain of [a church in [Rome]32-rome]977-a church in rome . [This core of darkness]978-this core of darkness could go anywhere , for [no one]477-no one saw it . [They]980-they could not stop it , [she]69-rose thought , exulting . There was freedom , there was peace , there was , most welcome of all , a summoning together , a resting on a platform of stability . Not as [oneself]981-oneself did [one]222-one find rest ever , in [her]69-rose experience [she]69-rose accomplished here something dexterous with [her]69-rose needles but as a wedge of darkness . Losing personality , [one]222-one lost the fret , the hurry , the stir ; and there rose to [her]69-rose lips always some exclamation of triumph over life when things came together in this peace , this rest , this eternity ; and pausing there [she]69-rose looked out to meet that stroke of the Lighthouse , the long steady stroke , the last of the three , which was [her]69-rose stroke , for watching [them]984-them in this mood always at this hour one could not help attaching [oneself]981-oneself to one thing especially of the things [one]981-oneself saw ; and this thing , the long steady stroke , was [her]69-rose stroke . Often [she]69-rose found [herself]69-rose sitting and looking , sitting and looking , with [her]69-rose work in [her]69-rose hands until [she]69-rose became the thing [she]69-rose looked at - that light , for example . And it would lift up on it some little phrase or other which had been lying in [her]69-rose mind like that - " [Children]325-children do n't forget , [children]325-children do n't forget "[69-rose] - which [she]69-rose would repeat and begin adding to it , It will end , it will end , [she]69-rose said . It will come , it will come , when suddenly [she]69-rose added , [We]985-we are in the hands of [the Lord]986-the lord .

But instantly [she]69-rose was annoyed with [herself]69-rose for saying that . Who had said it ? Not [she]69-rose ; [she]69-rose had been trapped into saying something [she]69-rose did not mean . [She]69-rose looked up over [her]69-rose knitting and met the third stroke and it seemed to [her]69-rose like [her]69-rose own eyes meeting [her]69-rose own eyes , searching as [she]69-rose alone could search into [her]69-rose mind and [her]69-rose heart , purifying out of existence that lie , any lie . [She]69-rose praised [herself]69-rose in praising the light , without vanity , for [she]69-rose was stern , [she]69-rose was searching , [she]69-rose was beautiful like that light . It was odd , [she]69-rose thought , how if [one]222-one was alone , [one leant to inanimate things]988-one leant to inanimate things ; trees , streams , flowers ; felt [they]988-one leant to inanimate things expressed one ; felt [they]988-one leant to inanimate things became [one]222-one ; felt [they]988-one leant to inanimate things knew [one]222-one , in a sense were one ; felt an irrational tenderness thus [she]69-rose looked at that long steady light as for [oneself]991-oneself . There rose , and [she]69-rose looked and looked with [her]69-rose needles suspended , there curled up off the floor of the mind , rose from the lake of one 's being , a mist , [a bride]992-a bride to meet [[her]992-a bride lover]993-her lover .

What brought [her]69-rose to say that : " [We]2798-we are in the hands of [the Lord]986-the lord ? "[69-rose] [she]69-rose wondered . The insincerity slipping in among the truths roused [her]69-rose , annoyed [her]69-rose . [She]69-rose returned to [her]69-rose knitting again . How could [any Lord]994-any lord have made [this world]489-this world ? [she]69-rose asked . With [her]69-rose mind [she]69-rose had always seized the fact that there is no reason , order , justice : but suffering , death , [the poor]947-the poor . There was no treachery too base for [the world]300-the world to commit ; [she]69-rose knew that . No happiness lasted ; [she]69-rose knew that . [She]69-rose knitted with firm composure , slightly pursing [her]69-rose lips and , without being aware of it , so stiffened and composed the lines of [her]69-rose face in a habit of sternness that when [[her]69-rose husband]234-her husband passed , though [he]234-her husband was chuckling at the thought that [Hume]114-hume , [the philosopher]999-the philosopher , grown enormously fat , had stuck in a bog , [he]234-her husband could not help noting , as [he]234-her husband passed , the sternness at the heart of [her]69-rose beauty . It saddened [him]234-her husband , and [her]69-rose remoteness pained [him]234-her husband , and [he]234-her husband felt , as [he]234-her husband passed , that [he]234-her husband could not protect [her]69-rose , and , when [he]234-her husband reached the hedge , [he]234-her husband was sad . [He]234-her husband could do nothing to help [her]69-rose . [He]234-her husband must stand by and watch [her]69-rose . Indeed , the infernal truth was , [he]234-her husband made things worse for [her]69-rose . [He]234-her husband was irritable - [he]234-her husband was touchy . [He]234-her husband had lost [his]234-her husband temper over [the Lighthouse]49-the lighthouse . [He]234-her husband looked into the hedge , into its intricacy , its darkness .

Always , [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay felt , [one]222-one helped [oneself]222-one out of solitude reluctantly by laying hold of some little odd or end , some sound , some sight . [She]65-mrs. ramsay listened , but it was all very still ; cricket was over ; [the children]258-the children were in [their]258-the children baths ; there was only the sound of [the sea]220-the sea . [She]65-mrs. ramsay stopped knitting ; [she]65-mrs. ramsay held the long reddish - brown stocking dangling in [her]65-mrs. ramsay hands a moment . [She]65-mrs. ramsay saw the light again . With some irony in [her]65-mrs. ramsay interrogation , for when [one]222-one woke at all , [one]222-one 's relations changed , [she]65-mrs. ramsay looked at the steady light , the pitiless , the remorseless , which was so much [her]65-mrs. ramsay , yet so little [her]65-mrs. ramsay , which had [her]65-mrs. ramsay at its beck and call [she]65-mrs. ramsay woke in the night and saw [it]1005-it bent across [their]1006-their bed , stroking the floor , but for all that [she]65-mrs. ramsay thought , watching it with fascination , hypnotised , as if it were stroking with its silver fingers some sealed vessel in [her]65-mrs. ramsay brain whose bursting would flood [her]65-mrs. ramsay with delight , [she]65-mrs. ramsay had known happiness , exquisite happiness , intense happiness , and it silvered the rough waves a little more brightly , as daylight faded , and the blue went out of [the sea]220-the sea and it rolled in waves of pure lemon which curved and swelled and broke upon [the beach]366-the beach and the ecstasy burst in [her]65-mrs. ramsay eyes and waves of pure delight raced over the floor of [her]65-mrs. ramsay mind and [she]65-mrs. ramsay felt , It is enough ! It is enough !

[He]1009-he turned and saw [her]65-mrs. ramsay . Ah ! [She]65-mrs. ramsay was lovely , lovelier now than ever [he]1009-he thought . But [he]1009-he could not speak to [her]65-mrs. ramsay . [He]1009-he could not interrupt [her]65-mrs. ramsay . [He]1009-he wanted urgently to speak to [her]65-mrs. ramsay now that [James]93-james was gone and [she]65-mrs. ramsay was alone at last . But [he]1009-he resolved , no ; [he]1009-he would not interrupt [her]65-mrs. ramsay . [She]65-mrs. ramsay was aloof from [him]1009-he now in [her]65-mrs. ramsay beauty , in [her]65-mrs. ramsay sadness . [He]1009-he would let [her]65-mrs. ramsay be , and [he]1009-he passed [her]65-mrs. ramsay without a word , though it hurt [him]1009-he that [she]65-mrs. ramsay should look so distant , and [he]1009-he could not reach [her]65-mrs. ramsay , [he]1009-he could do nothing to help [her]65-mrs. ramsay . And again [he]1009-he would have passed [her]65-mrs. ramsay without a word had [she]65-mrs. ramsay not , at that very moment , given [him]1009-he of [her]65-mrs. ramsay own free will what [she]65-mrs. ramsay knew [he]1009-he would never ask , and called to [him]1009-he and taken the green shawl off the picture frame , and gone to [him]1009-he . For [he]1009-he wished , [she]65-mrs. ramsay knew , to protect [her]65-mrs. ramsay .

12

[She]65-mrs. ramsay folded the green shawl about [her]65-mrs. ramsay shoulders . [She]65-mrs. ramsay took [his]1009-he arm . [His]1009-he beauty was so great , [she]65-mrs. ramsay said , beginning to speak of [Kennedy]125-kennedy [the gardener]1010-the gardener , at once [he]1009-he was so awfully handsome , that [she]65-mrs. ramsay could n't dismiss [him]1009-he . There was a ladder against [the greenhouse]955-the greenhouse , and little lumps of putty stuck about , for [they]1012-they were beginning to mend the greenhouse . Yes , but as [she]65-mrs. ramsay strolled along with [[her]65-mrs. ramsay husband]234-her husband , [she]65-mrs. ramsay felt that that particular source of worry had been placed . [[Her]65-mrs. ramsay husband]234-her husband was so sensible , so just . [She]65-mrs. ramsay supposed it was all right leaving [him]234-her husband to [his]234-her husband own devices , [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay said , wondering whether it was any use sending down bulbs ; did [they]258-the children plant them ? " Well , then , look tonight , "[65-mrs. ramsay] said [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay . [They]1025-they paused . [He]67-mr. ramsay wished [Andrew]71-andrew could be induced to work harder . Suddenly [she]65-mrs. ramsay remembered those little paths on [the edge of [the cliffs]1027-the cliffs]1026-the edge of the cliffs .

Was n't it late ? [she]65-mrs. ramsay asked . [They]1025-they had n't come [home]378-home yet . [He]71-andrew flicked [his]71-andrew watch carelessly open . But it was only just past seven . [He]71-andrew held [his]71-andrew watch open for a moment , deciding that [he]71-andrew would tell [her]65-mrs. ramsay what [he]71-andrew had felt on [the terrace]225-the terrace . Then , [he]71-andrew wanted to tell [her]65-mrs. ramsay that when [he]71-andrew was walking on [the terrace]225-the terrace just now - here [he]71-andrew became uncomfortable , as if [he]71-andrew were breaking into that solitude , that aloofness , that remoteness of [hers]65-mrs. ramsay . But [she]65-mrs. ramsay pressed [him]71-andrew .
