"[71-andrew] But no . [He]71-andrew did not like to see [her]65-mrs. ramsay look so sad , [he]71-andrew said . Only wool gathering , [she]65-mrs. ramsay protested , flushing a little . [They]1032-they both felt uncomfortable , as if [they]1032-they did not know whether to go on or go back . [She]65-mrs. ramsay had been reading fairy tales to [James]93-james , [she]65-mrs. ramsay said . No , [they]1032-they could not share that ; [they]1032-they could not say that .

[They]1032-they had reached the gap between the two clumps of red - hot pokers , and there was [the Lighthouse]210-the lighthouse again , but [she]65-mrs. ramsay would not let [herself]65-mrs. ramsay look at [it]210-the lighthouse . Had [she]65-mrs. ramsay known that [he]71-andrew was looking at [her]65-mrs. ramsay , [she]65-mrs. ramsay thought , [she]65-mrs. ramsay would not have let [herself]65-mrs. ramsay sit there , thinking . [She]65-mrs. ramsay disliked anything that reminded [her]65-mrs. ramsay that [she]65-mrs. ramsay had been seen sitting thinking . So [she]65-mrs. ramsay looked over [her]65-mrs. ramsay shoulder , at [the town]231-the town . The lights were rippling and running as if they were drops of silver water held firm in a wind . And all the poverty , all the suffering had turned to that , [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay thought . The lights of [the town]231-the town and of [the harbour]1036-the harbour and of [the boats]1037-the boats seemed like a phantom net floating there to mark something which had sunk . Well , if [he]71-andrew could not share [her]65-mrs. ramsay thoughts , [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay said to [himself]71-andrew , [he]71-andrew would be off , then , on [his]71-andrew own . [He]71-andrew wanted to go on thinking , telling [himself]71-andrew the story how [Hume]114-hume was stuck in [a bog]1038-a bog ; [he]71-andrew wanted to laugh . But first it was nonsense to be anxious about [Andrew]71-andrew . When [he]71-andrew was [Andrew]71-andrew 's age [he]71-andrew used to walk about [the country]912-the country all day long , with nothing but a biscuit in [his]71-andrew pocket and [nobody]216-nobody bothered about [him]71-andrew , or thought that [he]71-andrew had fallen over [a cliff]1041-a cliff . [He]71-andrew said aloud [he]71-andrew thought [he]71-andrew would be off for a day 's walk if the weather held . [He]71-andrew had had about enough of [Bankes]90-mr. bankes and of [Carmichael]80-mr. carmichael . [He]71-andrew would like a little solitude . Yes , [she]1042-she said . It annoyed [him]71-andrew that [she]1042-she did not protest . [She]1042-she knew that [he]71-andrew would never do it . [He]71-andrew was too old now to walk all day long with a biscuit in [his]71-andrew pocket . [She]1042-she worried about [the boys]309-the boys , but not about [him]71-andrew . Years ago , before [he]71-andrew had married , [he]71-andrew thought , looking across [the bay]446-the bay , as [they]1045-they stood between the clumps of red - hot pokers , [he]71-andrew had walked all day . [He]71-andrew had made a meal off bread and cheese in [a public house]1046-a public house . [He]71-andrew had worked ten hours at a stretch ; [an old woman]239-an old woman just popped [her]239-an old woman head in now and again and saw to the fire . That was [the country [he]71-andrew liked best]1048-the country he liked best , over [there]236-there ; [those sandhills]479-those sandhills dwindling away into darkness . [One]222-one could walk all day without meeting [a soul]1052-a soul . There was not [a house scarcely]1053-a house scarcely , not [a single village]1054-a single village for [miles on end]1055-miles on end . [One]222-one could worry things out alone . There were [little sandy beaches where [no one]477-no one had been since the beginning of time]1057-little sandy beaches where no one had been since the beginning of time . [The seals]1059-the seals sat up and looked at [you]1060-you . It sometimes seemed to [him]71-andrew that in [a little house out there , alone]1061-a little house out there , alone - [he]71-andrew broke off , sighing . [He]71-andrew had no right . [The father of [eight children]383-eight children]2735-the father of eight children - [he]71-andrew reminded [himself]71-andrew . And [he]71-andrew would have been a beast and [a cur to wish a single thing altered]1064-a cur to wish a single thing altered . [Andrew]71-andrew would be [a better man than [he]71-andrew had been]1065-a better man than he had been . [Prue]94-prue would be [a beauty]1066-a beauty , [[her]94-prue mother]897-her mother said . [They]1068-they would stem the flood a bit . That was a good bit of work on the whole - [[his]71-andrew eight children]1069-his eight children . [They]1068-they showed [he]71-andrew did not damn the poor little universe entirely , for on an evening like this , [he]71-andrew thought , looking at [the land]1070-the land dwindling away , [the little island]1071-the little island seemed pathetically small , half swallowed up in [the sea]220-the sea .

" [Poor little place]2806-poor little place , "[71-andrew] [he]71-andrew murmured with a sigh .

[She]897-her mother heard [him]71-andrew . [He]71-andrew said the most melancholy things , but [she]897-her mother noticed that directly [he]71-andrew had said them [he]71-andrew always seemed more cheerful than usual . All this phrase - making was a game , [she]897-her mother thought , for if [she]897-her mother had said half what [he]71-andrew said , [she]897-her mother would have blown [her]897-her mother brains out by now .

It annoyed [her]897-her mother , this phrase - making , and [she]897-her mother said to [him]71-andrew , in a matter- of - fact way , that it was a perfectly lovely evening . And what was [he]71-andrew groaning about , [she]897-her mother asked , half laughing , half complaining , for [she]897-her mother guessed what [he]71-andrew was thinking - [he]71-andrew would have written better books if [he]71-andrew had not married .

[He]71-andrew was not complaining , [he]71-andrew said . [She]897-her mother knew that [he]71-andrew did not complain . [She]897-her mother knew that [he]71-andrew had nothing whatever to complain of . And [he]71-andrew seized [her]897-her mother hand and raised it to [his]71-andrew lips and kissed it with an intensity that brought the tears to [her]897-her mother eyes , and quickly [he]71-andrew dropped it .

[They]1073-they turned away from the view and began to walk up the path where the silver - green spear - like plants grew , arm in arm . [His]71-andrew arm was almost like [a young man]1074-a young man 's arm , [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay thought , thin and hard , and [she]897-her mother thought with delight how strong [he]71-andrew still was , though [he]71-andrew was over sixty , and how untamed and optimistic , and how strange it was that being convinced , as [he]71-andrew was , of all sorts of horrors , seemed not to depress [him]71-andrew , but to cheer [him]71-andrew . Was it not odd , [she]897-her mother reflected ? Indeed [he]71-andrew seemed to [her]897-her mother sometimes made differently from [other people]332-other people , born blind , deaf , and dumb , to the ordinary things , but to the extraordinary things , with an eye like an eagle 's . [His]71-andrew understanding often astonished [her]897-her mother . But did [he]71-andrew notice the flowers ? No . Did [he]71-andrew notice the view ? No . Did [he]71-andrew even notice [[his]71-andrew own daughter]1076-his own daughter 's beauty , or whether there was pudding on [his]71-andrew plate or roast beef ? [He]71-andrew would sit at table with [them]1077-them like [a person in a dream]1078-a person in a dream . And [his]71-andrew habit of talking aloud , or saying poetry aloud , was growing on [him]71-andrew , [she]897-her mother was afraid ; for sometimes it was awkward -

Best and brightest come away !

poor [Miss Giddings]126-miss giddings , when [he]71-andrew shouted that at [her]897-her mother , almost jumped out of [her]897-her mother skin . But then , [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay , though instantly taking [his]71-andrew side against all the silly Giddingses in [the world]300-the world , then , [she]897-her mother thought , intimating by a little pressure on [his]71-andrew arm that [he]71-andrew walked up hill too fast for [her]897-her mother , and [she]897-her mother must stop for a moment to see whether those were fresh molehills on [the bank]482-the bank , then , [she]897-her mother thought , stooping down to look , a great mind like [his]71-andrew must be different in every way from [ours]1081-ours . [All the great men [she]897-her mother had ever known]1082-all the great men she had ever known , [she]897-her mother thought , deciding that a rabbit must have got in , were like that , and it was good for [young men]814-young men though the atmosphere of [lecture - rooms]1084-lecture - rooms was stuffy and depressing to [her]897-her mother beyond endurance almost simply to hear [him]71-andrew , simply to look at [him]71-andrew . But without shooting rabbits , how was one to keep them down ? [she]897-her mother wondered . It might be a rabbit ; it might be a mole . Some creature anyhow was ruining [her]897-her mother Evening Primroses . And looking up , [she]897-her mother saw above the thin trees the first pulse of the full - throbbing star , and wanted to make [[her]897-her mother husband]234-her husband look at it ; for the sight gave [her]897-her mother such keen pleasure . But [she]897-her mother stopped [herself]897-her mother . [He]234-her husband never looked at things . If [he]234-her husband did , all [he]234-her husband would say would be , Poor little world , with one of [his]234-her husband sighs .

At that moment , [he]234-her husband said , " Very fine , "[234-her husband] to please [her]897-her mother , and pretended to admire the flowers . But [she]897-her mother knew quite well that [he]234-her husband did not admire them , or even realise that they were there . It was only to please [her]897-her mother . Ah , but was that not [Lily Briscoe]86-lily strolling along with [William Bankes]87-william bankes ? [She]897-her mother focussed [her]897-her mother short - sighted eyes upon the backs of [a retreating couple]1086-a retreating couple . Yes , indeed it was . Did that not mean that [they]1086-a retreating couple would marry ? Yes , it must ! What an admirable idea ! [They]1086-a retreating couple must marry !

13

[He]234-her husband had been to [Amsterdam]34-amsterdam , [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes was saying as [he]90-mr. bankes strolled across [the lawn]310-the lawn with [Lily Briscoe]86-lily . [He]234-her husband had seen [the Rembrandts]127-the rembrandts . [He]234-her husband had been to [Madrid]35-madrid . Unfortunately , it was Good Friday and [the Prado]1088-the prado was shut . [He]234-her husband had been to [Rome]32-rome . Had [Miss Briscoe]89-miss briscoe never been to [Rome]32-rome ? Oh , [she]89-miss briscoe should - It would be a wonderful experience for [her]89-miss briscoe - [the Sistine Chapel]1089-the sistine chapel ; [Michael Angelo]103-michael angelo ; and [Padua]36-padua , with [[its]36-padua Giottos]1090-its giottos . [[His]90-mr. bankes wife]204-his wife had been in bad health for many years , so that [their]1092-their sight - seeing had been on a modest scale .

[She]204-his wife had been to [Brussels]37-brussels ; [she]204-his wife had been to [Paris]2-paris but only for a flying visit to see [an aunt who was ill]1093-an aunt who was ill . [She]204-his wife had been to [Dresden]38-dresden ; there were masses of pictures [she]204-his wife had not seen ; however , [Lily Briscoe]86-lily reflected , perhaps it was better not to see pictures : they only made [one]222-one hopelessly discontented with [one]222-one 's own work . [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes thought [one]222-one could carry that point of view too far . [We]1097-we ca n't all be [Titians]128-titians and [we]1097-we ca n't all be [Darwins]129-darwins , [he]90-mr. bankes said ; at the same time [he]90-mr. bankes doubted whether [you]1098-your could have [your]1098-your [Darwin]130-darwin and [your]1098-your Titian if it were n't for [humble people like [ourselves]1097-we]1099-humble people like ourselves . [Lily]86-lily would have liked to pay [him]90-mr. bankes a compliment ; [you]90-mr. bankes 're not humble , [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes , [she]86-lily would have liked to have said . But [he]90-mr. bankes did not want compliments [most men]1100-most men do , [she]86-lily thought , and [she]86-lily was a little ashamed of [her]86-lily impulse and said nothing while [he]90-mr. bankes remarked that perhaps what [he]90-mr. bankes was saying did not apply to pictures . Anyhow , said [Lily]86-lily , tossing off [her]86-lily little insincerity , [she]86-lily would always go on painting , because it interested [her]86-lily . Yes , said [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes , [he]90-mr. bankes was sure [she]86-lily would , and , as [they]1101-they reached the end of [the lawn]310-the lawn [he]90-mr. bankes was asking [her]86-lily whether [she]86-lily had difficulty in finding subjects in [London]11-london when [they]1101-they turned and saw [the Ramsays]82-the ramsays . So that is marriage , [Lily]86-lily thought , [a man]1103-a man and [a woman]376-a woman looking at [a girl throwing a ball]1105-a girl throwing a ball . That is what [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay tried to tell [me]0-i the other night , [she]86-lily thought . For [she]86-lily was wearing a green shawl , and [they]1101-they were standing close together watching [Prue]94-prue and [Jasper]72-jasper throwing catches . And suddenly the meaning which , for no reason at all , as perhaps [they]1101-they are stepping out of the Tube or ringing a doorbell , descends on [people]264-people , making [them]264-people symbolical , making [them]264-people representative , came upon [them]264-people , and made [them]264-people in the dusk standing , looking , the symbols of marriage , [husband]1107-husband and [wife]2747-wife . Then , after an instant , the symbolical outline which transcended the real figures sank down again , and [they]1101-they became , as [they]1101-they met [them]1101-they , [Mr.]1109-mr. and [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay watching [the children]258-the children throwing catches . But still for a moment , though [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay greeted [them]1101-they with [her]65-mrs. ramsay usual smile oh , [she]65-mrs. ramsay 's thinking [we]1111-we 're going to get married , [Lily]86-lily thought and said , " [I]86-lily have triumphed tonight , "[86-lily] meaning that for once [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes had agreed to dine with [them]1101-they and not run off to [[his]90-mr. bankes own lodging where [[his]90-mr. bankes man]1113-his man cooked vegetables properly]1112-his own lodging where his man cooked vegetables properly ; still , for one moment , there was a sense of things having been blown apart , of space , of irresponsibility as the ball soared high , and [they]1101-they followed it and lost it and saw the one star and the draped branches . In the failing light [they]1101-they all looked sharp - edged and ethereal and divided by great distances . Then , darting backwards over the vast space for it seemed as if solidity had vanished altogether , [Prue]94-prue ran full tilt into [them]1101-they and caught the ball brilliantly high up in [her]94-prue left hand , and [[her]94-prue mother]897-her mother said , " Have n't [they]1101-they come back yet ? "[94-prue] whereupon the spell was broken . [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay felt free now to laugh out loud at the thought that [Hume]114-hume had stuck in a bog and [an old woman]239-an old woman rescued [him]67-mr. ramsay on condition [he]67-mr. ramsay said [the Lord]986-the lord 's Prayer , and chuckling to [himself]67-mr. ramsay [he]67-mr. ramsay strolled off to [[his]67-mr. ramsay study]1117-his study . [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay , bringing [Prue]94-prue back into throwing catches again , from which [she]94-prue had escaped , asked ,

" Did [Nancy]75-nancy go with [them]1118-them ? "[65-mrs. ramsay]

14

Certainly , [Nancy]75-nancy had gone with [them]1118-them , since [Minta Doyle]77-minta had asked it with [her]77-minta dumb look , holding out [her]77-minta hand , as [Nancy]75-nancy made off , after lunch , to [[her]75-nancy attic]1119-her attic , to escape the horror of family life . [She]75-nancy supposed [she]75-nancy must go then . [She]75-nancy did not want to go . [She]75-nancy did not want to be drawn into it all . For as [they]1118-them walked along [the road]305-the road to [the cliff]1121-the cliff [Minta]77-minta kept on taking [her]75-nancy hand . Then [she]77-minta would let it go . Then [she]77-minta would take it again . What was it [she]77-minta wanted ? [Nancy]75-nancy asked [herself]75-nancy . There was something , of course , that [people]264-people wanted ; for when [Minta]77-minta took [her]75-nancy hand and held it , [Nancy]75-nancy , reluctantly , saw [the whole world]800-the whole world spread out beneath [her]77-minta , as if it were Constantinople seen through a mist , and then , however heavy - eyed one might be , one must needs ask , " Is that [Santa Sofia]131-santa sofia ? "[77-minta] " Is that the Golden Horn ? "[77-minta] So [Nancy]75-nancy asked , when [Minta]77-minta took [her]75-nancy hand . " What is it that [she]77-minta wants ? Is it that ? "[77-minta] And what was that ? Here and there emerged from the mist as [Nancy]75-nancy looked down upon life spread beneath [her]75-nancy a pinnacle , a dome ; prominent things , without names . But when [Minta]77-minta dropped [her]77-minta hand , as [she]77-minta did when [they]1124-they ran down [the hillside]1125-the hillside , all that , the dome , the pinnacle , whatever it was that had protruded through the mist , sank down into it and disappeared . [Minta]77-minta , [Andrew]71-andrew observed , was rather [a good walker]1126-a good walker . [She]77-minta wore more sensible clothes that [most women]1127-most women . [She]77-minta wore very short skirts and black knickerbockers . [She]77-minta would jump straight into [a stream]1128-a stream and flounder across . [He]71-andrew liked [her]77-minta rashness , but [he]71-andrew saw that it would not do - [she]77-minta would kill [herself]77-minta in some idiotic way one of these days . [She]77-minta seemed to be afraid of nothing - except bulls . At the mere sight of a bull in [a field]1129-a field [she]77-minta would throw up [her]77-minta arms and fly screaming , which was the very thing to enrage a bull of course . But [she]77-minta did not mind owning up to it in the least ; [one]222-one must admit that . [She]77-minta knew [she]77-minta was an awful coward about bulls , [she]77-minta said . [She]77-minta thought [she]77-minta must have been tossed in [her]77-minta perambulator when [she]77-minta was [a baby]936-a baby . [She]77-minta did n't seem to mind what [she]77-minta said or did . Suddenly now [she]77-minta pitched down on the edge of [the cliff]1121-the cliff and began to sing some song about

Damn [your]1133-your eyes , damn [your]1133-your eyes .

[They]1134-they all had to join in and sing the chorus , and shout out together :

Damn [your]1133-your eyes , damn [your]1133-your eyes ,

but it would be fatal to let the tide come in and cover up all the good hunting - grounds before [they]1134-they got on to [the beach]366-the beach .

" Fatal , "[78-paul] [Paul]78-paul agreed , springing up , and as [they]1134-they went slithering down , [he]78-paul kept quoting the guide - book about " [these islands]2807-these islands being justly celebrated for [their]2807-these islands park - like prospects and the extent and variety of [their]2807-these islands marine curiosities . "[78-paul] But it would not do altogether , this shouting and damning [your]1133-your eyes , [Andrew]71-andrew felt , picking [his]71-andrew way down [the cliff]1121-the cliff , this clapping [him]71-andrew on the back , and calling [him]71-andrew " [old fellow]2808-old fellow "[71-andrew] and all that ; it would not altogether do . It was the worst of taking [women]600-women on walks . Once on [the beach]366-the beach [they]1134-they separated , [he]71-andrew going out on to the [Pope]132-pope 's Nose , taking [his]71-andrew shoes off , and rolling [his]71-andrew socks in them and letting [that couple]1139-that couple look after [themselves]1139-that couple ; [Nancy]75-nancy waded out to [[her]75-nancy own rocks]1140-her own rocks and searched [[her]75-nancy own pools]1141-her own pools and let [that couple]1139-that couple look after [themselves]1139-that couple . [She]75-nancy crouched low down and touched the smooth rubber - like sea anemones , who were stuck like lumps of jelly to the side of [the rock]1143-the rock . [Brooding]133-brooding , [she]75-nancy changed the pool into [the sea]220-the sea , and made the minnows into sharks and whales , and cast vast clouds over [this tiny world]1145-this tiny world by holding [her]75-nancy hand against the sun , and so brought darkness and desolation , like [God]134-god [himself]134-god , to millions of [ignorant and innocent creatures]1146-ignorant and innocent creatures , and then took [her]75-nancy hand away suddenly and let the sun stream down . Out on the pale criss - crossed sand , high - stepping , fringed , gauntleted , stalked some fantastic leviathan [she]75-nancy was still enlarging [the pool]1147-the pool , and slipped into the vast fissures of [the mountain side]1148-the mountain side . And then , letting [her]75-nancy eyes slide imperceptibly above [the pool]1147-the pool and rest on that wavering line of sea and sky , on the tree trunks which the smoke of steamers made waver on the horizon , [she]75-nancy became with all that power sweeping savagely in and inevitably withdrawing , hypnotised , and the two senses of that vastness and this tininess [the pool]1147-the pool had diminished again flowering within it made [her]75-nancy feel that [she]75-nancy was bound hand and foot and unable to move by the intensity of feelings which reduced [her]75-nancy own body , [her]75-nancy own life , and the lives of [all the people in [the world]300-the world]1151-all the people in the world , for ever , to nothingness . So listening to the waves , crouching over [the pool]1147-the pool , [she]75-nancy brooded .

And [Andrew]71-andrew shouted that [the sea]220-the sea was coming in , so [she]75-nancy leapt splashing through the shallow waves on to [the shore]1155-the shore and ran up [the beach]366-the beach and was carried by [her]75-nancy own impetuosity and [her]75-nancy desire for rapid movement right behind a rock and there - oh , heavens ! in [each other]1157-each other 's arms , were [Paul]78-paul and [Minta]77-minta kissing probably . [She]75-nancy was outraged , indignant . [She]75-nancy and [Andrew]71-andrew put on [their]1158-they shoes and stockings in dead silence without saying a thing about it . Indeed [they]1158-they were rather sharp with each other . [She]75-nancy might have called [him]71-andrew when [she]75-nancy saw the crayfish or whatever it was , [Andrew]71-andrew grumbled . However , [they]1158-they both felt , it 's not [our]1158-they fault . [They]1158-they had not wanted this horrid nuisance to happen . All the same it irritated [Andrew]71-andrew that [Nancy]75-nancy should be [a woman]376-a woman , and [Nancy]75-nancy that [Andrew]71-andrew should be [a man]1103-a man , and [they]1158-they tied [their]1158-they shoes very neatly and drew the bows rather tight .

It was not until [they]1158-they had climbed right up on to [the top of [the cliff]1121-the cliff]1161-the top of the cliff again that [Minta]77-minta cried out that [she]77-minta had lost [[her]77-minta grandmother]1163-her grandmother 's brooch - [[her]77-minta grandmother]1163-her grandmother 's brooch , the sole ornament [she]77-minta possessed - a weeping willow , it was [they]1158-they must remember it set in pearls . [They]1158-they must have seen it , [she]77-minta said , with the tears running down [her]77-minta cheeks , the brooch which [[her]77-minta grandmother]1163-her grandmother had fastened [her]77-minta cap with till the last day of [her]77-minta life . Now [she]77-minta had lost it . [She]77-minta would rather have lost anything than that ! [She]77-minta would go back and look for it . [They]1158-they all went back . [They]1158-they poked and peered and looked . [They]1158-they kept [their]1158-they heads very low , and said things shortly and gruffly . [Paul Rayley]78-paul searched like [a madman]2786-a madman all about the rock where [they]1158-they had been sitting . All this pother about a brooch really did n't do at all , [Andrew]71-andrew thought , as [Paul]78-paul told [him]71-andrew to make a " thorough search between this point and that . "[78-paul] The tide was coming in fast . [The sea]220-the sea would cover the place where [they]1158-they had sat in a minute . There was not a ghost of a chance of [their]1158-they finding it now . " [We]1158-they shall be cut off ! "[77-minta] [Minta]77-minta shrieked , suddenly terrified . As if there were any danger of that ! It was the same as the bulls all over again - [she]77-minta had no control over [her]77-minta emotions , [Andrew]71-andrew thought . [Women]600-women had n't . [The wretched Paul]78-paul had to pacify [her]77-minta . [The men]398-the men [Andrew]71-andrew and [Paul]78-paul at once became manly , and different from usual took counsel briefly and decided that [they]398-the men would plant [Rayley]78-paul 's stick where [they]398-the men had sat and come back at low tide again . There was nothing more that could be done now . If the brooch was there , it would still be there in the morning , [they]398-the men assured [her]77-minta , but [Minta]77-minta still sobbed , all the way up to [the top of [the cliff]1121-the cliff]1161-the top of the cliff . It was [[her]77-minta grandmother]1163-her grandmother 's brooch ; [she]77-minta would rather have lost anything but that , and yet [Nancy]75-nancy felt , it might be true that [she]77-minta minded losing [her]77-minta brooch , but [she]77-minta was n't crying only for that . [She]77-minta was crying for something else . [We]1173-we might all sit down and cry , [she]77-minta felt . But [she]77-minta did not know what for .

[They]398-the men drew ahead together , [Paul]78-paul and [Minta]77-minta , and [he]78-paul comforted [her]77-minta , and said how famous [he]78-paul was for finding things . Once when [he]78-paul was [a little boy]1174-a little boy [he]78-paul had found a gold watch . [He]78-paul would get up at daybreak and [he]78-paul was positive [he]78-paul would find it . It seemed to [him]78-paul that it would be almost dark , and [he]78-paul would be alone on [the beach]366-the beach , and somehow it would be rather dangerous . [He]78-paul began telling [her]77-minta , however , that [he]78-paul would certainly find it , and [she]77-minta said that [she]77-minta would not hear of [his]78-paul getting up at dawn : it was lost : [she]77-minta knew that : [she]77-minta had had a presentiment when [she]77-minta put it on that afternoon . And secretly [he]78-paul resolved that [he]78-paul would not tell [her]77-minta , but [he]78-paul would slip out of [the house]299-the house at dawn when [they]1177-they were all asleep and if [he]78-paul could not find it [he]78-paul would go to [Edinburgh]39-edinburgh and buy [her]77-minta another , just like it but more beautiful . [He]78-paul would prove what [he]78-paul could do . And as [they]1177-they came out on [the hill]1178-the hill and saw the lights of [the town]231-the town beneath [them]1177-they , the lights coming out suddenly one by one seemed like things that were going to happen to [him]78-paul - [his]78-paul marriage , [[his]78-paul children]202-his children , [[his]78-paul house]571-his house ; and again [he]78-paul thought , as [they]1177-they came out on to [the high road]1182-the high road , which was shaded with high bushes , how [they]1177-they would retreat into solitude together , and walk on and on , [he]78-paul always leading [her]77-minta , and [she]77-minta pressing close to [his]78-paul side as [she]77-minta did now . As [they]1177-they turned by [the cross roads]1183-the cross roads [he]78-paul thought what an appalling experience [he]78-paul had been through , and [he]78-paul must tell [some one]386-some one - [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay of course , for it took [his]78-paul breath away to think what [he]78-paul had been and done . It had been far and away the worst moment of [his]78-paul life when [he]78-paul asked [Minta]77-minta to marry [him]78-paul . [He]78-paul would go straight to [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay , because [he]78-paul felt somehow that [she]65-mrs. ramsay was [the person who had made [him]78-paul do it]1185-the person who had made him do it . [She]65-mrs. ramsay had made [him]78-paul think [he]78-paul could do anything . [Nobody else]1186-nobody else took [him]78-paul seriously . But [she]65-mrs. ramsay made [him]78-paul believe that [he]78-paul could do whatever [he]78-paul wanted . [He]78-paul had felt [her]65-mrs. ramsay eyes on [him]78-paul all day today , following [him]78-paul about though [she]65-mrs. ramsay never said a word as if [she]65-mrs. ramsay were saying , " Yes , [you]78-paul can do it . "[78-paul] And so turning into [the lane that led to [the house]299-the house]1190-the lane that led to the house [he]78-paul could see lights moving about in the upper windows . [They]1187-they must be awfully late then . [People]264-people were getting ready for dinner . [The house]299-the house was all lit up , and the lights after the darkness made [his]78-paul eyes feel full , and [he]78-paul said to [himself]78-paul , childishly , as [he]78-paul walked up [the drive]478-the drive , Lights , lights , lights , and repeated in a dazed way , Lights , lights , lights , as [they]1187-they came into [the house]299-the house staring about [him]78-paul with [his]78-paul face quite stiff . " Yes , "[94-prue] said [Prue]94-prue , in [her]94-prue considering way , answering [[her]94-prue mother]897-her mother 's question , " [I]94-prue think [Nancy]75-nancy did go with [them]1187-they . "[94-prue]

16

Well then , [Nancy]75-nancy had gone with [them]1187-they , [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay supposed , wondering , as [she]75-nancy put down a brush , took up a comb , and said " Come in "[75-nancy] to a tap at the door [Jasper]72-jasper and [Rose]69-rose came in , whether the fact that [Nancy]75-nancy was with [them]1187-they made it less likely or more likely that anything would happen ; it made it less likely , somehow , [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay felt , very irrationally , except that after all holocaust on such a scale was not probable . [They]1187-they could not all be drowned . And again [she]65-mrs. ramsay felt alone in the presence of [[her]65-mrs. ramsay old antagonist]1197-her old antagonist , life .

[Jasper]72-jasper and [Rose]69-rose said that [Mildred]117-mildred wanted to know whether [she]117-mildred should wait dinner .

" Not for [the Queen of [England]4-england]2809-the queen of england , "[65-mrs. ramsay] said [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay emphatically .

" Not for [the Empress of [Mexico]40-mexico]2810-the empress of mexico , "[65-mrs. ramsay] [she]65-mrs. ramsay added , laughing at [Jasper]72-jasper ; for [he]72-jasper shared [[his]72-jasper mother]197-his mother 's vice : [he]72-jasper , too , exaggerated .

And if [Rose]69-rose liked , [she]69-rose said , while [Jasper]72-jasper took the message , [she]69-rose might choose which jewels [she]69-rose was to wear . When there are [fifteen people sitting down to dinner]1199-fifteen people sitting down to dinner , [one]222-one can not keep things waiting for ever . [She]65-mrs. ramsay was now beginning to feel annoyed with [them]1199-fifteen people sitting down to dinner for being so late ; it was inconsiderate of [them]1199-fifteen people sitting down to dinner , and it annoyed [her]65-mrs. ramsay on top of [her]65-mrs. ramsay anxiety about [them]1199-fifteen people sitting down to dinner , that [they]1199-fifteen people sitting down to dinner should choose this very night to be out late , when , in fact , [she]65-mrs. ramsay wished the dinner to be particularly nice , since [William Bankes]87-william bankes had at last consented to dine with [them]1199-fifteen people sitting down to dinner ; and [they]1199-fifteen people sitting down to dinner were having [Mildred]117-mildred 's masterpiece - BOEUF EN DAUBE . Everything depended upon things being served up to the precise moment [they]1199-fifteen people sitting down to dinner were ready . The beef , the bayleaf , and the wine - all must be done to a turn . To keep it waiting was out of the question . Yet of course tonight , of all nights , out [they]1199-fifteen people sitting down to dinner went , and [they]1199-fifteen people sitting down to dinner came in late , and things had to be sent out , things had to be kept hot ; [the BOEUF EN DAUBE]135-the boeuf en daube would be entirely spoilt .

[Jasper]72-jasper offered [her]65-mrs. ramsay an opal necklace ; [Rose]69-rose a gold necklace . Which looked best against [her]65-mrs. ramsay black dress ? Which did indeed , said [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay absent - mindedly , looking at [her]65-mrs. ramsay neck and shoulders but avoiding [her]65-mrs. ramsay face in the glass . And then , while [the children]258-the children rummaged among [her]65-mrs. ramsay things , [she]65-mrs. ramsay looked out of the window at a sight which always amused [her]65-mrs. ramsay - the rooks trying to decide which tree to settle on . Every time , [they]1199-fifteen people sitting down to dinner seemed to change [their]1199-fifteen people sitting down to dinner minds and rose up into the air again , because , [she]65-mrs. ramsay thought , [the old rook]1202-the old rook , [the father rook]1203-the father rook , [old Joseph]136-joseph was [her]65-mrs. ramsay name for [him]136-joseph , was a bird of a very trying and difficult disposition . [He]136-joseph was a disreputable old bird , with half [his]136-joseph wing feathers missing . [He]136-joseph was like [some seedy old gentleman in a top hat [she]65-mrs. ramsay had seen playing the horn in front of [a public house]1046-a public house]1204-some seedy old gentleman in a top hat she had seen playing the horn in front of a public house .

" Look ! "[65-mrs. ramsay] [she]65-mrs. ramsay said , laughing . [They]1199-fifteen people sitting down to dinner were actually fighting . [Joseph]136-joseph and [Mary]137-mary were fighting . Anyhow [they]1199-fifteen people sitting down to dinner all went up again , and the air was shoved aside by [their]1199-fifteen people sitting down to dinner black wings and cut into exquisite scimitar shapes . The movements of the wings beating out , out , out - [she]65-mrs. ramsay could never describe it accurately enough to please [herself]65-mrs. ramsay - was one of the loveliest of all to [her]65-mrs. ramsay . Look at that , [she]65-mrs. ramsay said to [Rose]69-rose , hoping that [Rose]69-rose would see it more clearly than [she]65-mrs. ramsay could . For [[one]222-one 's children]1207-one 's children so often gave [one]222-one 's own perceptions a little thrust forwards .

But which was it to be ? [They]1199-fifteen people sitting down to dinner had all the trays of [her]65-mrs. ramsay jewel - case open . The gold necklace , which was Italian , or the opal necklace , which [Uncle James]138-james had brought [her]65-mrs. ramsay from [India]1-india ; or should [she]65-mrs. ramsay wear [her]65-mrs. ramsay amethysts ?

" Choose , [dearests]2811-dearests , choose , "[65-mrs. ramsay] [she]65-mrs. ramsay said , hoping that [they]1199-fifteen people sitting down to dinner would make haste .

But [she]65-mrs. ramsay let [them]1199-fifteen people sitting down to dinner take [their]1199-fifteen people sitting down to dinner time to choose : [she]65-mrs. ramsay let [Rose]69-rose , particularly , take up this and then that , and hold [her]69-rose jewels against the black dress , for this little ceremony of choosing jewels , which was gone through every night , was what [Rose]69-rose liked best , [she]65-mrs. ramsay knew . [She]69-rose had some hidden reason of [her]69-rose own for attaching great importance to this choosing what [[her]69-rose mother]897-her mother was to wear . What was the reason , [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay wondered , standing still to let [her]69-rose clasp the necklace [she]69-rose had chosen , divining , through [her]69-rose own past , some deep , some buried , some quite speechless feeling that [one]222-one had for [[one]222-one 's mother]1212-one 's mother at [Rose]69-rose 's age . Like all feelings felt for [oneself]222-one , [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay thought , it made [one]222-one sad . It was so inadequate , what [one]222-one could give in return ; and what [Rose]69-rose felt was quite out of proportion to anything [she]69-rose actually was . And [Rose]69-rose would grow up ; and [Rose]69-rose would suffer , [she]69-rose supposed , with these deep feelings , and [she]69-rose said [she]69-rose was ready now , and [they]1215-they would go down , and [Jasper]72-jasper , because [he]72-jasper was [the gentleman]2714-the gentleman , should give [her]69-rose [his]72-jasper arm , and [Rose]69-rose , as [she]69-rose was [the lady]1217-the lady , should carry [her]69-rose handkerchief [she]69-rose gave [her]69-rose the handkerchief , and what else ? oh , yes , it might be cold : a shawl . Choose [me]0-i a shawl , [she]69-rose said , for that would please [Rose]69-rose , who was bound to suffer so . " There , "[69-rose] [she]69-rose said , stopping by the window on [the landing]548-the landing , " there they are again . "[69-rose] [Joseph]136-joseph had settled on another tree- top . " Do n't [you]72-jasper think [they]1219-they mind , "[69-rose] [she]69-rose said to [Jasper]72-jasper , " having [their]1219-they wings broken ? "[69-rose] Why did [he]72-jasper want to shoot poor old [Joseph]136-joseph and [Mary]137-mary ? [He]72-jasper shuffled a little on the stairs , and felt rebuked , but not seriously , for [she]69-rose did not understand the fun of shooting birds ; and [they]1219-they did not feel ; and being [[his]72-jasper mother]197-his mother [she]69-rose lived away in [another division of [the world]300-the world]1221-another division of the world , but [he]72-jasper rather liked [her]69-rose stories about [Mary]137-mary and [Joseph]136-joseph . [She]69-rose made [him]72-jasper laugh . But how did [she]69-rose know that those were [Mary]137-mary and [Joseph]136-joseph ? Did [she]69-rose think the same birds came to the same trees every night ? [he]72-jasper asked . But here , suddenly , like [all grown - up people]1223-all grown - up people , [she]69-rose ceased to pay [him]72-jasper the least attention . [She]69-rose was listening to a clatter in [the hall]914-the hall .

" [They]1225-they 've come back ! "[69-rose] [she]69-rose exclaimed , and at once [she]69-rose felt much more annoyed with [them]1225-they than relieved . Then [she]69-rose wondered , had it happened ? [She]69-rose would go down and [they]1225-they would tell [her]69-rose - but no . [They]1225-they could not tell [her]69-rose anything , with all [these people]1226-these people about . So [she]69-rose must go down and begin dinner and wait . And , like [some queen who , finding [[her]1227-some queen who , finding her people gathered in the hall , looks down upon them , and descends among them , and acknowledges their tributes silently , and accepts their devotion and their prostration before her paul people]1228-her people gathered in [the hall]914-the hall , looks down upon [them]1228-her people , and descends among [them]1228-her people , and acknowledges [their]1228-her people tributes silently , and accepts [their]1228-her people devotion and [their]1228-her people prostration before [her]1227-some queen who , finding her people gathered in the hall , looks down upon them , and descends among them , and acknowledges their tributes silently , and accepts their devotion and their prostration before her paul [Paul]78-paul]1227-some queen who , finding her people gathered in the hall , looks down upon them , and descends among them , and acknowledges their tributes silently , and accepts their devotion and their prostration before her paul did not move a muscle but looked straight before [him]78-paul as [she]69-rose passed [she]69-rose went down , and crossed [the hall]914-the hall and bowed [her]69-rose head very slightly , as if [she]69-rose accepted what [they]1228-her people could not say : [their]1228-her people tribute to [her]69-rose beauty .

But [she]69-rose stopped . There was a smell of burning . Could [they]1228-her people have let [the BOEUF EN DAUBE]135-the boeuf en daube overboil ? [she]69-rose wondered , pray heaven not ! when [the great clangour of the gong]1231-the great clangour of the gong announced solemnly , authoritatively , that all those scattered about , in [attics]1232-attics , in [bedrooms]1233-bedrooms , on little perches of [their]1228-her people own , reading , writing , putting the last smooth to [their]1228-her people hair , or fastening dresses , must leave all that , and the little odds and ends on [their]1228-her people washing - tables and dressing tables , and the novels on the bed- tables , and the diaries which were so private , and assemble in [the dining - room]279-the dining - room for dinner .

17

But what have [I]0-i done with [my]0-i life ? thought [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay , taking [her]0-i place at the head of the table , and looking at all the plates making white circles on it . " [William]87-william bankes , sit by [me]65-mrs. ramsay , "[65-mrs. ramsay] [she]65-mrs. ramsay said . " [Lily]86-lily , "[65-mrs. ramsay] [she]65-mrs. ramsay said , wearily , " over there . "[65-mrs. ramsay] [They]1228-her people had that - [Paul Rayley]78-paul and [Minta Doyle]77-minta - [she]65-mrs. ramsay , only this - an infinitely long table and plates and knives . At the far end was [[her]65-mrs. ramsay husband]234-her husband , sitting down , all in a heap , frowning . What at ? [She]65-mrs. ramsay did not know . [She]65-mrs. ramsay did not mind . [She]65-mrs. ramsay could not understand how [she]65-mrs. ramsay had ever felt any emotion or affection for [him]234-her husband . [She]65-mrs. ramsay had a sense of being past everything , through everything , out of everything , as [she]65-mrs. ramsay helped the soup , as if there was an eddy - there - and one could be in it , or [one]222-one could be out of it , and [she]65-mrs. ramsay was out of it . It 's all come to an end , [she]65-mrs. ramsay thought , while [they]1228-her people came in one after another , [Charles Tansley]68-charles tansley - " Sit there , please , "[65-mrs. ramsay] [she]65-mrs. ramsay said - [Augustus Carmichael]79-augustus carmichael - and sat down . And meanwhile [she]65-mrs. ramsay waited , passively , for [some one]386-some one to answer [her]65-mrs. ramsay , for something to happen . But this is not a thing , [she]65-mrs. ramsay thought , ladling out soup , [that one]647-that one says .

Raising [her]65-mrs. ramsay eyebrows at the discrepancy - that was what [she]65-mrs. ramsay was thinking , this was what [she]65-mrs. ramsay was doing - ladling out soup - [she]65-mrs. ramsay felt , more and more strongly , outside that eddy ; or as if a shade had fallen , and , robbed of colour , [she]65-mrs. ramsay saw things truly . [The room]213-the room [she]65-mrs. ramsay looked round [it]213-the room was very shabby . There was no beauty anywhere . [She]65-mrs. ramsay forebore to look at [Mr. Tansley]76-mr. tansley . Nothing seemed to have merged . [They]1228-her people all sat separate . And the whole of the effort of merging and flowing and creating rested on [her]65-mrs. ramsay . Again [she]65-mrs. ramsay felt , as a fact without hostility , the sterility of [men]358-men , for if [she]65-mrs. ramsay did not do it [nobody]216-nobody would do it , and so , giving [herself]65-mrs. ramsay a little shake that [one]222-one gives a watch that has stopped , the old familiar pulse began beating , as the watch begins ticking - one , two , three , one , two , three . And so on and so on , [she]65-mrs. ramsay repeated , listening to it , sheltering and fostering the still feeble pulse as one might guard a weak flame with a news - paper . And so then , [she]65-mrs. ramsay concluded , addressing [herself]65-mrs. ramsay by bending silently in [his]76-mr. tansley direction to [William Bankes]87-william bankes - [poor man ! who had [no wife]1244-no wife , and [no children]1245-no children and dined alone in [lodgings]1246-lodgings except for tonight]1243-poor man ! who had no wife , and no children and dined alone in lodgings except for tonight ; and in pity for [him]76-mr. tansley , life being now strong enough to bear [her]65-mrs. ramsay on again , [she]65-mrs. ramsay began all this business , as [a sailor not without weariness]1247-a sailor not without weariness sees the wind fill [his]1247-a sailor not without weariness sail and yet hardly wants to be off again and thinks how , had [the ship]1248-the ship sunk , [he]1247-a sailor not without weariness would have whirled round and round and found rest on the floor of [the sea]220-the sea .

" Did [you]87-william bankes find [your]87-william bankes letters ? [I]65-mrs. ramsay told [them]264-people to put them in [the hall]914-the hall for [you]87-william bankes , "[65-mrs. ramsay] [she]65-mrs. ramsay said to [William Bankes]87-william bankes .

[Lily Briscoe]86-lily watched [her]65-mrs. ramsay drifting into [that strange no - man 's land]1250-that strange no - man 's land where to follow [people]264-people is impossible and yet [their]264-people going inflicts such a chill on those who watch [them]264-people that [they]264-people always try at least to follow [them]264-people with [their]264-people eyes as one follows [a fading ship]1252-a fading ship until the sails have sunk beneath the horizon .

How old [she]65-mrs. ramsay looks , how worn [she]65-mrs. ramsay looks , [Lily]86-lily thought , and how remote . Then when [she]86-lily turned to [William Bankes]87-william bankes , smiling , it was as if [the ship]1248-the ship had turned and the sun had struck its sails again , and [Lily]86-lily thought with some amusement because [she]86-lily was relieved , Why does [she]86-lily pity [him]87-william bankes ? [Poor William Bankes]87-william bankes , [she]86-lily seemed to be saying , as if [her]86-lily own weariness had been partly pitying [people]264-people , and the life in [her]86-lily , [her]86-lily resolve to live again , had been stirred by pity . And it was not true , [Lily]86-lily thought ; it was one of those misjudgments of [hers]86-lily that seemed to be instinctive and to arise from some need of [her]86-lily own rather than of [other people]332-other people 's . [He]87-william bankes is not in the least pitiable . [He]87-william bankes has [his]87-william bankes work , [Lily]86-lily said to [herself]86-lily . " It 's odd that [one]222-one scarcely gets anything worth having by post , yet [one]222-one always wants [one]222-one 's letters , "[90-mr. bankes] said [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes .

What damned rot [they]1258-they talk , thought [Charles Tansley]68-charles tansley , laying down [his]68-charles tansley spoon precisely in the middle of [his]68-charles tansley plate , which [he]68-charles tansley had swept clean , as if , [Lily]86-lily thought [he]68-charles tansley sat opposite to [her]86-lily with [his]68-charles tansley back to the window precisely in the middle of view , [he]68-charles tansley were determined to make sure of [his]68-charles tansley meals . [She]86-lily liked [his]68-charles tansley eyes ; they were blue , deep set , frightening .

" Do [you]68-charles tansley write many letters , [Mr. Tansley]76-mr. tansley ? "[65-mrs. ramsay] asked [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay , pitying [him]68-charles tansley too , [Lily]86-lily supposed ; for that was true of [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay - [she]65-mrs. ramsay pitied [men]358-men always as if [they]358-men lacked something - [women]600-women never , as if [they]600-women had something . For [he]68-charles tansley was not going to talk the sort of rot these condescended to by [these silly women]1263-these silly women . [He]68-charles tansley had been reading in [[his]68-charles tansley room]1264-his room , and now [he]68-charles tansley came down and it all seemed to [him]68-charles tansley silly , superficial , flimsy . " [One]222-one never gets anything worth having by post "[1263-these silly women] - that was the sort of thing [they]1263-these silly women were always saying . [They]1263-these silly women made [men]358-men say that sort of thing . Yes , it was pretty well true , [he]68-charles tansley thought . [They]1263-these silly women never got anything worth having from one year 's end to another . [They]1263-these silly women did nothing but talk , talk , talk , eat , eat , eat . It was [the women]1266-the women 's fault . [Women]600-women made civilisation impossible with all [their]600-women " charm , "[600-women] all [their]600-women silliness .

" No going to [the Lighthouse]210-the lighthouse tomorrow , [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay , "[68-charles tansley] [he]68-charles tansley said , asserting [himself]68-charles tansley . [He]68-charles tansley liked [her]600-women ; [he]68-charles tansley admired [her]600-women ; [he]68-charles tansley still thought of [the man in the drain - pipe]1268-the man in the drain - pipe looking up at [her]600-women ; but [he]68-charles tansley felt it necessary to assert [himself]68-charles tansley .

[He]68-charles tansley was really , [Lily Briscoe]86-lily thought , in spite of [his]68-charles tansley eyes , but then look at [his]68-charles tansley nose , look at [his]68-charles tansley hands , [the most uncharming human being [she]600-women had ever met]1269-the most uncharming human being she had ever met . Then why did [she]600-women mind what [he]68-charles tansley said ? [Women]600-women ca n't write , [women]600-women ca n't paint - what did that matter coming from [him]68-charles tansley , since clearly it was not true to [him]68-charles tansley but for some reason helpful to [him]68-charles tansley , and that was why [he]68-charles tansley said it ? Why did [her]600-women whole being bow , like corn under a wind , and erect itself again from this abasement only with a great and rather painful effort ? [She]600-women must make it once more . There 's the sprig on the table - cloth ; there 's [my]0-i painting ; [I]0-i must move the tree to the middle ; that matters - nothing else . Could [she]600-women not hold fast to that , [she]600-women asked [herself]600-women , and not lose [her]600-women temper , and not argue ; and if [she]600-women wanted revenge take it by laughing at [him]68-charles tansley ?

" Oh , [Mr. Tansley]76-mr. tansley , "[600-women] [she]600-women said , " do take [me]600-women to [the Lighthouse]210-the lighthouse with [you]76-mr. tansley . [I]600-women should so love it . "[600-women]

[She]600-women was telling lies [he]68-charles tansley could see . [She]600-women was saying what [she]600-women did not mean to annoy [him]68-charles tansley , for some reason . [She]600-women was laughing at [him]68-charles tansley . [He]68-charles tansley was in [his]68-charles tansley old flannel trousers . [He]68-charles tansley had [no others]1272-no others . [He]68-charles tansley felt very rough and isolated and lonely . [He]68-charles tansley knew that [she]600-women was trying to tease [him]68-charles tansley for some reason ; [she]600-women did n't want to go to [the Lighthouse]210-the lighthouse with [him]68-charles tansley ; [she]600-women despised [him]68-charles tansley : so did [Prue Ramsay]70-prue ; so did [they]1274-they all . But [he]68-charles tansley was not going to be made a fool of by [women]600-women , so [he]68-charles tansley turned deliberately in [his]68-charles tansley chair and looked out of the window and said , all in a jerk , very rudely , it would be too rough for [her]600-women tomorrow . [She]600-women would be sick .

It annoyed [him]68-charles tansley that [she]600-women should have made [him]68-charles tansley speak like that , with [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay listening . If only [he]68-charles tansley could be alone in [[his]68-charles tansley room]1264-his room working , [he]68-charles tansley thought , among [his]68-charles tansley books . That was where [he]68-charles tansley felt at [his]68-charles tansley ease . And [he]68-charles tansley had never run a penny into debt ; [he]68-charles tansley had never cost [[his]68-charles tansley father]199-his father a penny since [he]68-charles tansley was fifteen ; [he]68-charles tansley had helped [them]1278-them at [home]378-home out of [his]68-charles tansley savings ; [he]68-charles tansley was educating [[his]68-charles tansley sister]1280-his sister . " [You]89-miss briscoe 'd be sick . " Yes , take it away , "[65-mrs. ramsay] [she]65-mrs. ramsay said briefly , interrupting what [she]65-mrs. ramsay was saying to [William Bankes]87-william bankes to speak to [the maid]2767-the maid . " It must have been fifteen - no , twenty years ago - that [I]65-mrs. ramsay last saw [her]139-carrie , "[65-mrs. ramsay] [she]65-mrs. ramsay was saying , turning back to [him]68-charles tansley again as if [she]65-mrs. ramsay could not lose a moment of [their]1283-their talk , for [she]65-mrs. ramsay was absorbed by what [they]1283-their were saying . So [he]68-charles tansley had actually heard from [her]65-mrs. ramsay this evening ! And was [Carrie]139-carrie still living at [Marlow]41-marlow , and was everything still the same ? Oh , [she]65-mrs. ramsay could remember it as if it were yesterday - on [the river]1284-the river , feeling it as if it were yesterday - going on [the river]1284-the river , feeling very cold . But if [the Mannings]140-the mannings made a plan [they]1286-they stuck to it . Never should [she]65-mrs. ramsay forget [Herbert]141-herbert killing a wasp with a teaspoon on [the bank]482-the bank ! And it was still going on , [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay mused , gliding like a ghost among the chairs and tables of that drawing - room on [the banks of [the Thames]42-the thames]1288-the banks of the thames where [she]65-mrs. ramsay had been so very , very cold twenty years ago ; but now [she]65-mrs. ramsay went among [them]1289-them like a ghost ; and it fascinated [her]65-mrs. ramsay , as if , while [she]65-mrs. ramsay had changed , that particular day , now become very still and beautiful , had remained there , all these years . Had [Carrie]139-carrie written to [him]1290-he [herself]139-carrie ? [she]139-carrie asked .

" Yes . [She]139-carrie says [they]1292-they 're building [a new billiard room]2819-a new billiard room , "[1290-he] [he]1290-he said . No ! No ! That was out of the question ! Building [a new billiard room]2819-a new billiard room ! It seemed to [her]139-carrie impossible .

[Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes could not see that there was anything very odd about it . [They]1292-they were very well off now . Should [he]1290-he give [her]139-carrie love to [Carrie]139-carrie ?

" Oh , "[65-mrs. ramsay] said [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay with a little start , " No , "[65-mrs. ramsay] [she]65-mrs. ramsay added , reflecting that [she]65-mrs. ramsay did not know [this [Carrie]139-carrie who built [a new billiard room]2819-a new billiard room]1293-this carrie who built a new billiard room . But how strange , [she]65-mrs. ramsay repeated , to [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes 's amusement , that [they]1292-they should be going on [there]236-there still . For it was extraordinary to think that [they]1292-they had been capable of going on living all these years when [she]65-mrs. ramsay had not thought of [them]1292-they more than once all that time . How eventful [her]65-mrs. ramsay own life had been , during those same years . Yet perhaps [Carrie Manning]139-carrie had not thought about [her]65-mrs. ramsay , either . The thought was strange and distasteful .

" [People]264-people soon drift apart , "[90-mr. bankes] said [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes , feeling , however , some satisfaction when [he]90-mr. bankes thought that after all [he]90-mr. bankes knew both [the Mannings]140-the mannings and [the Ramsays]82-the ramsays . [she]65-mrs. ramsay saw [him]90-mr. bankes clutch [himself]90-mr. bankes and clap a brake on the wheel , and the whole of [his]90-mr. bankes body seemed to emit sparks but not words . [He]90-mr. bankes sat there scowling . [He]90-mr. bankes had said nothing , [he]90-mr. bankes would have [her]65-mrs. ramsay observe . " [Ellen]119-ellen , please , another plate of soup , "[90-mr. bankes] and then [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay scowled like that .

And why not ? [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay demanded . Surely [they]1386-they could let [Augustus]79-augustus carmichael have [his]79-augustus carmichael soup if [he]79-augustus carmichael wanted it . [He]79-augustus carmichael hated [people]264-people wallowing in food , [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay frowned at [her]65-mrs. ramsay . [He]79-augustus carmichael hated everything dragging on for hours like this . But [he]79-augustus carmichael had controlled [himself]79-augustus carmichael , [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay would have [her]65-mrs. ramsay observe , disgusting though the sight was . But why show it so plainly , [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay demanded [they]1386-they looked at [each other]1157-each other down the long table sending these questions and answers across , [each]1389-each knowing exactly what [the other]1390-the other felt . [Everybody]973-everybody could see , [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay thought . There was [Rose]69-rose gazing at [[her]69-rose father]274-her father , there was [Roger]73-roger gazing at [[his]73-roger father]199-his father ; [both]1394-both would be off in spasms of laughter in another second , [she]65-mrs. ramsay knew , and so [she]65-mrs. ramsay said promptly indeed it was time :

" Light the candles , "[65-mrs. ramsay] and [they]1386-they jumped up instantly and went and fumbled at the sideboard .

Why could [he]79-augustus carmichael never conceal [his]79-augustus carmichael feelings ? [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay wondered , and [she]65-mrs. ramsay wondered if [Augustus Carmichael]79-augustus carmichael had noticed . Perhaps [he]79-augustus carmichael had ; perhaps [he]79-augustus carmichael had not . [She]65-mrs. ramsay could not help respecting the composure with which [he]79-augustus carmichael sat there , drinking [his]79-augustus carmichael soup . If [he]79-augustus carmichael wanted soup , [he]79-augustus carmichael asked for soup . Whether [people]264-people laughed at [him]79-augustus carmichael or were angry with [him]79-augustus carmichael [he]79-augustus carmichael was the same . [He]79-augustus carmichael did not like [her]65-mrs. ramsay , [she]65-mrs. ramsay knew that ; but partly for that very reason [she]65-mrs. ramsay respected [him]79-augustus carmichael , and looking at [him]79-augustus carmichael , drinking soup , very large and calm in the failing light , and monumental , and contemplative , [she]65-mrs. ramsay wondered what [he]79-augustus carmichael did feel then , and why [he]79-augustus carmichael was always content and dignified ; and [she]65-mrs. ramsay thought how devoted [he]79-augustus carmichael was to [Andrew]71-andrew , and would call [him]79-augustus carmichael into [[his]79-augustus carmichael room]1264-his room , and [Andrew]71-andrew said , ' show [him]79-augustus carmichael things . " And there [he]79-augustus carmichael would lie all day long on [the lawn]310-the lawn brooding presumably over [his]79-augustus carmichael poetry , till [he]79-augustus carmichael reminded one of a cat watching birds , and then [he]79-augustus carmichael clapped [his]79-augustus carmichael paws together when [he]79-augustus carmichael had found the word , and [[her]1399-her husband]234-her husband said , "[71-andrew] [Poor old Augustus]79-augustus carmichael - [he]79-augustus carmichael 's [a true poet]1397-a true poet , " which was high praise from [[her]1399-her husband]234-her husband .[79-augustus carmichael]

Now eight candles were stood down the table , and after the first stoop the flames stood upright and drew with [them]1398-them into visibility the long table entire , and in the middle a yellow and purple dish of fruit . What had [she]1399-her done with it , [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay wondered , for [Rose]69-rose 's arrangement of the grapes and pears , of the horny pink - lined shell , of the bananas , made [her]1399-her think of a trophy fetched from [the bottom of [the sea]220-the sea]1400-the bottom of the sea , of [Neptune]146-neptune 's banquet , of the bunch that hangs with vine leaves over the shoulder of Bacchus in some picture , among the leopard skins and the torches lolloping red and gold ... Thus brought up suddenly into the light it seemed possessed of great size and depth , was like [a world in which one could take [one]222-one 's staff and climb hills]1402-a world in which one could take one 's staff and climb hills , [she]1399-her thought , and go down into [valleys]1404-valleys , and to [her]1399-her pleasure for it brought [them]1405-they into sympathy momentarily [she]1399-her saw that [Augustus]79-augustus carmichael too feasted [his]79-augustus carmichael eyes on the same plate of fruit , plunged in , broke off a bloom there , a tassel here , and returned , after feasting , to [his]79-augustus carmichael hive . That was [his]79-augustus carmichael way of looking , different from [hers]1399-her . But looking together united [them]1405-they .

Now all the candles were lit up , and the faces on both sides of the table were brought nearer by the candle light , and composed , as [they]1405-they had not been in the twilight , into a party round a table , for the night was now shut off by panes of glass , which , far from giving any accurate view of [the outside world]1406-the outside world , rippled it so strangely that here , inside [the room]213-the room , seemed to be [order and dry land]1408-order and dry land ; there , outside , a reflection in which things waved and vanished , waterily .

Some change at once went through [them]1405-they all , as if this had really happened , and [they]1405-they were all conscious of making a party together in [a hollow]1409-a hollow , on [an island]1410-an island ; had [their]1405-they common cause against that fluidity out there . [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay , who had been uneasy , waiting for [Paul]78-paul and [Minta]77-minta to come in , and unable , [she]65-mrs. ramsay felt , to settle to things , now felt [her]65-mrs. ramsay uneasiness changed to expectation . For now [they]1405-they must come , and [Lily Briscoe]86-lily , trying to analyse the cause of the sudden exhilaration , compared it with that moment on [the tennis lawn]297-the tennis lawn , when solidity suddenly vanished , and such vast spaces lay between [them]1405-they ; and now the same effect was got by the many candles in [the sparely furnished room]1412-the sparely furnished room , and the uncurtained windows , and the bright mask - like look of faces seen by candlelight . Some weight was taken off [them]1405-they ; anything might happen , [she]65-mrs. ramsay felt . [They]1405-they must come now , [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay thought , looking at the door , and at that instant , [Minta Doyle]77-minta , [Paul Rayley]78-paul , and [a maid carrying a great dish]1413-a maid carrying a great dish in [her]1413-a maid carrying a great dish hands came in together . [They]1405-they were awfully late ; [they]1405-they were horribly late , [Minta]77-minta said , as [they]1405-they found [their]1405-they way to different ends of the table .

" [I]77-minta lost [my]77-minta brooch - [[my]77-minta grandmother]2849-my grandmother 's brooch , "[77-minta] said [Minta]77-minta with a sound of lamentation in [her]77-minta voice , and a suffusion in [her]77-minta large brown eyes , looking down , looking up , as [she]77-minta sat by [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay , which roused [his]67-mr. ramsay chivalry so that [he]67-mr. ramsay bantered [her]77-minta .

How could [she]77-minta be such a goose , [he]67-mr. ramsay asked , as to scramble about the rocks in jewels ?

[She]77-minta was by way of being terrified of [him]67-mr. ramsay - [he]67-mr. ramsay was so fearfully clever , and the first night when [she]77-minta had sat by [him]67-mr. ramsay , and [he]67-mr. ramsay talked about [George Eliot]147-george , [she]77-minta had been really frightened , for [she]77-minta had left the third volume of [MIDDLEMARCH]44-middlemarch in [the train]1414-the train and [she]77-minta never knew what happened in the end ; but afterwards [she]77-minta got on perfectly , and made [herself]77-minta out even more ignorant than [she]77-minta was , because [he]67-mr. ramsay liked telling [her]77-minta [she]77-minta was [a fool]847-a fool . And so tonight , directly [he]67-mr. ramsay laughed at [her]77-minta , [she]77-minta was not frightened . Besides , [she]77-minta knew , directly [she]77-minta came into [the room]213-the room that the miracle had happened ; [she]77-minta wore [her]77-minta golden haze . Sometimes [she]77-minta had it ; sometimes not . [She]77-minta never knew why it came or why it went , or if [she]77-minta had it until [she]77-minta came into [the room]213-the room and then [she]77-minta knew instantly by the way [some man]1418-some man looked at [her]77-minta . [She]77-minta sat beside [him]67-mr. ramsay , smiling .

It must have happened then , thought [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay ; [they]1420-they are engaged . And for a moment [she]77-minta felt what [she]77-minta had never expected to feel again - jealousy . For [he]67-mr. ramsay , [[her]77-minta husband]234-her husband , felt it too - [Minta]77-minta 's glow ; [he]67-mr. ramsay liked [these girls]1422-these girls , these golden - reddish girls , with something flying , something a little wild and harum - scarum about [them]1422-these girls , who did n't ' scrape [their]1422-these girls hair off , " were n't , as [he]67-mr. ramsay said about poor [Lily Briscoe]86-lily , ' skimpy "[77-minta] . But indeed [she]77-minta was not jealous , only , now and then , when [she]77-minta made [herself]77-minta look in [her]77-minta glass , a little resentful that [she]77-minta had grown old , perhaps , by [her]77-minta own fault . " [We]1432-they went back to look for [Minta]77-minta 's brooch , "[78-paul] [he]78-paul said , sitting down by [her]77-minta . " [We]1432-they "[78-paul] - that was enough . [The cook]904-the cook had spent three days over that dish . And [she]77-minta must take great care , [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay thought , diving into the soft mass , to choose a specially tender piece for [William Bankes]87-william bankes . And [she]77-minta peered into the dish , with [its]1435-its shiny walls and its confusion of savoury brown and yellow meats and its bay leaves and its wine , and thought , This will celebrate the occasion - a curious sense rising in [her]77-minta , at once freakish and tender , of celebrating a festival , as if two emotions were called up in [her]77-minta , one profound - for what could be more serious than the love of [man]311-man for [woman]1437-woman , what more commanding , more impressive , bearing in its bosom the seeds of death ; at the same time [these lovers]1438-these lovers , [these people entering into illusion glittering eyed]1439-these people entering into illusion glittering eyed , must be danced round with mockery , decorated with garlands .

" It is a triumph , "[90-mr. bankes] said [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes , laying [his]90-mr. bankes knife down for a moment . [He]90-mr. bankes had eaten attentively . It was rich ; it was tender . It was perfectly cooked . How did [she]77-minta manage these things in [the depths of [the country]912-the country]1440-the depths of the country ? [he]90-mr. bankes asked [her]77-minta . [She]77-minta was [a wonderful woman]1442-a wonderful woman . All [his]90-mr. bankes love , all [his]90-mr. bankes reverence , had returned ; and [she]77-minta knew it .

" It is a French recipe of [[my]65-mrs. ramsay grandmother]2849-my grandmother 's , "[65-mrs. ramsay] said [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay , speaking with a ring of great pleasure in [her]65-mrs. ramsay voice . Of course it was French . What passes for cookery in [England]4-england is an abomination [they]1443-they agreed . It is putting cabbages in water . It is roasting meat till it is like leather . It is cutting off the delicious skins of vegetables . " In which , "[90-mr. bankes] said [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes , " all the virtue of the vegetable is contained . "[90-mr. bankes] And the waste , said [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay . [A whole French family]1444-a whole french family could live on what [an English cook]1445-an english cook throws away . Spurred on by [her]77-minta sense that [William]87-william bankes 's affection had come back to [her]77-minta , and that everything was all right again , and that [her]77-minta suspense was over , and that now [she]77-minta was free both to triumph and to mock , [she]77-minta laughed , [she]77-minta gesticulated , till [Lily]86-lily thought , How childlike , how absurd [she]77-minta was , sitting up there with all [her]77-minta beauty opened again in [her]77-minta , talking about the skins of vegetables . There was something frightening about [her]77-minta . [She]77-minta was irresistible . Always [she]77-minta got [her]77-minta own way in the end , [Lily]86-lily thought . Now [she]77-minta had brought this off - [Paul]78-paul and [Minta]77-minta , [one]222-one might suppose , were engaged . [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes was dining [here]361-here . [She]77-minta put a spell on [them]1448-them all , by wishing , so simply , so directly , and [Lily]86-lily contrasted that abundance with [her]86-lily own poverty of spirit , and supposed that it was partly that belief for [her]86-lily face was all lit up - without looking young , [she]86-lily looked radiant in this strange , this terrifying thing , which made [Paul Rayley]78-paul , sitting at [her]77-minta side , all of a tremor , yet abstract , absorbed , silent . [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay , [Lily]86-lily felt , as [she]86-lily talked about the skins of vegetables , exalted that , worshipped that ; held [her]86-lily hands over it to warm them , to protect it , and yet , having brought it all about , somehow laughed , led [[her]86-lily victims]1449-her victims , [Lily]86-lily felt , to the altar . It came over [her]86-lily too now - the emotion , the vibration , of love . How inconspicuous [she]86-lily felt [herself]86-lily by [Paul]78-paul 's side ! [He]78-paul , glowing , burning ; [she]86-lily , aloof , satirical ; [he]78-paul , bound for adventure ; [she]86-lily , moored to [the shore]1155-the shore ; [he]78-paul , launched , incautious ; [she]86-lily solitary , left out - and , ready to implore a share , if it were a disaster , in [his]78-paul disaster , [she]86-lily said shyly :

" When did [Minta]77-minta lose [her]77-minta brooch ? "[86-lily]

[He]78-paul smiled the most exquisite smile , veiled by memory , tinged by dreams . [He]78-paul shook [his]78-paul head . " On [the beach]366-the beach , "[78-paul] [he]78-paul said .

" [I]78-paul 'm going to find it , "[78-paul] [he]78-paul said , " [I]78-paul 'm getting up early . "[78-paul] This being kept secret from [Minta]77-minta , [he]78-paul lowered [his]78-paul voice , and turned [his]78-paul eyes to where [she]86-lily sat , laughing , beside [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay .

[Lily]86-lily wanted to protest violently and outrageously [her]86-lily desire to help [him]78-paul , envisaging how in the dawn on [the beach]366-the beach [she]86-lily would be the one to pounce on the brooch half - hidden by some stone , and thus [herself]86-lily be included among [the sailors]1452-the sailors and [adventurers]1453-adventurers . But what did [he]78-paul reply to [her]86-lily offer ? [She]86-lily actually said with an emotion that [she]86-lily seldom let appear , " Let [me]86-lily come with [you]78-paul , "[86-lily] and [he]78-paul laughed . [He]78-paul meant yes or no - either perhaps . But it was not [his]78-paul meaning - it was the odd chuckle [he]78-paul gave , as if [he]78-paul had said , Throw [yourself]1454-yourself over [the cliff]1121-the cliff if [you]1454-yourself like , [I]0-i do n't care . [He]78-paul turned on [her]86-lily cheek the heat of love , its horror , its cruelty , its unscrupulosity . It scorched [her]86-lily , and [Lily]86-lily , looking at [Minta]77-minta , being charming to [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay at the other end of the table , flinched for [her]77-minta exposed to these fangs , and was thankful . For at any rate , [she]86-lily said to [herself]86-lily , catching sight of the salt cellar on the pattern , [she]86-lily need not marry , thank [Heaven]149-heaven : [she]86-lily need not undergo that degradation . [She]86-lily was saved from that dilution . [She]86-lily would move the tree rather more to the middle .

Such was the complexity of things . For what happened to [her]86-lily , especially staying with [the Ramsays]82-the ramsays , was to be made to feel violently two opposite things at the same time ; that 's what [you]1456-you feel , was one ; that 's what [I]0-i feel , was the other , and then [they]1457-they fought together in [her]86-lily mind , as now . It is so beautiful , so exciting , this love , that [I]0-i tremble on the verge of it , and offer , quite out of [my]0-i own habit , to look for a brooch on [a beach]1458-a beach ; also it is the stupidest , the most barbaric of human passions , and turns [a nice young man with a profile like a gem]1459-a nice young man with a profile like a gem 's [Paul]78-paul 's was exquisite into a bully with a crowbar [he]1459-a nice young man with a profile like a gem was swaggering , [he]1459-a nice young man with a profile like a gem was insolent in [the Mile End Road]1460-the mile end road . Yet , [she]86-lily said to [herself]86-lily , from the dawn of time odes have been sung to love ; wreaths heaped and roses ; and if [you]1456-you asked [nine people]1461-nine people out of ten [they]1461-nine people would say [they]1461-nine people wanted nothing but this - love ; while [the women]1266-the women , judging from [her]86-lily own experience , would all the time be feeling , This is not what [we]1463-we want ; there is nothing more tedious , puerile , and inhumane than this ; yet it is also beautiful and necessary . Well then , well then ? [she]86-lily asked , somehow expecting [the others]280-the others to go on with the argument , as if in an argument like this [one]222-one threw [one]222-one 's own little bolt which fell short obviously and left [the others]280-the others to carry it on . So [she]86-lily listened again to what [they]280-the others were saying in case [they]280-the others should throw any light upon the question of love .

" Then , "[90-mr. bankes] said [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes , " there is that liquid the English call coffee . "[90-mr. bankes]

" Oh , coffee ! "[65-mrs. ramsay] said [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay . But it was much rather a question [she]86-lily was thoroughly roused , [Lily]86-lily could see , and talked very emphatically of real butter and clean milk . Speaking with warmth and eloquence , [she]86-lily described the iniquity of the English dairy system , and in what state milk was delivered at the door , and was about to prove [her]86-lily charges , for [she]86-lily had gone into the matter , when all round the table , beginning with [Andrew]71-andrew in the middle , like a fire leaping from tuft to tuft of furze , [[her]86-lily children]278-her children laughed ; [[her]86-lily husband]234-her husband laughed ; [she]86-lily was laughed at , fire- encircled , and forced to veil [her]86-lily crest , dismount [her]86-lily batteries , and only retaliate by displaying the raillery and ridicule of the table to [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes as an example of what [one]222-one suffered if one attacked the prejudices of [the British Public]1471-the british public .

Purposely , however , for [she]86-lily had it on [her]86-lily mind that [Lily]86-lily , who had helped [her]86-lily with [Mr. Tansley]76-mr. tansley , was out of things , [she]86-lily exempted [her]86-lily from the rest ; said " [Lily]86-lily anyhow agrees with [me]86-lily , "[86-lily] and so drew [her]86-lily in , a little fluttered , a little startled . For [she]86-lily was thinking about love . [They]1472-they were both out of things , [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay had been thinking , both [Lily]86-lily and [Charles Tansley]68-charles tansley . [Poor fellow]1476-poor fellow !
