With [Lily]86-lily it was different . [She]86-lily faded , under [Minta]77-minta 's glow ; became more inconspicuous than ever , in [her]86-lily little grey dress with [her]86-lily little puckered face and [her]86-lily little Chinese eyes . Everything about [her]86-lily was so small . Yet , thought [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay , comparing [her]86-lily with [Minta]77-minta , as [she]77-minta claimed [her]77-minta help for [Lily]86-lily should bear [her]86-lily out [she]77-minta talked no more about [her]77-minta dairies than [[her]77-minta husband]234-her husband did about [his]234-her husband boots - [he]234-her husband would talk by the hour about [his]234-her husband boots of the two , [Lily]86-lily at forty will be the better . There was in [Lily]86-lily a thread of something ; a flare of something ; something of [her]86-lily own which [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay liked very much indeed , but [no man]1479-no man would , [she]65-mrs. ramsay feared . Obviously , not , unless it were [a much older man]1480-a much older man , like [William Bankes]87-william bankes . But then [he]87-william bankes cared , well , [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay sometimes thought that [he]87-william bankes cared , since [[his]87-william bankes wife]204-his wife 's death , perhaps for [her]204-his wife . [He]87-william bankes was not " in love "[87-william bankes] of course ; it was one of those unclassified affections of which there are so many . Oh , but nonsense , [she]65-mrs. ramsay thought ; [William]87-william bankes must marry [Lily]86-lily . [They]1482-they have so many things in common . [Lily]86-lily is so fond of flowers . [They]1482-they are both cold and aloof and rather self - sufficing . [She]65-mrs. ramsay must arrange for [them]1482-they to take a long walk together .

Foolishly , [she]65-mrs. ramsay had set [them]1482-they opposite each other . That could be remedied tomorrow . If it were fine , [they]1482-they should go for a picnic . Everything seemed possible . Everything seemed right . Just now but this can not last , [she]65-mrs. ramsay thought , dissociating [herself]65-mrs. ramsay from the moment while [they]1482-they were all talking about boots just now [she]65-mrs. ramsay had reached security ; [she]65-mrs. ramsay hovered like a hawk suspended ; like a flag floated in an element of joy which filled every nerve of [her]65-mrs. ramsay body fully and sweetly , not noisily , solemnly rather , for it arose , [she]65-mrs. ramsay thought , looking at [them]1482-they all eating there , from [husband]1107-husband and [children]325-children and [friends]1296-friends ; all of which rising in this profound stillness [she]65-mrs. ramsay was helping [William Bankes]87-william bankes to one very small piece more , and peered into the depths of the earthenware pot seemed now for no special reason to stay there like a smoke , like a fume rising upwards , holding [them]1482-they safe together . Nothing need be said ; nothing could be said . There it was , all round [them]1482-they . It partook , [she]65-mrs. ramsay felt , carefully helping [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes to a specially tender piece , of eternity ; as [she]65-mrs. ramsay had already felt about something different once before that afternoon ; there is a coherence in things , a stability ; something , [she]65-mrs. ramsay meant , is immune from change , and shines out [she]65-mrs. ramsay glanced at the window with its ripple of reflected lights in the face of the flowing , the fleeting , the spectral , like a ruby ; so that again tonight [she]65-mrs. ramsay had the feeling [she]65-mrs. ramsay had had once today , already , of peace , of rest . Of such moments , [she]65-mrs. ramsay thought , the thing is made that endures .

" Yes , "[65-mrs. ramsay] [she]65-mrs. ramsay assured [William Bankes]87-william bankes , " there is plenty for [everybody]973-everybody . "[65-mrs. ramsay]

" [Andrew]71-andrew , "[65-mrs. ramsay] [she]65-mrs. ramsay said , " hold [your]71-andrew plate lower , or [I]65-mrs. ramsay shall spill it . "[65-mrs. ramsay] The BOEUF EN DAUBE was a perfect triumph . Here , [she]65-mrs. ramsay felt , putting the spoon down , where [one]222-one could move or rest ; could wait now [they]1482-they were all helped listening ; could then , like a hawk which lapses suddenly from its high station , flaunt and sink on laughter easily , resting [her]65-mrs. ramsay whole weight upon what at the other end of the table [[her]65-mrs. ramsay husband]234-her husband was saying about the square root of one thousand two hundred and fifty - three . That was the number , it seemed , on [his]234-her husband watch .

What did it all mean ? To this day [she]65-mrs. ramsay had no notion . A square root ? What was that ? [[Her]65-mrs. ramsay sons]1488-her sons knew . [She]65-mrs. ramsay leant on [them]1488-her sons ; on cubes and square roots ; that was what [they]1482-they were talking about now ; on [Voltaire]150-voltaire and [Madame de Stael]151-madame de stael ; on the character of [Napoleon]152-napoleon ; on the French system of land tenure ; on [Lord Rosebery]153-lord rosebery ; on [Creevey]154-creevey 's Memoirs : [she]65-mrs. ramsay let it uphold [her]65-mrs. ramsay and sustain [her]65-mrs. ramsay , this admirable fabric of the masculine intelligence , which ran up and down , crossed this way and that , like iron girders spanning the swaying fabric , upholding [the world]300-the world , so that [she]65-mrs. ramsay could trust [herself]65-mrs. ramsay to it utterly , even shut [her]65-mrs. ramsay eyes , or flicker them for a moment , as [a child]381-a child staring up from its pillow winks at the myriad layers of the leaves of a tree . Then [she]65-mrs. ramsay woke up . It was still being fabricated . [William Bankes]87-william bankes was praising the Waverly novels .

[He]87-william bankes read one of them every six months , [he]87-william bankes said . And why should that make [Charles Tansley]68-charles tansley angry ? [He]87-william bankes rushed in all , thought [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay , because [Prue]70-prue will not be nice to [him]87-william bankes and denounced the Waverly novels when [he]87-william bankes knew nothing about it , nothing about it whatsoever , [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay thought , observing [him]87-william bankes rather than listening to what [he]87-william bankes said . [She]65-mrs. ramsay could see how it was from [his]87-william bankes manner - [he]87-william bankes wanted to assert [himself]87-william bankes , and so it would always be with [him]87-william bankes till [he]87-william bankes got [his]87-william bankes Professorship or married [[his]87-william bankes wife]204-his wife , and so need not be always saying , " [I]87-william bankes - [I]87-william bankes - I. "[87-william bankes] For that was what [his]87-william bankes criticism of [poor Sir Walter]155-poor sir walter , or perhaps it was [Jane Austen]156-jane austen , amounted to . " [I]87-william bankes - -I - -I. "[87-william bankes] [He]87-william bankes was thinking of [himself]87-william bankes and the impression [he]87-william bankes was making , as [she]65-mrs. ramsay could tell by the sound of [his]87-william bankes voice , and [his]87-william bankes emphasis and [his]87-william bankes uneasiness . Success would be good for [him]87-william bankes . At any rate [they]1492-they were off again . Now [she]65-mrs. ramsay need not listen . It could not last , [she]65-mrs. ramsay knew , but at the moment [her]65-mrs. ramsay eyes were so clear that [they]1493-they seemed to go round the table unveiling each of [these people]1226-these people , and [their]1226-these people thoughts and [their]1226-these people feelings , without effort like a light stealing under water so that its ripples and the reeds in it and the minnows balancing [themselves]1495-themselves , and the sudden silent trout are all lit up hanging , trembling . So [she]65-mrs. ramsay saw [them]1493-they ; [she]65-mrs. ramsay heard [them]1493-they ; but whatever [they]1493-they said had also this quality , as if what [they]1493-they said was like the movement of a trout when , at the same time , one can see the ripple and the gravel , something to the right , something to the left ; and the whole is held together ; for whereas in active life [she]65-mrs. ramsay would be netting and separating one thing from another ; [she]65-mrs. ramsay would be saying [she]65-mrs. ramsay liked the Waverly novels or had not read them ; [she]65-mrs. ramsay would be urging [herself]65-mrs. ramsay forward ; now [she]65-mrs. ramsay said nothing . For the moment , [she]65-mrs. ramsay hung suspended .

" Ah , but how long do [you]65-mrs. ramsay think it 'll last ? "[335-somebody] said [somebody]335-somebody . It was as if [she]65-mrs. ramsay had antennae trembling out from [her]65-mrs. ramsay , which , intercepting certain sentences , forced them upon [her]65-mrs. ramsay attention . This was one of them . [She]65-mrs. ramsay scented danger for [[her]65-mrs. ramsay husband]234-her husband . A question like that would lead , almost certainly , to something being said which reminded [him]234-her husband of [his]234-her husband own failure . How long would [he]234-her husband be read - [he]234-her husband would think at once . [William Bankes]87-william bankes who was entirely free from all such vanity laughed , and said [he]87-william bankes attached no importance to changes in fashion . Who could tell what was going to last - in literature or indeed in anything else ?

" Let [us]2853-us enjoy what [we]2853-us do enjoy , "[234-her husband] [he]234-her husband said . [His]234-her husband integrity seemed to [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay quite admirable . [He]234-her husband never seemed for a moment to think , But how does this affect [me]0-i ? But then if [you]1498-you had the other temperament , which must have praise , which must have encouragement , naturally [you]1498-you began and [she]65-mrs. ramsay knew that [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay was beginning to be uneasy ; to want [somebody]335-somebody to say , Oh , but [your]67-mr. ramsay work will last , [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay , or something like that . [He]67-mr. ramsay showed [his]67-mr. ramsay uneasiness quite clearly now by saying , with some irritation , that , anyhow , [Scott]157-scott or was it [Shakespeare]107-shakespeare ? would last [him]67-mr. ramsay [his]67-mr. ramsay lifetime . [He]67-mr. ramsay said it irritably . [Everybody]973-everybody , [she]65-mrs. ramsay thought , felt a little uncomfortable , without knowing why . Then [Minta Doyle]77-minta , whose instinct was fine , said bluffly , absurdly , that [she]77-minta did not believe that [any one]703-any one really enjoyed reading [Shakespeare]107-shakespeare . [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay said grimly but [his]67-mr. ramsay mind was turned away again that [very few people]1502-very few people liked it as much as [they]1502-very few people said [they]1502-very few people did . But [she]65-mrs. ramsay wished it was not necessary : perhaps it was [her]65-mrs. ramsay fault that it was necessary . " [Vronsky]159-vronsky , "[65-mrs. ramsay] said [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay ; " Oh , [ANNA KARENINA]160-anna karenina , "[65-mrs. ramsay] but that did not take [them]1507-them very far ; books were not in [their]1507-them line . Like [all stupid people]1509-all stupid people , [he]78-paul had a kind of modesty too , a consideration for what [you]1510-you were feeling , which , once in a way at least , [she]65-mrs. ramsay found attractive . Now [he]78-paul was thinking , not about [himself]78-paul , or about [Tolstoi]158-tolstoi , but whether [she]65-mrs. ramsay was cold , whether [she]65-mrs. ramsay felt a draught , whether [she]65-mrs. ramsay would like a pear .

No , [she]65-mrs. ramsay said , [she]65-mrs. ramsay did not want a pear . Indeed [she]65-mrs. ramsay had been keeping guard over the dish of fruit without realising it jealously , hoping that [nobody]216-nobody would touch it . [Her]65-mrs. ramsay eyes had been going in and out among the curves and shadows of the fruit , among the rich purples of the lowland grapes , then over the horny ridge of the shell , putting a yellow against a purple , a curved shape against a round shape , without knowing why [she]65-mrs. ramsay did it , or why , every time [she]65-mrs. ramsay did it , [she]65-mrs. ramsay felt more and more serene ; until , oh , what a pity that [they]1512-they should do it - a hand reached out , took a pear , and spoilt the whole thing . In sympathy [she]65-mrs. ramsay looked at [Rose]69-rose . [She]65-mrs. ramsay looked at [Rose]69-rose sitting between [Jasper]72-jasper and [Prue]70-prue . How odd that [one 's child]1513-one 's child should do that !

It was not about [[their]1512-they father]1516-their father , [she]65-mrs. ramsay hoped . No , [she]65-mrs. ramsay thought not . What was it , [she]65-mrs. ramsay wondered , sadly rather , for it seemed to [her]65-mrs. ramsay that [they]1512-they would laugh when [she]65-mrs. ramsay was not there . There was all that hoarded behind those rather set , still , mask - like faces , for [they]1512-they did not join in easily ; [they]1512-they were like [watchers]1517-watchers , [surveyors]1518-surveyors , a little raised or set apart from [the grown - up people]1519-the grown - up people . But when [she]65-mrs. ramsay looked at [Prue]70-prue tonight , [she]65-mrs. ramsay saw that this was not now quite true of [her]65-mrs. ramsay . [She]65-mrs. ramsay was just beginning , just moving , just descending . [She]65-mrs. ramsay kept looking at [Minta]77-minta , shyly , yet curiously , so that [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay looked from one to [the other]1390-the other and said , speaking to [Prue]70-prue in [her]65-mrs. ramsay own mind , [You]70-prue will be as happy as [she]77-minta is one of these days . But dinner was over . It was time to go . [They]1528-they were only playing with things on [their]1528-they plates . [She]65-mrs. ramsay would wait until [they]1528-they had done laughing at some story [[her]65-mrs. ramsay husband]234-her husband was telling . [He]234-her husband was having a joke with [Minta]77-minta about a bet . Then [she]65-mrs. ramsay would get up .

[She]65-mrs. ramsay liked [Charles Tansley]68-charles tansley , [she]65-mrs. ramsay thought , suddenly ; [she]65-mrs. ramsay liked [his]68-charles tansley laugh . And [Lily]86-lily , [she]65-mrs. ramsay thought , putting [her]65-mrs. ramsay napkin beside [her]65-mrs. ramsay plate , [she]86-lily always has some joke of [her]86-lily own . [One]222-one need never bother about [Lily]86-lily . [She]65-mrs. ramsay waited . [She]65-mrs. ramsay tucked [her]65-mrs. ramsay napkin under the edge of [her]65-mrs. ramsay plate . Well , were [they]1532-they done now ? No . That story had led to another story . [[Her]65-mrs. ramsay husband]234-her husband was in great spirits tonight , and wishing , [she]65-mrs. ramsay supposed , to make it all right with [old Augustus]79-augustus carmichael after that scene about the soup , had drawn [him]79-augustus carmichael in - [they]1532-they were telling stories about [some one [they]1532-they had both known at college]1534-some one they had both known at college . [She]65-mrs. ramsay looked at the window in which the candle flames burnt brighter now that the panes were black , and looking at that outside the voices came to [her]65-mrs. ramsay very strangely , as if [they]1535-they were voices at a service in [a cathedral]824-a cathedral , for [she]65-mrs. ramsay did not listen to the words . The sudden bursts of laughter and then one voice [Minta]77-minta 's speaking alone , reminded [her]65-mrs. ramsay of [men]358-men and [boys]1538-boys crying out the Latin words of a service in [some Roman Catholic cathedral]1539-some roman catholic cathedral . [She]65-mrs. ramsay waited . [[Her]65-mrs. ramsay husband]234-her husband spoke . [He]234-her husband was repeating something , and [she]65-mrs. ramsay knew it was poetry from the rhythm and the ring of exultation , and melancholy in [his]234-her husband voice :

Come out and climb [the garden path]1541-the garden path , [Luriana Lurilee]45-luriana lurilee . The China rose is all abloom and buzzing with the yellow bee .

The words [she]65-mrs. ramsay was looking at the window sounded as if they were floating like flowers on water out there , cut off from them all , as if [no one]477-no one had said them , but [they]1535-they had come into existence of [themselves]1535-they .

And all the lives [we]1543-we ever lived and all the lives to be Are full of trees and changing leaves .

[She]65-mrs. ramsay did not know what they meant , but , like music , the words seemed to be spoken by [her]65-mrs. ramsay own voice , outside [her]65-mrs. ramsay self , saying quite easily and naturally what had been in [her]65-mrs. ramsay mind the whole evening while [she]65-mrs. ramsay said different things . [She]65-mrs. ramsay knew , without looking round , that [every one at the table]1544-every one at the table was listening to the voice saying :

[I]0-i wonder if it seems to [you]1545-you , [Luriana]161-luriana , [Lurilee]162-lurilee

with the same sort of relief and pleasure that [she]65-mrs. ramsay had , as if this were , at last , the natural thing to say , this were [their]1544-every one at the table own voice speaking .

But the voice had stopped . [She]65-mrs. ramsay looked round . [She]65-mrs. ramsay made [herself]65-mrs. ramsay get up . [Augustus Carmichael]79-augustus carmichael had risen and , holding [his]79-augustus carmichael table napkin so that it looked like a long white robe [he]79-augustus carmichael stood chanting :

To see [the Kings]1546-the kings go riding by Over lawn and [daisy]163-daisy lea With [their]1546-the kings palm leaves and cedar [Luriana]161-luriana , [Lurilee]162-lurilee ,

and as [she]65-mrs. ramsay passed [him]79-augustus carmichael , [he]79-augustus carmichael turned slightly towards [her]65-mrs. ramsay repeating the last words :

[Luriana]161-luriana , [Lurilee]162-lurilee

and bowed to [her]65-mrs. ramsay as if [he]79-augustus carmichael did [her]65-mrs. ramsay homage . Without knowing why , [she]65-mrs. ramsay felt that [he]79-augustus carmichael liked [her]65-mrs. ramsay better than [he]79-augustus carmichael ever had done before ; and with a feeling of relief and gratitude [she]65-mrs. ramsay returned [his]79-augustus carmichael bow and passed through the door which [he]79-augustus carmichael held open for [her]65-mrs. ramsay .

It was necessary now to carry everything a step further . With [her]65-mrs. ramsay foot on the threshold [she]65-mrs. ramsay waited a moment longer in a scene which was vanishing even as [she]65-mrs. ramsay looked , and then , as [she]65-mrs. ramsay moved and took [Minta]77-minta 's arm and left [the room]213-the room , it changed , it shaped itself differently ; it had become , [she]65-mrs. ramsay knew , giving one last look at it over [her]65-mrs. ramsay shoulder , already the past .

18

As usual , [Lily]86-lily thought . There was always something that had to be done at that precise moment , something that [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay had decided for reasons of [her]65-mrs. ramsay own to do instantly , it might be with [every one standing about making jokes]1548-every one standing about making jokes , as now , not being able to decide whether [they]1549-they were going into [the smoking - room]1550-the smoking - room , into [the drawing - room]200-the drawing - room , up to [the attics]1552-the attics . Then [one]222-one saw [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay in the midst of [this hubbub]1554-this hubbub standing there with [Minta]77-minta 's arm in [hers]65-mrs. ramsay , bethink [her]65-mrs. ramsay , " Yes , it is time for that now , "[65-mrs. ramsay] and so make off at once with an air of secrecy to do something alone . And directly [she]65-mrs. ramsay went a sort of disintegration set in ; [they]1549-they wavered about , went different ways , [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes took [Charles Tansley]68-charles tansley by the arm and went off to finish on the terrace the discussion [they]1549-they had begun at dinner about politics , thus giving a turn to the whole poise of the evening , making the weight fall in a different direction , as if , [Lily]86-lily thought , seeing [them]1549-they go , and hearing a word or two about the policy of [the Labour Party]46-the labour party , [they]1549-they had gone up on to [the bridge of [the ship]1248-the ship]1555-the bridge of the ship and were taking [their]1549-they bearings ; the change from poetry to politics struck [her]86-lily like that ; so [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes and [Charles Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay going [upstairs]375-upstairs in the lamplight alone . Where , [Lily]86-lily wondered , was [she]86-lily going so quickly ?

Not that [she]86-lily did in fact run or hurry ; [she]86-lily went indeed rather slowly . [She]86-lily felt rather inclined just for a moment to stand still after all that chatter , and pick out one particular thing ; the thing that mattered ; to detach it ; separate it off ; clean [it]1558-it of all the emotions and odds and ends of things , and so hold it before [her]86-lily , and bring it to the tribunal where , ranged about in conclave , sat [the judges [she]86-lily had set up to decide these things]1559-the judges she had set up to decide these things . Is it good , is it bad , is it right or wrong ? Where are [we]1560-we all going to ? and so on . So [she]86-lily righted [herself]86-lily after the shock of the event , and quite unconsciously and incongruously , used the branches of the elm trees outside to help [her]86-lily to stabilise [her]86-lily position . [Her]86-lily world was changing : they were still . The event had given [her]86-lily a sense of movement . All must be in order . [She]86-lily must get that right and that right , [she]86-lily thought , insensibly approving of the dignity of the trees ' stillness , and now again of the superb upward rise like the beak of [a ship]633-a ship up a wave of the elm branches as the wind raised them . For it was windy [she]86-lily stood a moment to look out . It was windy , so that the leaves now and then brushed open a star , and the stars themselves seemed to be shaking and darting light and trying to flash out between the edges of the leaves . Yes , that was done then , accomplished ; and as with all things done , became solemn . Now one thought of it , cleared of chatter and emotion , it seemed always to have been , only was shown now and so being shown , struck everything into stability . [They]1562-they would , [she]86-lily thought , going on again , however long [they]1562-they lived , come back to this night ; this moon ; this wind ; [this house]1563-this house : and to [her]86-lily too . It flattered [her]86-lily , where [she]86-lily was most susceptible of flattery , to think how , wound about in [their]1562-they hearts , however long [they]1562-they lived [she]86-lily would be woven ; and this , and this , and this , [she]86-lily thought , going [upstairs]375-upstairs , laughing , but affectionately , at the sofa on the landing [[her]86-lily mother]897-her mother 's ; at the rocking - chair [[her]86-lily father]274-her father 's ; at the map of [the Hebrides]47-the hebrides . All that would be revived again in the lives of [Paul]78-paul and [Minta]77-minta ; " [the Rayleys]164-the rayleys "[86-lily] - [she]86-lily tried the new name over ; and [she]86-lily felt , with [her]86-lily hand on the nursery door , that community of feeling with [other people]332-other people which emotion gives as if the walls of partition had become so thin that practically the feeling was one of relief and happiness it was all one stream , and chairs , tables , maps , were [hers]86-lily , were theirs , it did not matter whose , and [Paul]78-paul and [Minta]77-minta would carry it on when [she]86-lily was dead .

[She]86-lily turned the handle , firmly , lest it should squeak , and went in , pursing [her]86-lily lips slightly , as if to remind [herself]86-lily that [she]86-lily must not speak aloud . But directly [she]86-lily came in [she]86-lily saw , with annoyance , that the precaution was not needed . [The children]258-the children were not asleep . It was most annoying . [Mildred]117-mildred should be more careful . There was [James]138-james wide awake and [Cam]91-cam sitting bolt upright , and [Mildred]117-mildred out of bed in [her]117-mildred bare feet , and it was almost eleven and [they]258-the children were all talking . What was the matter ? It was that horrid skull again . [She]86-lily had told [Mildred]117-mildred to move it , but [Mildred]117-mildred , of course , had forgotten , and now there was [Cam]91-cam wide awake , and [James]138-james wide awake quarreling when [they]258-the children ought to have been asleep hours ago . What had possessed [Edward]165-edward to send [them]258-the children this horrid skull ? [She]86-lily had been so foolish as to let [them]258-the children nail it up there . It was nailed fast , [Mildred]117-mildred said , and [Cam]91-cam could n't go to sleep with it in [the room]213-the room , and [James]138-james screamed if [she]86-lily touched it .

Then [Cam]91-cam must go to sleep it had great horns said [Cam]91-cam - must go to sleep and dream of [lovely palaces]1570-lovely palaces , said [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay , sitting down on the bed by [her]65-mrs. ramsay side . [She]65-mrs. ramsay could see the horns , [Cam]91-cam said , all over [the room]213-the room . It was true . Wherever [they]258-the children put the light and [James]138-james could not sleep without a light there was always a shadow somewhere .

" But think , [Cam]91-cam , it 's only an old pig , "[65-mrs. ramsay] said [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay , " a nice black pig like the pigs at [the farm]2854-the farm . "[65-mrs. ramsay] But [Cam]91-cam thought it was a horrid thing , branching at [her]65-mrs. ramsay all over [the room]213-the room .

" Well then , "[65-mrs. ramsay] said [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay , " [we]258-the children will cover it up , "[65-mrs. ramsay] and [they]258-the children all watched [her]65-mrs. ramsay go to the chest of drawers , and open the little drawers quickly one after another , and not seeing anything that would do , [she]65-mrs. ramsay quickly took [her]65-mrs. ramsay own shawl off and wound it round the skull , round and round and round , and then [she]65-mrs. ramsay came back to [Cam]91-cam and laid [her]65-mrs. ramsay head almost flat on the pillow beside [Cam]91-cam 's and said how lovely it looked now ; how [the fairies]1573-the fairies would love it ; it was like a bird 's nest ; it was like [a beautiful mountain such as [she]65-mrs. ramsay had seen abroad , with valleys]1574-a beautiful mountain such as she had seen abroad , with valleys and flowers and bells ringing and birds singing and little goats and antelopes and ... [She]65-mrs. ramsay could see the words echoing as [she]65-mrs. ramsay spoke them rhythmically in [Cam]91-cam 's mind , and [Cam]91-cam was repeating after [her]65-mrs. ramsay how it was like [a mountain]1575-a mountain , a bird 's nest , [a garden]1576-a garden , and there were little antelopes , and [her]65-mrs. ramsay eyes were opening and shutting , and [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay went on speaking still more monotonously , and more rhythmically and more nonsensically , how [she]65-mrs. ramsay must shut [her]65-mrs. ramsay eyes and go to sleep and dream of mountains and [valleys]1404-valleys and stars falling and parrots and antelopes and [gardens]1578-gardens , and everything lovely , [she]65-mrs. ramsay said , raising [her]65-mrs. ramsay head very slowly and speaking more and more mechanically , until [she]65-mrs. ramsay sat upright and saw that [Cam]91-cam was asleep .

Now , [she]65-mrs. ramsay whispered , crossing over to [his]1579-he bed , [James]138-james must go to sleep too , for see , [she]65-mrs. ramsay said , the boar 's skull was still there ; [they]1580-they had not touched it ; [they]1580-they had done just what [he]1579-he wanted ; it was there quite unhurt . [He]1579-he made sure that the skull was still there under the shawl . But [he]1579-he wanted to ask [her]65-mrs. ramsay something more . Would [they]1581-they go to [the Lighthouse]210-the lighthouse tomorrow ?

No , not tomorrow , [she]65-mrs. ramsay said , but soon , [she]65-mrs. ramsay promised [him]1579-he ; the next fine day . [He]1579-he was very good . [He]1579-he lay down . [She]65-mrs. ramsay covered [him]1579-he up . But [he]1579-he would never forget , [she]65-mrs. ramsay knew , and [she]65-mrs. ramsay felt angry with [Charles Tansley]68-charles tansley , with [[her]65-mrs. ramsay husband]234-her husband , and with [herself]65-mrs. ramsay , for [she]65-mrs. ramsay had raised [his]1579-he hopes . [She]65-mrs. ramsay hoped [he]1579-he would not bang [his]1579-he books on the floor above [their]1585-they heads , [she]65-mrs. ramsay thought , still thinking how annoying [Charles Tansley]68-charles tansley was . For neither of [them]1585-they slept well ; [they]1585-they were [excitable children]1586-excitable children , and since [he]1579-he said things like that about [the Lighthouse]210-the lighthouse , it seemed to [her]65-mrs. ramsay likely that [he]1579-he would knock a pile of books over , just as [they]1585-they were going to sleep , clumsily sweeping them off the table with [his]1579-he elbow . For [she]65-mrs. ramsay supposed that [he]1579-he had gone [upstairs]375-upstairs to work . Yet [he]1579-he looked so desolate ; yet [she]65-mrs. ramsay would feel relieved when [he]1579-he went ; yet [she]65-mrs. ramsay would see that [he]1579-he was better treated tomorrow ; yet [he]1579-he was admirable with [[her]65-mrs. ramsay husband]234-her husband ; yet [his]1579-he manners certainly wanted improving ; yet [she]65-mrs. ramsay liked [his]1579-he laugh - thinking this , as [she]65-mrs. ramsay came [downstairs]1590-downstairs , [she]65-mrs. ramsay noticed that [she]65-mrs. ramsay could now see the moon itself through the staircase window - the yellow harvest moon - and turned , and [they]1585-they saw [her]65-mrs. ramsay , standing above [them]1585-they on the stairs .

" That 's [[my]70-prue mother]2855-my mother , "[70-prue] thought [Prue]70-prue . Yes ; [Minta]77-minta should look at [her]65-mrs. ramsay ; [Paul Rayley]78-paul should look at [her]65-mrs. ramsay . "[65-mrs. ramsay]

And all the lives [we]1615-they ever lived And all the lives to be , Are full of trees and changing leaves ,

Steer , hither steer [your]1616-your winged pines , all beaten Mariners

[she]65-mrs. ramsay read and turned the page , swinging [herself]65-mrs. ramsay , zigzagging this way and that , from one line to another as from one branch to another , from one red and white flower to another , until a little sound roused [her]65-mrs. ramsay - [[her]65-mrs. ramsay husband]234-her husband slapping [his]234-her husband thighs . [Their]1615-they eyes met for a second ; but [they]1615-they did not want to speak to [each other]1157-each other . [They]1615-they had nothing to say , but something seemed , nevertheless , to go from [him]234-her husband to [her]65-mrs. ramsay . It was the life , it was the power of it , it was the tremendous humour , [she]65-mrs. ramsay knew , that made [him]234-her husband slap [his]234-her husband thighs . Do n't interrupt [me]0-i , [he]234-her husband seemed to be saying , do n't say anything ; just sit there . And [he]234-her husband went on reading . [His]234-her husband lips twitched . It filled [him]234-her husband . It fortified [him]234-her husband . [He]234-her husband clean forgot all the little rubs and digs of the evening , and how it bored [him]234-her husband unutterably to sit still while [people]264-people ate and drank interminably , and [his]234-her husband being so irritable with [[his]234-her husband wife]204-his wife and so touchy and minding when [they]1615-they passed [his]234-her husband books over as if they did n't exist at all . But now , [he]234-her husband felt , it did n't matter a damn who reached Z if thought ran like an alphabet from A to [Z]166-z . [Somebody]335-somebody would reach it - if not [he]234-her husband , then another . [This man]887-this man 's strength and sanity , [his]234-her husband feeling for straight forward simple things , [these fishermen]1623-these fishermen , [the poor old crazed creature in [[Mucklebackit]167-mucklebackit 's cottage]1625-mucklebackit 's cottage]1624-the poor old crazed creature in mucklebackit 's cottage made [him]234-her husband feel so vigorous , so relieved of something that [he]234-her husband felt roused and triumphant and could not choke back [his]234-her husband tears . Well , let [them]1626-they improve upon that , [he]234-her husband thought as [he]234-her husband finished the chapter . " Well ? "[65-mrs. ramsay] [she]65-mrs. ramsay said , echoing [his]234-her husband smile dreamily , looking up from [her]65-mrs. ramsay book .
