With a curious physical sensation , as if [she]86-lily were urged forward and at the same time must hold [herself]86-lily back , [she]86-lily made [her]86-lily first quick decisive stroke . The brush descended . It flickered brown over the white canvas ; it left a running mark . A second time [she]86-lily did it - a third time . And so pausing and so flickering , [she]86-lily attained a dancing rhythmical movement , as if the pauses were one part of the rhythm and the strokes another , and all were related ; and so , lightly and swiftly pausing , striking , [she]86-lily scored [her]86-lily canvas with brown running nervous lines which had no sooner settled there than they enclosed [she]86-lily felt it looming out at [her]86-lily a space . Down in the hollow of one wave [she]86-lily saw the next wave towering higher and higher above [her]86-lily . For what could be more formidable than [that space]1998-that space ? Here [she]86-lily was again , [she]86-lily thought , stepping back to look at it , drawn out of gossip , out of living , out of [community]1999-community with [people]264-people into the presence of [this formidable ancient enemy of hers]2001-this formidable ancient enemy of hers - this other thing , this truth , this reality , which suddenly laid hands on [her]86-lily , emerged stark at the back of appearances and commanded [her]86-lily attention . [She]86-lily was half unwilling , half reluctant . Why always be drawn out and haled away ? Why not left in peace , to talk to [Mr. Carmichael]80-mr. carmichael on [the lawn]310-the lawn ? It was an exacting form of intercourse anyhow . [Other worshipful objects]2003-other worshipful objects were content with worship ; [men]358-men , [women]600-women , [God]134-god , all let one kneel prostrate ; but this form , were it only the shape of a white lamp - shade looming on a wicker table , roused one to perpetual combat , challenged [one]222-one to a fight in which [one]222-one was bound to be worsted . Always it was in [her]86-lily nature , or in [her]86-lily sex , [she]86-lily did not know which before [she]86-lily exchanged the fluidity of life for the concentration of painting [she]86-lily had a few moments of nakedness when [she]86-lily seemed like an unborn soul , a soul reft of body , hesitating on some windy pinnacle and exposed without protection to all the blasts of doubt . Why then did [she]86-lily do it ? [She]86-lily looked at the canvas , lightly scored with running lines . It would be hung in [[the servants]1669-the servants ' bedrooms]1670-the servants ' bedrooms . It would be rolled up and stuffed under a sofa . What was the good of doing it then , and [she]86-lily heard some voice saying [she]86-lily could n't paint , saying [she]86-lily could n't create , as if [she]86-lily were caught up in one of those habitual currents in which after a certain time experience forms in the mind , so that [one]222-one repeats words without being aware any longer who originally spoke them .

Ca n't paint , ca n't write , [she]86-lily murmured monotonously , anxiously considering what [her]86-lily plan of attack should be . For the mass loomed before [her]86-lily ; it protruded ; [she]86-lily felt it pressing on [her]86-lily eyeballs . Then , as if some juice necessary for the lubrication of [her]86-lily faculties were spontaneously squirted , [she]86-lily began precariously dipping among the blues and umbers , moving [her]86-lily brush hither and thither , but it was now heavier and went slower , as if it had fallen in with some rhythm which was dictated to [her]86-lily [she]86-lily kept looking at the hedge , at the canvas by what [she]86-lily rhythm was strong enough to bear [her]86-lily along with it on its current . Certainly [she]86-lily was losing consciousness of outer things . And as [she]86-lily lost consciousness of outer things , and [her]86-lily name and [her]86-lily personality and [her]86-lily appearance , and whether [Mr. Carmichael]80-mr. carmichael was there or not , [her]86-lily mind kept throwing up from its depths , scenes , and names , and sayings , and memories and ideas , like a fountain spurting over that glaring , hideously difficult white space , while [she]86-lily modelled it with greens and blues .

[Charles Tansley]68-charles tansley used to say that , [she]86-lily remembered , [women]600-women ca n't paint , ca n't write . Coming up behind [her]86-lily , [he]68-charles tansley had stood close beside [her]86-lily , a thing [she]86-lily hated , as [she]86-lily painted [her]86-lily on this very spot . " Shag tobacco , "[68-charles tansley] [he]68-charles tansley said , " fivepence an ounce , "[68-charles tansley] parading [his]68-charles tansley poverty , [his]68-charles tansley principles . But the war had drawn the sting of [her]86-lily femininity . Poor devils , one thought , poor devils , of both sexes . [He]68-charles tansley was always carrying a book about under [his]68-charles tansley arm - a purple book . [He]68-charles tansley " worked . "[68-charles tansley] [He]68-charles tansley sat , [she]86-lily remembered , working in a blaze of sun . At dinner [he]68-charles tansley would sit right in the middle of the view . But after all , [she]86-lily reflected , there was the scene on [the beach]366-the beach . [One]222-one must remember that . It was a windy morning . [They]2014-they had all gone down to [the beach]366-the beach . [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay sat down and wrote letters by a rock . [She]65-mrs. ramsay wrote and wrote . " Oh , "[65-mrs. ramsay] [she]65-mrs. ramsay said , looking up at something floating in [the sea]220-the sea , " is it a lobster pot ? Is it [an upturned boat]2869-an upturned boat ? "[65-mrs. ramsay] [She]86-lily was so short - sighted that [she]86-lily could not see , and then [Charles Tansley]68-charles tansley became as nice as [he]68-charles tansley could possibly be . [He]68-charles tansley began playing ducks and drakes . [They]2014-they chose little flat black stones and sent them skipping over the waves . Every now and then [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay looked up over [her]65-mrs. ramsay spectacles and laughed at them . What [they]2014-they said [she]65-mrs. ramsay could not remember , but only [she]86-lily and [Charles]68-charles tansley throwing stones and getting on very well all of a sudden and [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay watching [them]2014-they . [She]65-mrs. ramsay was highly conscious of that . [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay , [she]65-mrs. ramsay thought , stepping back and screwing up [her]65-mrs. ramsay eyes . It must have altered the design a good deal when [she]65-mrs. ramsay was sitting on the step with [James]93-james . There must have been a shadow . When [she]65-mrs. ramsay thought of [herself]65-mrs. ramsay and [Charles]68-charles tansley throwing ducks and drakes and of the whole scene on [the beach]366-the beach , it seemed to depend somehow upon [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay sitting under the rock , with a pad on [her]65-mrs. ramsay knee , writing letters . [She]65-mrs. ramsay wrote innumerable letters , and sometimes the wind took them and [she]65-mrs. ramsay and [Charles]68-charles tansley just saved a page from [the sea]220-the sea . But what a power was in the human soul ! [she]65-mrs. ramsay thought . [That woman sitting there writing under the rock]2019-that woman sitting there writing under the rock resolved everything into simplicity ; made these angers , irritations fall off like old rags ; [she]65-mrs. ramsay brought together this and that and then this , and so made out of that miserable silliness and spite [she]65-mrs. ramsay and [Charles]68-charles tansley squabbling , sparring , had been silly and spiteful something - this scene on [the beach]366-the beach for example , this moment of friendship and liking - which survived , after all these years complete , so that [she]65-mrs. ramsay dipped into it to re - fashion [her]65-mrs. ramsay memory of [him]68-charles tansley , and there it stayed in the mind affecting one almost like a work of art .

" Like a work of art , "[65-mrs. ramsay] [she]65-mrs. ramsay repeated , looking from [her]65-mrs. ramsay canvas to the drawing - room steps and back again . [She]65-mrs. ramsay must rest for a moment . And , resting , looking from one to the other vaguely , the old question which traversed the sky of the soul perpetually , the vast , the general question which was apt to particularise itself at such moments as these , when [she]65-mrs. ramsay released faculties that had been on the strain , stood over [her]65-mrs. ramsay , paused over [her]65-mrs. ramsay , darkened over [her]65-mrs. ramsay . What is the meaning of life ? That was all - a simple question ; one that tended to close in on one with years . The great revelation had never come . The great revelation perhaps never did come . Instead there were little daily miracles , illuminations , matches struck unexpectedly in the dark ; here was one . This , that , and the other ; [herself]65-mrs. ramsay and [Charles Tansley]68-charles tansley and the breaking wave ; [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay bringing [them]2021-them together ; [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay saying , " Life stand still here "[65-mrs. ramsay] ; [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay making of the moment something permanent as in another sphere [Lily]86-lily [herself]86-lily tried to make of the moment something permanent - this was of the nature of a revelation . In the midst of chaos there was shape ; this eternal passing and flowing [she]86-lily looked at the clouds going and the leaves shaking was struck into stability . Life stand still here , [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay said . " [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay ! [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay ! "[65-mrs. ramsay] [she]65-mrs. ramsay repeated . [She]65-mrs. ramsay owed it all to [her]65-mrs. ramsay .

All was silence . [Nobody]216-nobody seemed yet to be stirring in [the house]299-the house . [She]65-mrs. ramsay looked at [it]299-the house there sleeping in the early sunlight with [its]299-the house windows green and blue with the reflected leaves . The faint thought [she]65-mrs. ramsay was thinking of [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay seemed in consonance with [this quiet house]2024-this quiet house ; this smoke ; this fine early morning air . Faint and unreal , it was amazingly pure and exciting . [She]65-mrs. ramsay hoped [nobody]216-nobody would open the window or come out of [the house]299-the house , but that [she]65-mrs. ramsay might be left alone to go on thinking , to go on painting . [She]65-mrs. ramsay turned to [her]65-mrs. ramsay canvas . But impelled by some curiosity , driven by the discomfort of the sympathy which [she]65-mrs. ramsay held undischarged , [she]65-mrs. ramsay walked a pace or so to the end of [the lawn]310-the lawn to see whether , down there on [the beach]366-the beach , [she]65-mrs. ramsay could see [that little company setting sail]2029-that little company setting sail . Down there among the little boats which floated , some with [their]2030-their sails furled , some slowly , for it was very calm moving away , there was one rather apart from the others . The sail was even now being hoisted . [She]65-mrs. ramsay decided that there in [that very distant and entirely silent little boat [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay]2031-that very distant and entirely silent little boat mr. ramsay was sitting with [Cam]91-cam and [James]93-james . Now [they]2032-they had got the sail up ; now after a little flagging and silence , [she]65-mrs. ramsay watched [the boat]1676-the boat take its way with deliberation past the other boats out to [sea]1706-sea .

5

The sails flapped over [their]2032-they heads . The water chuckled and slapped the sides of [the boat]1676-the boat , which drowsed motionless in the sun . Now and then the sails rippled with a little breeze in them , but the ripple ran over [them]2032-they and ceased . [The boat]1676-the boat made no motion at all . [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay sat in the middle of [the boat]1676-the boat . [He]67-mr. ramsay would be impatient in a moment , [James]93-james thought , and [Cam]91-cam thought , looking at [[her]91-cam father]274-her father , who sat in the middle of [the boat]1676-the boat between [them]2032-they [James]93-james steered ; [Cam]91-cam sat alone in the bow with [his]2040-he legs tightly curled . [He]2040-he hated hanging about . Sure enough , after fidgeting a second or two , [he]2040-he said something sharp to [[Macalister]184-macalister 's boy]2041-macalister 's boy , who got out [his]2040-he oars and began to row . But [[their]2032-they father]1516-their father , [they]2032-they knew , would never be content until [they]2032-they were flying along . [He]2040-he would keep looking for a breeze , fidgeting , saying things under [his]2040-he breath , which [Macalister]184-macalister and and [[Macalister]184-macalister 's boy]2041-macalister 's boy would overhear , and [they]2032-they would both be made horribly uncomfortable . [He]2040-he had made [them]2032-they come . [He]2040-he had forced [them]2032-they to come . In [their]2032-they anger [they]2032-they hoped that the breeze would never rise , that [he]2040-he might be thwarted in every possible way , since [he]2040-he had forced [them]2032-they to come against [their]2032-they wills .

All the way down to [the beach]366-the beach [they]2032-they had lagged behind together , though [he]2040-he bade [them]2032-they " Walk up , walk up , "[2040-he] without speaking . [Their]2032-they heads were bent down , [their]2032-they heads were pressed down by some remorseless gale . Speak to [him]2040-he [they]2032-they could not . [They]2032-they must come ; [they]2032-they must follow . [They]2032-they must walk behind [him]2040-he carrying brown paper parcels . But [they]2032-they vowed , in silence , as [they]2032-they walked , to stand by each other and carry out the great compact - to resist tyranny to the death . So there [they]2032-they would sit , one at one end of [the boat]1676-the boat , one at the other , in silence . [They]2032-they would say nothing , only look at [him]2040-he now and then where [he]2040-he sat with [his]2040-he legs twisted , frowning and fidgeting , and pishing and pshawing and muttering things to [himself]2040-he , and waiting impatiently for a breeze . And [they]2032-they hoped it would be calm . [They]2032-they hoped [he]2040-he would be thwarted . [They]2032-they hoped [the whole expedition]2046-the whole expedition would fail , and [they]2032-they would have to put back , with [[their]2032-they parcels]2047-their parcels , to [the beach]366-the beach .

But now , when [[Macalister]184-macalister 's boy]2041-macalister 's boy had rowed a little way out , the sails slowly swung round , [the boat]1676-the boat quickened itself , flattened itself , and shot off . Instantly , as if some great strain had been relieved , [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay uncurled [his]67-mr. ramsay legs , took out [his]67-mr. ramsay tobacco pouch , handed it with a little grunt to [Macalister]184-macalister , and felt , [they]2032-they knew , for all [they]2032-they suffered , perfectly content . Now [they]2032-they would sail on for hours like this , and [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay would ask [old Macalister]184-macalister a question - about the great storm last winter probably - and [old Macalister]184-macalister would answer it , and [they]2032-they would puff [their]2032-they pipes together , and [Macalister]184-macalister would take a tarry rope in [his]184-macalister fingers , tying or untying some knot , and [the boy]2051-the boy would fish , and never say a word to [any one]703-any one . [James]93-james would be forced to keep [his]93-james eye all the time on the sail . For if [he]93-james forgot , then the sail puckered and shivered , and [the boat]1676-the boat slackened , and [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay would say sharply , " Look out ! Look out ! "[67-mr. ramsay] and [old Macalister]184-macalister would turn slowly on [his]184-macalister seat . So [they]2032-they heard [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay asking some question about the great storm at Christmas . " [She]2870-she comes driving round the point , "[184-macalister] [old Macalister]184-macalister said , describing the great storm last Christmas , when [ten ships]2054-ten ships had been driven into [the bay]446-the bay for shelter , and [he]184-macalister had seen " one there , one there , one there "[184-macalister] [he]184-macalister pointed slowly round [the bay]446-the bay . [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay followed [him]184-macalister , turning [his]67-mr. ramsay head . [He]67-mr. ramsay had seen [four men clinging to the mast]2057-four men clinging to the mast . Then [she]2058-her was gone . " And at last [we]2032-they shoved [her]2058-her off , "[67-mr. ramsay] [he]67-mr. ramsay went on but in [their]2032-they anger and [their]2032-they silence [they]2032-they only caught a word here and there , sitting at opposite ends of [the boat]1676-the boat , united by [their]2032-they compact to fight tyranny to the death . At last [they]2032-they had shoved [her]2058-her off , [they]2032-they had launched [the lifeboat]2060-the lifeboat , and [they]2032-they had got [her]2058-her out past the point - [Macalister]184-macalister told the story ; and though [they]2032-they only caught a word here and there , [they]2032-they were conscious all the time of [[their]2032-they father]1516-their father - how [he]1516-their father leant forward , how [he]1516-their father brought [his]1516-their father voice into tune with [Macalister]184-macalister 's voice ; how , puffing at [his]1516-their father pipe , and looking there and there where [Macalister]184-macalister pointed , [he]1516-their father relished the thought of the storm and the dark night and [the fishermen striving there]2062-the fishermen striving there . [He]1516-their father liked that [men]358-men should labour and sweat on [the windy beach]2064-the windy beach at night ; pitting muscle and brain against the waves and the wind ; [he]1516-their father liked [men]358-men to work like that , and [women]600-women to keep [house]2067-house , and sit beside [sleeping children]2068-sleeping children indoors , while [men]358-men were drowned , out there in a storm . So [James]93-james could tell , so [Cam]91-cam could tell [they]2070-they looked at [him]1516-their father , [they]2070-they looked at [each other]1157-each other , from [his]1516-their father toss and [his]1516-their father vigilance and the ring in [his]1516-their father voice , and the little tinge of Scottish accent which came into [his]1516-their father voice , making [him]1516-their father seem like [a peasant]2072-a peasant [himself]1516-their father , as [he]1516-their father questioned [Macalister]184-macalister about [the eleven ships that had been driven into [the bay]446-the bay]2073-the eleven ships that had been driven into the bay in a storm . [Three]2075-three had sunk .

[He]1516-their father looked proudly where [Macalister]184-macalister pointed ; and [Cam]91-cam thought , feeling proud of [him]1516-their father without knowing quite why , had [he]1516-their father been [there]236-there [he]1516-their father would have launched [the lifeboat]2060-the lifeboat , [he]1516-their father would have reached [the wreck]2078-the wreck , [Cam]91-cam thought . [He]1516-their father was so brave , [he]1516-their father was so adventurous , [Cam]91-cam thought . But [she]91-cam remembered . There was the compact ; to resist tyranny to the death . [Their]2079-they grievance weighed [them]2079-they down . [They]2079-they had been forced ; [they]2079-they had been bidden . [He]1516-their father had borne [them]2079-they down once more with [his]1516-their father gloom and [his]1516-their father authority , making [them]2079-they do [his]1516-their father bidding , on this fine morning , come , because [he]1516-their father wished it , carrying these parcels , to [the Lighthouse]210-the lighthouse ; take part in these rites [he]1516-their father went through for [his]1516-their father own pleasure in memory of [dead people]2081-dead people , which [they]2079-they hated , so that [they]2079-they lagged after [him]1516-their father , all the pleasure of the day was spoilt .

Yes , the breeze was freshening . [The boat]1676-the boat was leaning , the water was sliced sharply and fell away in green cascades , in bubbles , in cataracts . [Cam]91-cam looked down into [the foam]2083-the foam , into [the sea]220-the sea with all its treasure in it , and its speed hypnotised [her]91-cam , and the tie between [her]91-cam and [James]93-james sagged a little . It slackened a little . [She]91-cam began to think , How fast it goes . Where are [we]2085-we going ? and the movement hypnotised [her]91-cam , while [James]93-james , with [his]93-james eye fixed on the sail and on the horizon , steered grimly . But [he]93-james began to think as [he]93-james steered that [he]93-james might escape ; [he]93-james might be quit of it all . [They]2085-we might land somewhere ; and be free then . [Both of [them]456-both of them]456-both of them , looking at [each other]1157-each other for a moment , had a sense of escape and exaltation , what with the speed and the change . But the breeze bred in [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay too the same excitement , and , as [old Macalister]184-macalister turned to fling [his]184-macalister line overboard , [he]184-macalister cried out aloud ,

" [We]2085-we perished , "[184-macalister] and then again , " [each alone]2871-each alone . "[184-macalister] And then with [his]184-macalister usual spasm of repentance or shyness , pulled [himself]184-macalister up , and waved [his]184-macalister hand towards [the shore]1155-the shore .

" See [the little house]2872-the little house , "[184-macalister] [he]184-macalister said pointing , wishing [Cam]91-cam to look . [She]91-cam raised [herself]91-cam reluctantly and looked . But which was it ? [She]91-cam could no longer make out , there on [the hillside]1125-the hillside , which was [[their]456-both of them house]2090-their house . All looked distant and peaceful and strange . [The shore]1155-the shore seemed refined , far away , unreal . Already the little distance [they]456-both of them had sailed had put [them]456-both of them far from [it]1155-the shore and given [it]1155-the shore the changed look , the composed look , of something receding in which one has no longer any part . Which was [[their]456-both of them house]2090-their house ? [She]91-cam could not see it .

" But [I]67-mr. ramsay beneath [a rougher sea]2873-a rougher sea , "[67-mr. ramsay] [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay murmured . [He]67-mr. ramsay had found [the house]299-the house and so seeing [it]299-the house , [he]67-mr. ramsay had also seen [himself]67-mr. ramsay [there]236-there ; [he]67-mr. ramsay had seen [himself]67-mr. ramsay walking on [the terrace]225-the terrace , alone . [He]67-mr. ramsay was walking up and down between the urns ; and [he]67-mr. ramsay seemed to [himself]67-mr. ramsay very old and bowed . Sitting in [the boat]1676-the boat , [he]67-mr. ramsay bowed , [he]67-mr. ramsay crouched [himself]67-mr. ramsay , acting instantly [his]67-mr. ramsay part - the part of [a desolate man , widowed]2097-a desolate man , widowed , bereft ; and so called up before [him]67-mr. ramsay in [hosts people sympathising with [him]67-mr. ramsay]2098-hosts people sympathising with him ; staged for [himself]67-mr. ramsay as [he]67-mr. ramsay sat in [the boat]1676-the boat , a little drama ; which required of [him]67-mr. ramsay decrepitude and exhaustion and sorrow [he]67-mr. ramsay raised [his]67-mr. ramsay hands and looked at the thinness of them , to confirm [his]67-mr. ramsay dream and then there was given [him]67-mr. ramsay in abundance [women]600-women 's sympathy , and [he]67-mr. ramsay imagined how [they]600-women would soothe [him]67-mr. ramsay and sympathise with [him]67-mr. ramsay , and so getting in [his]67-mr. ramsay dream some reflection of the exquisite pleasure [women]600-women 's sympathy was to [him]67-mr. ramsay , [he]67-mr. ramsay sighed and said gently and mournfully :

But [I]0-i beneath [a rougher sea]2873-a rougher sea Was whelmed in [deeper gulfs]2103-deeper gulfs than [he]67-mr. ramsay ,

so that the mournful words were heard quite clearly by [them]600-women all . [Cam]91-cam half started on [her]91-cam seat . It shocked [her]91-cam - it outraged [her]91-cam . The movement roused [[her]91-cam father]274-her father ; and [he]274-her father shuddered , and broke off , exclaiming : " Look ! Look ! "[274-her father] so urgently that [James]93-james also turned [his]93-james head to look over [his]93-james shoulder at [the island]402-the island . [They]600-women all looked . [They]600-women looked at [the island]402-the island .

But [Cam]91-cam could see nothing . [She]91-cam was thinking how all those paths and the lawn , thick and knotted with the lives [they]600-women had lived there , were gone : were rubbed out ; were past ; were unreal , and now this was real ; [the boat]1676-the boat and the sail with its patch ; [Macalister]184-macalister with [his]184-macalister earrings ; the noise of the waves - all this was real . Thinking this , [she]91-cam was murmuring to [herself]91-cam , " [We]600-women perished , [each alone]2871-each alone , "[91-cam] for [[her]91-cam father]274-her father 's words broke and broke again in [her]91-cam mind , when [[her]91-cam father]274-her father , seeing [her]91-cam gazing so vaguely , began to tease [her]91-cam . Did n't [she]91-cam know the points of the compass ? [he]274-her father asked . Did n't [she]91-cam know [the North from [the South]53-the south]2110-the north from the south ? Did [she]91-cam really think [they]2111-they lived right out there ? And [he]274-her father pointed again , and showed [her]91-cam where [[their]2111-they house]2090-their house was , there , by those trees . [He]274-her father wished [she]91-cam would try to be more accurate , [he]274-her father said : " Tell [me]274-her father - which is East , which is West ? "[274-her father] [he]274-her father said , half laughing at [her]91-cam , half scolding [her]91-cam , for [he]274-her father could not understand the state of mind of [any one]703-any one , not absolutely imbecile , who did not know the points of the compass . Yet [she]91-cam did not know . And seeing [her]91-cam gazing , with [her]91-cam vague , now rather frightened , eyes fixed where [no house]2114-no house was [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay forgot [his]274-her father dream ; how [he]274-her father walked up and down between the urns on [the terrace]225-the terrace ; how the arms were stretched out to [him]274-her father . [He]274-her father thought , [women]600-women are always like that ; the vagueness of [their]600-women minds is hopeless ; it was a thing [he]274-her father had never been able to understand ; but so it was . It had been so with [her]91-cam - [[his]274-her father wife]204-his wife . [They]2118-they could not keep anything clearly fixed in [their]2118-they minds . But [he]274-her father had been wrong to be angry with [her]91-cam ; moreover , did [he]274-her father not rather like this vagueness in [women]600-women ? It was part of [their]600-women extraordinary charm . [I]0-i will make [her]91-cam smile at [me]0-i , [he]274-her father thought . [She]91-cam looks frightened . [She]91-cam was so silent . [He]274-her father clutched [his]274-her father fingers , and determined that [his]274-her father voice and [his]274-her father face and all the quick expressive gestures which had been at [his]274-her father command making [people]264-people pity [him]274-her father and praise [him]274-her father all these years should subdue [themselves]264-people . [He]274-her father would make [her]91-cam smile at [him]274-her father . [He]274-her father would find some simple easy thing to say to [her]91-cam . But what ? For , wrapped up in [his]274-her father work as [he]274-her father was , [he]274-her father forgot the sort of thing [one]222-one said . There was [a puppy]2122-a puppy . [They]2123-they had a puppy . Who was looking after the puppy today ? [he]274-her father asked . Yes , thought [James]93-james pitilessly , seeing [[his]93-james sister]1280-his sister 's head against the sail , now [she]1280-his sister will give way . [I]0-i shall be left to fight [the tyrant]2125-the tyrant alone . The compact would be left to [him]93-james to carry out . [Cam]91-cam would never resist tyranny to the death , [he]274-her father thought grimly , watching [her]91-cam face , sad , sulky , yielding . And as sometimes happens when a cloud falls on [a green hillside]2126-a green hillside and gravity descends and there among [all the surrounding hills]2127-all the surrounding hills is gloom and sorrow , and it seems as if [the hills]2128-the hills [themselves]2128-the hills must ponder the fate of [the clouded]2129-the clouded , the darkened , either in pity , or maliciously rejoicing in [her]91-cam dismay : so [Cam]91-cam now felt [herself]91-cam overcast , as [she]91-cam sat there among [calm , resolute people]2130-calm , resolute people and wondered how to answer [[her]91-cam father]274-her father about [the puppy]2132-the puppy ; how to resist [his]274-her father entreaty - forgive [me]0-i , care for [me]0-i ; while [James the lawgiver]93-james , with the tablets of eternal wisdom laid open on [his]93-james knee [his]93-james hand on the tiller had become symbolical to [her]91-cam , said , Resist [him]93-james . Fight [him]93-james . [He]93-james said so rightly ; justly . For [they]2133-they must fight tyranny to the death , [she]91-cam thought . Of all human qualities [she]91-cam reverenced justice most . [[Her]91-cam brother]2134-her brother was most god - like , [[her]91-cam father]274-her father most suppliant . And to which did [she]91-cam yield , [she]91-cam thought , sitting between [them]2133-they , gazing at [the shore]1155-the shore whose points were all unknown to [her]91-cam , and thinking how [the lawn]310-the lawn and [the terrace]225-the terrace and [the house]299-the house were smoothed away now and peace dwelt there .

" [Jasper]72-jasper , "[91-cam] [she]91-cam said sullenly . [He]2140-he 'd look after the puppy .

And what was [she]91-cam going to call [him]2140-he ? [[her]91-cam father]274-her father persisted . [He]274-her father had had a dog when [he]274-her father was [a little boy]1174-a little boy , called [Frisk]185-frisk . [She]91-cam 'll give way , [James]93-james thought , as [he]93-james watched a look come upon [her]91-cam face , a look [he]93-james remembered . [They]2143-they look down [he]93-james thought , at [their]2143-they knitting or something . Then suddenly [they]2143-they look up . There was a flash of blue , [he]93-james remembered , and then [somebody sitting with]2144-somebody sitting with [him]93-james laughed , surrendered , and [he]93-james was very angry . It must have been [[his]93-james mother]197-his mother , [he]93-james thought , sitting on a low chair , with [[his]93-james father]199-his father standing over [her]197-his mother . [He]93-james began to search among the infinite series of impressions which time had laid down , leaf upon leaf , fold upon fold softly , incessantly upon [his]93-james brain ; among scents , sounds ; voices , harsh , hollow , sweet ; and lights passing , and brooms tapping ; and the wash and hush of [the sea]220-the sea , how [a man]1103-a man had marched up and down and stopped dead , upright , over [them]2143-they . Meanwhile , [he]93-james noticed , [Cam]91-cam dabbled [her]91-cam fingers in the water , and stared at [the shore]1155-the shore and said nothing . No , [she]91-cam wo n't give way , [he]93-james thought ; [she]91-cam 's different , [he]93-james thought . Well , if [Cam]91-cam would not answer [him]93-james , [he]93-james would not bother [her]91-cam [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay decided , feeling in [his]93-james pocket for a book . But [she]91-cam would answer [him]93-james ; [she]91-cam wished , passionately , to move some obstacle that lay upon [her]91-cam tongue and to say , Oh , yes , [Frisk]185-frisk . [I]0-i 'll call [him]2150-him [Frisk]185-frisk . [She]91-cam wanted even to say , Was that the dog that found its way over [the moor]2151-the moor alone ? But try as [she]91-cam might , [she]91-cam could think of nothing to say like that , fierce and loyal to [the compact]2152-the compact , yet passing on to [[her]91-cam father]274-her father , unsuspected by [James]93-james , a private token of the love [she]91-cam felt for [him]274-her father . For [she]91-cam thought , dabbling [her]91-cam hand and now [[Macalister]184-macalister 's boy]2041-macalister 's boy had caught a mackerel , and it lay kicking on the floor , with blood on its gills for [she]91-cam thought , looking at [James]93-james who kept [his]93-james eyes dispassionately on the sail , or glanced now and then for a second at the horizon , [you]2155-you 're not exposed to it , to this pressure and division of feeling , this extraordinary temptation . [[Her]91-cam father]274-her father was feeling in [his]274-her father pockets ; in another second , [he]274-her father would have found [his]274-her father book . For [no one]477-no one attracted [her]91-cam more ; [his]274-her father hands were beautiful , and [his]274-her father feet , and [his]274-her father voice , and [his]274-her father words , and [his]274-her father haste , and [his]274-her father temper , and [his]274-her father oddity , and [his]274-her father passion , and [his]274-her father saying straight out before every one , [we]2158-we perish , each alone , and [his]274-her father remoteness . [He]274-her father had opened [his]274-her father book . But what remained intolerable , [she]91-cam thought , sitting upright , and watching [[Macalister]184-macalister 's boy]2041-macalister 's boy tug the hook out of the gills of another fish , was that crass blindness and tyranny of [his]274-her father which had poisoned [her]91-cam childhood and raised bitter storms , so that even now [she]91-cam woke in the night trembling with rage and remembered some command of [his]274-her father ; some insolence : " Do this , "[274-her father] " Do that , "[274-her father] [his]274-her father dominance : [his]274-her father " Submit to [me]274-her father . "[274-her father]

So [she]91-cam said nothing , but looked doggedly and sadly at [the shore]1155-the shore , wrapped in its mantle of peace ; as if [the people there]2161-the people there had fallen asleep , [she]91-cam thought ; were free like smoke , were free to come and go like ghosts . [They]2161-the people there have no suffering there , [she]91-cam thought .

6

Yes , that is [[their]2161-the people there boat]2162-their boat , [Lily Briscoe]86-lily decided , standing on the edge of [the lawn]310-the lawn . It was [the boat with greyish - brown sails , which [she]86-lily saw now flatten itself upon the water and shoot off across [the bay]446-the bay]2164-the boat with greyish - brown sails , which she saw now flatten itself upon the water and shoot off across the bay . There [he]274-her father sits , [she]86-lily thought , and [the children]258-the children are quite silent still . And [she]86-lily could not reach [him]274-her father either . The sympathy [she]86-lily had not given [him]274-her father weighed [her]86-lily down . It made it difficult for [her]86-lily to paint .

[She]86-lily had always found [him]274-her father difficult . [She]86-lily never had been able to praise [him]274-her father to [his]274-her father face , [she]86-lily remembered . And that reduced [their]2167-their relationship to something neutral , without that element of sex in it which made [his]274-her father manner to [Minta]77-minta so gallant , almost gay . [He]274-her father would pick a flower for [her]86-lily , lend [her]86-lily [his]274-her father books . But could [he]274-her father believe that [Minta]77-minta read them ? [She]86-lily dragged them about [the garden]371-the garden , sticking in leaves to mark [the place]888-the place .

" D'you remember , [Mr. Carmichael]80-mr. carmichael ? "[86-lily] [she]86-lily was inclined to ask , looking at [the old man]2170-the old man . But [he]2170-the old man had pulled [his]2170-the old man hat half over [his]2170-the old man forehead ; [he]2170-the old man was asleep , or [he]2170-the old man was dreaming , or [he]2170-the old man was lying there catching words , [she]86-lily supposed .

" D'you remember ? "[86-lily] [she]86-lily felt inclined to ask [him]2170-the old man as [she]86-lily passed [him]2170-the old man , thinking again of [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay on [the beach]366-the beach ; the cask bobbing up and down ; and the pages flying . Why , after all these years had that survived , ringed round , lit up , visible to the last detail , with all before it blank and all after it blank , for miles and miles ?

" Is it [a boat]1340-a boat ? Is it a cork ? "[86-lily] [she]86-lily would say , [Lily]86-lily repeated , turning back , reluctantly again , to [her]86-lily canvas . Heaven be praised for it , the problem of space remained , [she]86-lily thought , taking up [her]86-lily brush again . It glared at [her]86-lily . The whole mass of the picture was poised upon that weight . Beautiful and bright it should be on the surface , feathery and evanescent , one colour melting into another like the colours on a butterfly 's wing ; but beneath the fabric must be clamped together with bolts of iron . It was to be a thing [you]2172-you could ruffle with [your]2172-you breath ; and a thing [you]2172-you could not dislodge with a team of horses . And [she]86-lily began to lay on a red , a grey , and [she]86-lily began to model [her]86-lily way into [the hollow there]2173-the hollow there . At the same time , [she]86-lily seemed to be sitting beside [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay on [the beach]366-the beach .

" Is it [a boat]1340-a boat ? Is it a cask ? "[65-mrs. ramsay] [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay said . And [she]65-mrs. ramsay began hunting round for [her]65-mrs. ramsay spectacles . And [she]65-mrs. ramsay sat , having found them , silent , looking out to [sea]1706-sea . And [Lily]86-lily , painting steadily , felt as if a door had opened , and [one]222-one went in and stood gazing silently about in [a high cathedral - like place]2177-a high cathedral - like place , very dark , very solemn . Shouts came from [a world far away]2178-a world far away . [Steamers]2179-steamers vanished in stalks of smoke on the horizon . [Charles]65-mrs. ramsay threw stones and sent [them]2179-steamers skipping .

[Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay sat silent . [She]65-mrs. ramsay was glad , [Lily]86-lily thought , to rest in silence , uncommunicative ; to rest in the extreme obscurity of human relationships . Who knows what [we]2180-we are , what [we]2180-we feel ? Who knows even at the moment of intimacy , This is knowledge ? Are n't things spoilt then , [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay may have asked it seemed to have happened so often , this silence by [her]65-mrs. ramsay side by saying them ? Are n't [we]2180-we more expressive thus ? The moment at least seemed extraordinarily fertile . [She]65-mrs. ramsay rammed a little hole in the sand and covered it up , by way of burying in it the perfection of the moment . It was like a drop of silver in which one dipped and illumined the darkness of the past .

[Lily]86-lily stepped back to get [her]86-lily canvas - so - into perspective . It was an odd road to be walking , this of painting . Out and out one went , further , until at last one seemed to be on a narrow plank , perfectly alone , over [the sea]220-the sea . And as [she]86-lily dipped into the blue paint , [she]86-lily dipped too into the past there . Now [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay got up , [she]86-lily remembered . It was time to go back to [the house]299-the house - time for luncheon . And [they]2183-them all walked up from [the beach]366-the beach together , [she]65-mrs. ramsay walking behind with [William Bankes]87-william bankes , and there was [Minta]77-minta in front of [them]2183-them with a hole in [her]77-minta stocking . How that little round hole of pink heel seemed to flaunt itself before [them]2183-them ! How [William Bankes]87-william bankes deplored it , without , so far as [she]65-mrs. ramsay could remember , saying anything about it ! It meant to [him]87-william bankes the annihilation of womanhood , and dirt and disorder , and [servants leaving and beds]2185-servants leaving and beds not made at mid - day - all the things [he]87-william bankes most abhorred . [He]87-william bankes had a way of shuddering and spreading [his]87-william bankes fingers out as if to cover an unsightly object which [he]87-william bankes did now - holding [his]87-william bankes hand in front of [him]87-william bankes . And [Minta]77-minta walked on ahead , and presumably [Paul]78-paul met [her]77-minta and [she]77-minta went off with [Paul]78-paul in [the garden]371-the garden .

[The Rayleys]164-the rayleys , thought [Lily Briscoe]86-lily , squeezing [her]86-lily tube of green paint . [She]86-lily collected [her]86-lily impressions of [the Rayleys]164-the rayleys . [Their]2187-them lives appeared to [her]86-lily in a series of scenes ; one , on the staircase at dawn . [Paul]78-paul had come in and gone to bed early ; [Minta]77-minta was late . There was [Minta]77-minta , wreathed , tinted , garish on the stairs about three o'clock in the morning . [Paul]78-paul came out in [his]78-paul pyjamas carrying a poker in case of [burglars]2188-burglars . [Minta]77-minta was eating a sandwich , standing half - way up by a window , in the cadaverous early morning light , and the carpet had a hole in it . But what did [they]2187-them say ? [Lily]86-lily asked [herself]86-lily , as if by looking [she]86-lily could hear [them]2187-them . [Minta]77-minta went on eating [her]77-minta sandwich , annoyingly , while [he]78-paul spoke something violent , abusing [her]77-minta , in a mutter so as not to wake [the children]258-the children , [the two little boys]2190-the two little boys . [He]78-paul was withered , drawn ; [she]77-minta flamboyant , careless . For things had worked loose after the first year or so ; the marriage had turned out rather badly .

And this , [Lily]86-lily thought , taking the green paint on [her]86-lily brush , this making up scenes about [them]2187-them , is what [we]2191-we call " knowing "[264-people] [people]264-people , " thinking "[86-lily] of [them]264-people , " being fond "[86-lily] of [them]264-people ! Not a word of it was true ; [she]86-lily had made it up ; but it was what [she]86-lily knew [them]2187-them by all the same . [She]86-lily went on tunnelling [her]86-lily way into [her]86-lily picture , into the past .

Another time , [Paul]78-paul said [he]78-paul " played chess in [coffee - houses]2877-coffee - houses . "[78-paul] [She]86-lily had built up a whole structure of imagination on that saying too . [She]86-lily remembered how , as [he]78-paul said it , [she]86-lily thought how [he]78-paul rang up [the servant]2193-the servant , and [she]86-lily said , " [Mrs. Rayley]186-mrs. rayley 's out , [sir]2878-sir , "[86-lily] and [he]78-paul decided that [he]78-paul would not come [home]378-home either . [She]86-lily saw [him]78-paul sitting in the corner of some lugubrious place where the smoke attached itself to the red plush seats , and [the waitresses]2195-the waitresses got to know [you]2196-you , and [he]78-paul played chess with [a little man who was in the tea trade]2197-a little man who was in the tea trade and lived at [Surbiton]54-surbiton , but that was all [Paul]78-paul knew about [him]78-paul . And then [Minta]77-minta was out when [he]78-paul came [home]378-home and then there was that scene on the stairs , when [he]78-paul got the poker in case of [burglars]2188-burglars no doubt to frighten [her]77-minta too and spoke so bitterly , saying [she]77-minta had ruined [his]78-paul life . At any rate when [she]86-lily went down to see [them]2200-they at [a cottage near [Rickmansworth]55-rickmansworth]2201-a cottage near rickmansworth , things were horribly strained . [Paul]78-paul took [her]86-lily down [the garden]371-the garden to look at the Belgian hares which [he]78-paul bred , and [Minta]77-minta followed [them]2200-they , singing , and put [her]77-minta bare arm on [his]78-paul shoulder , lest [he]78-paul should tell [her]77-minta anything .

[Minta]77-minta was bored by hares , [Lily]86-lily thought . But [Minta]77-minta never gave [herself]77-minta away . [She]77-minta never said things like that about playing chess in [coffee- houses]2203-coffee- houses . [She]77-minta was far too conscious , far too wary . But to go on with [their]2200-they story - [they]2200-they had got through the dangerous stage by now . [She]77-minta had been staying with [them]2200-they last summer some time and [the car]2204-the car broke down and [Minta]77-minta had to hand [him]78-paul [his]78-paul tools . [He]78-paul sat on [the road]305-the road mending [the car]2204-the car , and it was the way [she]77-minta gave [him]78-paul the tools - business - like , straightforward , friendly - that proved it was all right now . [They]2200-they were " in love "[77-minta] no longer ; no , [he]78-paul had taken up with [another woman]826-another woman , [a serious woman , with [her]826-another woman hair in a plait and a case in [her]826-another woman hand]2208-a serious woman , with her hair in a plait and a case in her hand [Minta]77-minta had described [her]826-another woman gratefully , almost admiringly , who went to meetings and shared [Paul]78-paul 's views [they]2200-they had got more and more pronounced about the taxation of land values and a capital levy . Far from breaking up the marriage , that alliance had righted it . [They]2200-they were [excellent friends]2209-excellent friends , obviously , as [he]78-paul sat on [the road]305-the road and [she]77-minta handed [him]78-paul [his]78-paul tools .

So that was the story of [the Rayleys]164-the rayleys , [Lily]86-lily thought . [She]86-lily imagined [herself]86-lily telling it to [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay , who would be full of curiosity to know what had become of [the Rayleys]164-the rayleys . [She]86-lily would feel a little triumphant , telling [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay that the marriage had not been a success .

But the dead , thought [Lily]86-lily , encountering some obstacle in [her]86-lily design which made [her]86-lily pause and ponder , stepping back a foot or so , oh , the dead ! [she]86-lily murmured , one pitied [them]2211-them , one brushed [them]2211-them aside , [one]222-one had even a little contempt for [them]2211-them . [They]2211-them are at [our]2213-our mercy . [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay has faded and gone , [she]86-lily thought . [We]2213-our can over - ride [her]65-mrs. ramsay wishes , improve away [her]65-mrs. ramsay limited , old - fashioned ideas . [She]65-mrs. ramsay recedes further and further from [us]2213-our . Mockingly [she]86-lily seemed to see [her]65-mrs. ramsay there at the end of [the corridor of years]2214-the corridor of years saying , of all incongruous things , " Marry , marry ! "[86-lily] sitting very upright early in the morning with the birds beginning to cheep in [the garden]371-the garden outside . And [one]222-one would have to say to [her]65-mrs. ramsay , It has all gone against [your]65-mrs. ramsay wishes . [They]2211-them 're happy like that ; [I]0-i 'm happy like this . Life has changed completely . At that all [her]65-mrs. ramsay being , even [her]65-mrs. ramsay beauty , became for a moment , dusty and out of date . For a moment [Lily]86-lily , standing there , with the sun hot on [her]86-lily back , summing up [the Rayleys]164-the rayleys , triumphed over [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay , who would never know how [Paul]78-paul went to [coffee - houses]2877-coffee - houses and had [a mistress]2218-a mistress ; how [he]78-paul sat on the ground and [Minta]77-minta handed [him]78-paul [his]78-paul tools ; how [she]65-mrs. ramsay stood here painting , had never married , not even [William Bankes]87-william bankes .

[Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay had planned it . Perhaps , had [she]65-mrs. ramsay lived , [she]65-mrs. ramsay would have compelled it . Already that summer [he]78-paul was " [the kindest of [men]358-men]2879-the kindest of men . "[78-paul] [He]78-paul was " [the first scientist of [his]78-paul age]2881-the first scientist of his age , [[my]78-paul husband]2833-my husband says . "[78-paul] [He]78-paul was also " poor [William]87-william bankes - it makes [me]78-paul so unhappy , when [I]78-paul go to see [him]78-paul , to find nothing nice in [[his]78-paul house]571-his house - [no one]477-no one to arrange the flowers . "[78-paul] So [they]2219-they were sent for walks together , and [she]65-mrs. ramsay was told , with that faint touch of irony that made [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay slip through one 's fingers , that [she]65-mrs. ramsay had a scientific mind ; [she]65-mrs. ramsay liked flowers ; [she]65-mrs. ramsay was so exact . What was this mania of [hers]65-mrs. ramsay for marriage ? [Lily]86-lily wondered , stepping to and fro from [her]86-lily easel .

Suddenly , as suddenly as a star slides in the sky , a reddish light seemed to burn in [her]65-mrs. ramsay mind , covering [Paul Rayley]78-paul , issuing from [him]78-paul . It rose like a fire sent up in token of some celebration by [savages]2220-savages on [a distant beach]2221-a distant beach . [She]65-mrs. ramsay heard the roar and the crackle . [The whole sea]2222-the whole sea for miles round ran red and gold . Some winey smell mixed with it and intoxicated [her]65-mrs. ramsay , for [she]65-mrs. ramsay felt again [her]65-mrs. ramsay own headlong desire to throw [herself]65-mrs. ramsay off [the cliff]1121-the cliff and be drowned looking for a pearl brooch on [a beach]1458-a beach . And the roar and the crackle repelled [her]65-mrs. ramsay with fear and disgust , as if while [she]65-mrs. ramsay saw its splendour and power [she]65-mrs. ramsay saw too how it fed on the treasure of [the house]299-the house , greedily , disgustingly , and [she]65-mrs. ramsay loathed it . But for a sight , for a glory it surpassed everything in [her]65-mrs. ramsay experience , and burnt year after year like a signal fire on [a desert island]2226-a desert island at [the edge of [the sea]220-the sea]2227-the edge of the sea , and [one]222-one had only to say " in love "[222-one] and instantly , as happened now , up rose [Paul]78-paul 's fire again . And it sank and [she]65-mrs. ramsay said to [herself]65-mrs. ramsay , laughing , " [The Rayleys]164-the rayleys "[65-mrs. ramsay] ; how [Paul]78-paul went to [coffee - houses]2877-coffee - houses and played chess .

[She]65-mrs. ramsay had only escaped by the skin of [her]65-mrs. ramsay teeth though , [she]65-mrs. ramsay thought . [She]65-mrs. ramsay had been looking at the table - cloth , and it had flashed upon [her]65-mrs. ramsay that [she]65-mrs. ramsay would move the tree to the middle , and need never marry [anybody]416-anybody , and [she]65-mrs. ramsay had felt an enormous exultation . [She]65-mrs. ramsay had felt , now [she]65-mrs. ramsay could stand up to [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay - a tribute to the astonishing power that [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay had over [one]222-one . Do this , [she]65-mrs. ramsay said , and [one]222-one did it . Even [her]65-mrs. ramsay shadow at the window with [James]93-james was full of authority . [She]65-mrs. ramsay remembered how [William Bankes]87-william bankes had been shocked by [her]65-mrs. ramsay neglect of the significance of [mother]339-mother and [son]617-son . Did [she]65-mrs. ramsay not admire [their]2236-they beauty ? [he]87-william bankes said . But [William]87-william bankes , [she]65-mrs. ramsay remembered , had listened to [her]65-mrs. ramsay with [[his]87-william bankes wise child]2237-his wise child 's eyes when [she]65-mrs. ramsay explained how it was not irreverence : how a light there needed a shadow there and so on . [She]65-mrs. ramsay did not intend to disparage a subject which , [they]2236-they agreed , [Raphael]187-raphael had treated divinely . [She]65-mrs. ramsay was not cynical . Quite the contrary . Thanks to [his]87-william bankes scientific mind [he]87-william bankes understood - a proof of disinterested intelligence which had pleased [her]65-mrs. ramsay and comforted [her]65-mrs. ramsay enormously . [One]222-one could talk of painting then seriously to [a man]1103-a man . Indeed , [his]87-william bankes friendship had been one of the pleasures of [her]65-mrs. ramsay life . [She]65-mrs. ramsay loved [William Bankes]87-william bankes .

[They]2236-they went to [Hampton Court]56-hampton court and [he]87-william bankes always left [her]65-mrs. ramsay , like [the perfect gentleman [he]87-william bankes was]2240-the perfect gentleman he was , plenty of time to wash [her]65-mrs. ramsay hands , while [he]87-william bankes strolled by [the river]1284-the river . That was typical of [their]2236-they relationship . Many things were left unsaid . Then [they]2236-they strolled through [the courtyards]2242-the courtyards , and admired , summer after summer , the proportions and the flowers , and [he]87-william bankes would tell [her]65-mrs. ramsay things , about perspective , about architecture , as [they]2236-they walked , and [he]87-william bankes would stop to look at a tree , or the view over [the lake]2243-the lake , and admire [a child]381-a child - it was [his]87-william bankes great grief - [he]87-william bankes had [no daughter]2245-no daughter in the vague aloof way that was natural to [a man who spent spent so much time in [laboratories]2247-laboratories that the world when [he]87-william bankes came out]2246-a man who spent spent so much time in laboratories that the world when he came out seemed to dazzle [him]87-william bankes , so that [he]87-william bankes walked slowly , lifted [his]87-william bankes hand to screen [his]87-william bankes eyes and paused , with [his]87-william bankes head thrown back , merely to breathe the air . Then [he]87-william bankes would tell [her]65-mrs. ramsay how [[his]87-william bankes housekeeper]2248-his housekeeper was on [her]2248-his housekeeper holiday ; [he]87-william bankes must buy a new carpet for [the staircase]1668-the staircase . Perhaps [she]65-mrs. ramsay would go with [him]87-william bankes to buy a new carpet for [the staircase]1668-the staircase . And once something led [him]87-william bankes to talk about [the Ramsays]82-the ramsays and [he]87-william bankes had said how when [he]87-william bankes first saw [her]65-mrs. ramsay [she]65-mrs. ramsay had been wearing a grey hat ; [she]65-mrs. ramsay was not more than nineteen or twenty . [She]65-mrs. ramsay was astonishingly beautiful . There [he]87-william bankes stood looking down [the avenue]2251-the avenue at [Hampton Court]56-hampton court as if [he]87-william bankes could see [her]65-mrs. ramsay there among the fountains .

[She]65-mrs. ramsay looked now at [the drawing - room]200-the drawing - room step . [She]65-mrs. ramsay saw , through [William]87-william bankes 's eyes , the shape of [a woman , peaceful and silent , with downcast eyes]2253-a woman , peaceful and silent , with downcast eyes . [She]65-mrs. ramsay sat musing , pondering [she]65-mrs. ramsay was in grey that day , [Lily]86-lily thought . [Her]65-mrs. ramsay eyes were bent . [She]65-mrs. ramsay would never lift them . Yes , thought [Lily]86-lily , looking intently , [I]0-i must have seen [her]65-mrs. ramsay look like that , but not in grey ; nor so still , nor so young , nor so peaceful . [The figure]2254-the figure came readily enough . [She]65-mrs. ramsay was astonishingly beautiful , as [William]87-william bankes said . But beauty was not everything . [Beauty]188-beauty had this penalty - it came too readily , came too completely . [It]188-beauty stilled life - froze it . [One]222-one forgot the little agitations ; the flush , the pallor , some queer distortion , some light or shadow , which made the face unrecognisable for a moment and yet added a quality [one]222-one saw for ever after . It was simpler to smooth that all out under the cover of beauty . But what was the look [she]65-mrs. ramsay had , [Lily]86-lily wondered , when [she]65-mrs. ramsay clapped [her]65-mrs. ramsay deer - stalkers 's hat on [her]65-mrs. ramsay head , or ran across the grass , or scolded [Kennedy]125-kennedy , [the gardener]1010-the gardener ? Who could tell [her]65-mrs. ramsay ? Who could help [her]65-mrs. ramsay ?

Against [her]86-lily will [she]86-lily had come to the surface , and found [herself]86-lily half out of the picture , looking , little dazedly , as if at unreal things , at [Mr. Carmichael]80-mr. carmichael . [He]80-mr. carmichael lay on [his]80-mr. carmichael chair with [his]80-mr. carmichael hands clasped above [his]80-mr. carmichael paunch not reading , or sleeping , but basking like [a creature gorged with existence]2258-a creature gorged with existence . [His]80-mr. carmichael book had fallen on to the grass .

[She]86-lily wanted to go straight up to [him]80-mr. carmichael and say , " [Mr. Carmichael]80-mr. carmichael ! "[86-lily] Then [he]80-mr. carmichael would look up benevolently as always , from [his]80-mr. carmichael smoky vague green eyes . But [one]222-one only woke [people]264-people if [one]222-one knew what [one]222-one wanted to say to [them]264-people . And [she]86-lily wanted to say not one thing , but everything . Little words that broke up the thought and dismembered it said nothing . " About life , about death ; about [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay "[222-one] - no , [she]86-lily thought , [one]222-one could say nothing to [nobody]216-nobody . The urgency of the moment always missed its mark . Words fluttered sideways and struck the object inches too low . Then [one]222-one gave it up ; then the idea sunk back again ; then [one]222-one became like [most middle - aged people]2267-most middle - aged people , cautious , furtive , with wrinkles between the eyes and a look of perpetual apprehension . For how could [one]222-one express in words these emotions of the body ? express that emptiness there ? [She]86-lily was looking at the drawing - room steps ; they looked extraordinarily empty . It was [one]222-one 's body feeling , not [one]222-one 's mind . The physical sensations that went with the bare look of the steps had become suddenly extremely unpleasant . To want and not to have , sent all up [her]86-lily body a hardness , a hollowness , a strain . And then to want and not to have - to want and want - how that wrung the heart , and wrung it again and again ! Oh , [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay ! [she]86-lily called out silently , to that essence which sat by [the boat]1676-the boat , that abstract one made of [her]86-lily , [that woman in grey]2272-that woman in grey , as if to abuse [her]86-lily for having gone , and then having gone , come back again . It had seemed so safe , thinking of [her]86-lily . Ghost , air , nothingness , a thing [you]2273-you could play with easily and safely at any time of day or night , [she]86-lily had been that , and then suddenly [she]86-lily put [her]86-lily hand out and wrung the heart thus . Suddenly , the empty drawing - room steps , the frill of the chair inside , the puppy tumbling on [the terrace]225-the terrace , the whole wave and whisper of [the garden]371-the garden became like curves and arabesques flourishing round a centre of complete emptiness .

" What does it mean ? How do [you]80-mr. carmichael explain it all ? "[86-lily] [she]86-lily wanted to say , turning to [Mr. Carmichael]80-mr. carmichael again . For [the whole world]800-the whole world seemed to have dissolved in this early morning hour into a pool of thought , a deep basin of reality , and [one]222-one could almost fancy that had [Mr. Carmichael]80-mr. carmichael spoken , for instance , a little tear would have rent the surface pool . And then ? Something would emerge . A hand would be shoved up , a blade would be flashed . It was nonsense of course .

A curious notion came to [her]86-lily that [he]80-mr. carmichael did after all hear the things [she]86-lily could not say . [He]80-mr. carmichael was [an inscrutable old man]2278-an inscrutable old man , with the yellow stain on [his]80-mr. carmichael beard , and [his]80-mr. carmichael poetry , and [his]80-mr. carmichael puzzles , sailing serenely through a world which satisfied all [his]80-mr. carmichael wants , so that [she]86-lily thought [he]80-mr. carmichael had only to put down [his]80-mr. carmichael hand where [he]80-mr. carmichael lay on [the lawn]310-the lawn to fish up anything [he]80-mr. carmichael wanted . [She]86-lily looked at [her]86-lily picture . That would have been [his]80-mr. carmichael answer , presumably - how " [you]2885-you "[80-mr. carmichael] and " [I]2280-i "[2280-i] and ' [she]2280-i " pass and vanish ; nothing stays ; all changes ; but not words , not paint . Yet it would be hung in [the attics]1552-the attics , [she]86-lily thought ; it would be rolled up and flung under a sofa ; yet even so , even of a picture like that , it was true . [One]222-one might say , even of this scrawl , not of that actual picture , perhaps , but of what it attempted , that it "[86-lily] remained for ever , " [she]86-lily was going to say , or , for the words spoken sounded even to [herself]86-lily , too boastful , to hint , wordlessly ; when , looking at the picture , [she]86-lily was surprised to find that [she]86-lily could not see it . [Her]86-lily eyes were full of a hot liquid [she]86-lily did not think of tears at first which , without disturbing the firmness of [her]86-lily lips , made the air thick , rolled down [her]86-lily cheeks . [She]86-lily had perfect control of [herself]86-lily - Oh , yes ! - in every other way . Was [she]86-lily crying then for [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay , without being aware of any unhappiness ? [She]86-lily addressed [old Mr. Carmichael]80-mr. carmichael again . What was it then ? What did it mean ? Could things thrust [their]2888-their hands up and grip one ; could the blade cut ; the fist grasp ? Was there no safety ? No learning by heart of the ways of [the world]300-the world ? [No guide]2890-no guide , no shelter , but all was miracle , and leaping from the pinnacle of [a tower]2891-a tower into the air ? Could it be , even for [elderly people]2892-elderly people , that this was life ? - startling , unexpected , unknown ? For one moment [she]86-lily felt that if [they]2892-elderly people both got up , here , now on [the lawn]310-the lawn , and demanded an explanation , why was it so short , why was it so inexplicable , said it with violence , as [two fully equipped human beings from whom nothing should be hid]2894-two fully equipped human beings from whom nothing should be hid might speak , then , beauty would roll itself up ; the space would fill ; those empty flourishes would form into shape ; if [they]2892-elderly people shouted loud enough [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay would return . "[65-mrs. ramsay] [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay ! " [she]86-lily said aloud , "[65-mrs. ramsay] [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay ! " The tears ran down [her]86-lily face .[65-mrs. ramsay]

7

[[Macalister]184-macalister 's boy]2041-macalister 's boy took one of the fish and cut a square out of its side to bait [his]2041-macalister 's boy hook with . The mutilated body it was alive still was thrown back into [the sea]220-the sea .

8

" [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay ! "[86-lily] [Lily]86-lily cried , " [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay ! "[86-lily] But nothing happened . The pain increased . That anguish could reduce one to such a pitch of imbecility , [she]86-lily thought ! Anyhow [the old man]2170-the old man had not heard [her]86-lily . [He]2170-the old man remained benignant , calm - if [one]222-one chose to think it , sublime . Heaven be praised , [no one]477-no one had heard [her]86-lily cry that ignominious cry , stop pain , stop ! [She]86-lily had not obviously taken leave of [her]86-lily senses . [No one]477-no one had seen [her]86-lily step off [her]86-lily strip of board into the waters of annihilation . [She]86-lily remained [a skimpy old maid]2287-a skimpy old maid , holding a paint - brush .

And now slowly the pain of the want , and the bitter anger to be called back , just as [she]86-lily thought [she]86-lily would never feel sorrow for [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay again . Had [she]86-lily missed [her]65-mrs. ramsay among the coffee cups at breakfast ? not in the least lessened ; and of [their]2288-their anguish left , as antidote , a relief that was balm in itself , and also , but more mysteriously , a sense of [some one there]2289-some one there , of [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay , relieved for a moment of the weight that [the world]300-the world had put on [her]65-mrs. ramsay , staying lightly by [her]65-mrs. ramsay side and then for this was [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay in all [her]65-mrs. ramsay beauty raising to [her]65-mrs. ramsay forehead a wreath of white flowers with which [she]65-mrs. ramsay went . [Lily]86-lily squeezed [her]86-lily tubes again . [She]86-lily attacked that problem of the hedge . It was strange how clearly [she]86-lily saw [her]65-mrs. ramsay , stepping with [her]86-lily usual quickness across fields among whose folds , purplish and soft , among whose flowers , hyacinth or lilies , [she]65-mrs. ramsay vanished . It was some trick of [the painter]2291-the painter 's eye . For days after [she]86-lily had heard of [her]65-mrs. ramsay death [she]86-lily had seen [her]65-mrs. ramsay thus , putting [her]65-mrs. ramsay wreath to [her]65-mrs. ramsay forehead and going unquestioningly with [[her]65-mrs. ramsay companion]2292-her companion , a shade across [the fields]762-the fields . The sight , the phrase , had its power to console . Wherever [she]86-lily happened to be , painting , here , in [the country]912-the country or in [London]11-london , the vision would come to [her]86-lily , and [her]86-lily eyes , half closing , sought something to base [her]86-lily vision on . [She]86-lily looked down [the railway carriage]2295-the railway carriage , [the omnibus]2296-the omnibus ; took a line from shoulder or cheek ; looked at the windows opposite ; at [Piccadilly]57-piccadilly , lamp - strung in the evening . All had been part of [the fields of death]2297-the fields of death . But always something - it might be a face , a voice , [a paper boy]2298-a paper boy crying STANDARD , NEWS - thrust through , snubbed [her]86-lily , waked [her]86-lily , required and got in the end an effort of attention , so that the vision must be perpetually remade . Now again , moved as [she]86-lily was by some instinctive need of distance and blue , [she]86-lily looked at [the bay beneath [her]86-lily]2299-the bay beneath her , making hillocks of the blue bars of the waves , and stony fields of the purpler spaces , again [she]86-lily was roused as usual by something incongruous . There was a brown spot in [the middle of [the bay]446-the bay]2300-the middle of the bay . It was [a boat]1340-a boat . Yes , [she]86-lily realised that after a second . But whose boat ? [[Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay 's boat]2303-mr. ramsay 's boat , [she]86-lily replied . [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay ; [the man who had marched past [her]86-lily , with [his]67-mr. ramsay hand raised , aloof , at the head of a procession , in [his]67-mr. ramsay beautiful boots , asking [her]86-lily for sympathy , which [she]86-lily had refused . [The boat]1676-the boat was now half way across [the bay]446-the bay]2304-the man who had marched past her , with his hand raised , aloof , at the head of a procession , in his beautiful boots , asking her for sympathy , which she had refused . the boat was now half way across the bay .

So fine was the morning except for a streak of wind here and there that [the sea]220-the sea and sky looked all one fabric , as if sails were stuck high up in the sky , or the clouds had dropped down into [the sea]220-the sea . [A steamer]2309-a steamer [far out at sea]2310-far out at sea had drawn in the air a great scroll of smoke which stayed there curving and circling decoratively , as if the air were a fine gauze which held things and kept them softly in its mesh , only gently swaying [them]2311-them this way and that . And as happens sometimes when the weather is very fine , [the cliffs]1027-the cliffs looked as if [they]1027-the cliffs were conscious of [the ships]2313-the ships , and [the ships]2313-the ships looked as if [they]2313-the ships were conscious of [the cliffs]1027-the cliffs , as if [they]2313-the ships signalled to [each other]1157-each other some message of [their]2313-the ships own . For sometimes quite close to [the shore]1155-the shore , [the Lighthouse]210-the lighthouse looked this morning in the haze an enormous distance away .

" Where are [they]2325-they now ? "[86-lily] [Lily]86-lily thought , looking out to [sea]1706-sea . Where was [he]2320-he , [that very old man who had gone past [her]86-lily silently , holding a brown paper parcel under [his]2320-he arm]2321-that very old man who had gone past her silently , holding a brown paper parcel under his arm ? [The boat]1676-the boat was in [the middle of [the bay]446-the bay]2300-the middle of the bay .

9

[They]2325-they do n't feel a thing there , [Cam]91-cam thought , looking at [the shore]1155-the shore , which , rising and falling , became steadily more distant and more peaceful . [Her]91-cam hand cut a trail in [the sea]220-the sea , as [her]91-cam mind made the green swirls and streaks into patterns and , numbed and shrouded , wandered in imagination in that underworld of waters where the pearls stuck in clusters to white sprays , where in the green light a change came over [one]222-one 's entire mind and [one]222-one 's body shone half transparent enveloped in a green cloak .

Then the eddy slackened round [her]91-cam hand . The rush of the water ceased ; [the world]300-the world became full of little creaking and squeaking sounds . [One]142-one heard the waves breaking and flapping against the side of [the boat]1676-the boat as if [they]2325-they were anchored in [harbour]2332-harbour . Everything became very close to [one]222-one . For the sail , upon which [James]93-james had [his]93-james eyes fixed until it had become to [him]93-james like [a person whom [he]93-james knew]2334-a person whom he knew , sagged entirely ; there [they]2325-they came to a stop , flapping about waiting for a breeze , in the hot sun , miles from shore , miles from [the Lighthouse]49-the lighthouse . Everything in [the whole world]800-the whole world seemed to stand still . [The Lighthouse]210-the lighthouse became immovable , and the line of [the distant shore]2337-the distant shore became fixed . The sun grew hotter and [everybody]973-everybody seemed to come very close together and to feel [each other]1157-each other 's presence , which [they]973-everybody had almost forgotten . [Macalister]184-macalister 's fishing line went plumb down into [the sea]220-the sea . But [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay went on reading with [his]67-mr. ramsay legs curled under [him]67-mr. ramsay .

[He]67-mr. ramsay was reading a little shiny book with covers mottled like a plover 's egg . Now and again , as they hung about in that horrid calm , [he]67-mr. ramsay turned a page . And [James]93-james felt that each page was turned with a peculiar gesture aimed at [him]93-james ; now assertively , now commandingly ; now with the intention of making [people]264-people pity [him]93-james ; and all the time , as [[his]93-james father]199-his father read and turned one after another of those little pages , [James]93-james kept dreading the moment when [he]199-his father would look up and speak sharply to [him]199-his father about something or other . Why were [they]973-everybody lagging about here ? [he]67-mr. ramsay would demand , or something quite unreasonable like that . And if [he]67-mr. ramsay does , [James]93-james thought , then [I]0-i shall take a knife and strike [him]67-mr. ramsay to the heart .

[He]93-james had always kept this old symbol of taking a knife and striking [[his]93-james father]199-his father to the heart . Only now , as [he]93-james grew older , and sat staring at [[his]93-james father]199-his father in an impotent rage , it was not [him]199-his father , [that old man]2345-that old man reading , whom [he]93-james wanted to kill , but it was the thing that descended on [him]93-james - without [his]93-james knowing it perhaps : that fierce sudden black - winged harpy , with its talons and its beak all cold and hard , that struck and struck at [you]2346-you [he]93-james could feel the beak on [his]93-james bare legs , where it had struck when [he]93-james was [a child]381-a child and then made off , and there [he]93-james was again , [an old man]2348-an old man , very sad , reading [his]93-james book . That [he]93-james would kill , that [he]93-james would strike to the heart . Whatever [he]93-james did - and [he]93-james might do anything , [he]93-james felt , looking at [the Lighthouse]210-the lighthouse and [the distant shore]2337-the distant shore whether [he]93-james was in a business , in [a bank]2351-a bank , [a barrister]2352-a barrister , [a man at the head of some enterprise]2353-a man at the head of some enterprise , that [he]93-james would fight , that [he]93-james would track down and stamp out - tyranny , despotism , [he]93-james called it - making [people]264-people do what [they]264-people did not want to do , cutting off [their]264-people right to speak . How could any of [them]264-people say , But [I]0-i wo n't , when [he]93-james said , Come to [the Lighthouse]210-the lighthouse . Do this . Fetch [me]0-i that . The black wings spread , and the hard beak tore . And then next moment , there [he]93-james sat reading [his]93-james book ; and [he]93-james might look up - [one]222-one never knew - quite reasonably . [He]93-james might talk to [the Macalisters]189-the macalisters . [He]93-james might be pressing a sovereign into [some frozen old woman]2357-some frozen old woman 's hand in [the street]385-the street , [James]93-james thought , and [he]93-james might be shouting out at [some fisherman]2359-some fisherman 's sports ; [he]93-james might be waving [his]93-james arms in the air with excitement . Or [he]93-james might sit at the head of the table dead silent from one end of dinner to the other . Yes , thought [James]93-james , while [the boat]1676-the boat slapped and dawdled there in the hot sun ; there was [a waste of snow and rock]2361-a waste of snow and rock very lonely and austere ; and there [he]93-james had come to feel , quite often lately , when [[his]93-james father]199-his father said something or did something which surprised [the others]280-the others , there were two pairs of footprints only ; [his]93-james own and [[his]93-james father]199-his father 's . [They]2365-they alone knew [each other]1157-each other . What then was this terror , this hatred ? Turning back among the many leaves which the past had folded in [him]93-james , peering into the heart of [that forest]2367-that forest where light and shade so chequer each other that all shape is distorted , and one blunders , now with the sun in [one]222-one 's eyes , now with a dark shadow , [he]93-james sought an image to cool and detach and round off [his]93-james feeling in a concrete shape . Suppose then that as [a child]381-a child sitting helpless in a perambulator , or on [some one]386-some one 's knee , [he]381-a child had seen a waggon crush ignorantly and innocently , [some one]386-some one 's foot ? Suppose [he]381-a child had seen the foot first , in the grass , smooth , and whole ; then the wheel ; and the same foot , purple , crushed . But the wheel was innocent . So now , when [[his]93-james father]199-his father came striding down [the passage]939-the passage knocking [them]2374-them up early in the morning to go to [the Lighthouse]210-the lighthouse down it came over [his]199-his father foot , over [Cam]91-cam 's foot , over [anybody]416-anybody 's foot . [One]222-one sat and watched [it]2378-it .

But whose foot was [he]93-james thinking of , and in [what garden]2379-what garden did all this happen ? For [one]222-one had settings for these scenes ; trees that grew there ; flowers ; a certain light ; a few figures . Everything tended to set itself in [a garden]1576-a garden where there was none of this gloom . None of this throwing of hands about ; [people]264-people spoke in an ordinary tone of voice . [They]2374-them went in and out all day long . There was [an old woman]239-an old woman gossiping in [the kitchen]677-the kitchen ; and the blinds were sucked in and out by the breeze ; all was blowing , all was growing ; and over all those plates and bowls and tall brandishing red and yellow flowers a very thin yellow veil would be drawn , like a vine leaf , at night . Things became stiller and darker at night . But the leaf - like veil was so fine , that lights lifted it , voices crinkled it ; [he]93-james could see through it [a figure stooping , hear , coming close , going away , some dress]2385-a figure stooping , hear , coming close , going away , some dress rustling , some chain tinkling .

It was in [this world]489-this world that the wheel went over [the person]2387-the person 's foot . Something , [he]93-james remembered , stayed flourished up in the air , something arid and sharp descended even there , like a blade , a scimitar , smiting through the leaves and flowers even of [that happy world]2388-that happy world and making it shrivel and fall .

" It will rain , "[199-his father] [he]93-james remembered [[his]93-james father]199-his father saying . " [You]93-james wo n't be able to go to [the Lighthouse]210-the lighthouse . "[199-his father]

[The Lighthouse]210-the lighthouse was then [a silvery , misty - looking tower]2391-a silvery , misty - looking tower with a yellow eye , that opened suddenly , and softly in the evening . Now -

[James]93-james looked at [the Lighthouse]210-the lighthouse . [He]93-james could see the white - washed rocks ; [the tower]2393-the tower , stark and straight ; [he]93-james could see that [it]2393-the tower was barred with black and white ; [he]93-james could see windows in [it]2393-the tower ; [he]93-james could even see washing spread on the rocks to dry . So that was [the Lighthouse]49-the lighthouse , was it ?

No , the other was also [the Lighthouse]49-the lighthouse . For nothing was simply one thing . [The other Lighthouse]2394-the other lighthouse was true too . It was sometimes hardly to be seen across [the bay]446-the bay . In the evening [one]222-one looked up and saw the eye opening and shutting and the light seemed to reach [them]2397-them in [that airy sunny garden where [they]2397-them sat]2398-that airy sunny garden where they sat .

But [he]93-james pulled [himself]93-james up . Whenever [he]93-james said " [they]2397-them "[93-james] or " [a person]1995-a person , "[93-james] and then began hearing the rustle of [some one]386-some one coming , the tinkle of [some one going]2400-some one going , [he]93-james became extremely sensitive to the presence of whoever might be in [the room]213-the room . It was [[his]93-james father]199-his father now . The strain was acute . For in one moment if there was no breeze , [[his]93-james father]199-his father would slap the covers of [his]199-his father book together , and say : " What 's happening now ? What are [we]2397-them dawdling about here for , eh ?
