"[93-james] as , once before [he]93-james had brought [his]93-james blade down among [them]2397-them on [the terrace]225-the terrace and [she]2405-she had gone stiff all over , and if there had been an axe handy , a knife , or anything with a sharp point [he]93-james would have seized it and struck [[his]93-james father]199-his father through the heart . [She]2405-she had gone stiff all over , and then , [her]2405-she arm slackening , so that [he]93-james felt [she]2405-she listened to [him]93-james no longer , [she]2405-she had risen somehow and gone away and left [him]93-james there , impotent , ridiculous , sitting on the floor grasping a pair of scissors .

Not a breath of wind blew . The water chuckled and gurgled in the bottom of [the boat]1676-the boat where [three or four mackerel]2408-three or four mackerel beat their tails up and down in a pool of water not deep enough to cover them . At any moment [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay [he]93-james scarcely dared look at [him]93-james might rouse [himself]93-james , shut [his]93-james book , and say something sharp ; but for the moment [he]93-james was reading , so that [James]93-james stealthily , as if [he]93-james were stealing [downstairs]1590-downstairs on bare feet , afraid of waking [a watchdog by a creaking board]2410-a watchdog by a creaking board , went on thinking what was [she]2405-she like , where did [she]2405-she go that day ? [He]93-james began following [her]2405-she from [room]1709-room to [room]1709-room and at last [they]2413-they came to [a room]2414-a room where in a blue light , as if the reflection came from many china dishes , [she]2405-she talked to [somebody]335-somebody ; [he]93-james listened to [her]2405-she talking . [She]2405-she talked to [a servant]2416-a servant , saying simply whatever came into [her]2405-she head . [She]2405-she alone spoke the truth ; to [her]2405-she alone could [he]93-james speak it . That was the source of [her]2405-she everlasting attraction for [him]93-james , perhaps ; [she]2405-she was [a person to whom one could say what came into one 's head]2417-a person to whom one could say what came into one 's head . But all the time [he]93-james thought of [her]2405-she , [he]93-james was conscious of [[his]93-james father]199-his father following [his]93-james thought , surveying it , making it shiver and falter . At last [he]93-james ceased to think .

There [he]93-james sat with [his]93-james hand on the tiller in the sun , staring at [the Lighthouse]49-the lighthouse , powerless to move , powerless to flick off these grains of misery which settled on [his]93-james mind one after another . A rope seemed to bind [him]93-james there , and [[his]93-james father]199-his father had knotted it and [he]93-james could only escape by taking a knife and plunging it ... But at that moment the sail swung slowly round , filled slowly out , [the boat]1676-the boat seemed to shake [herself]2405-she , and then to move off half conscious in [her]2405-she sleep , and then [she]2405-she woke and shot through the waves . The relief was extraordinary . [They]2421-they all seemed to fall away from each other again and to be at [their]2421-they ease , and the fishing - lines slanted taut across the side of [the boat]1676-the boat . But [[his]93-james father]199-his father did not rouse [himself]199-his father . [He]199-his father only raised [his]199-his father right hand mysteriously high in the air , and let it fall upon [his]199-his father knee again as if [he]199-his father were conducting some secret symphony .

10

[The sea]220-the sea without a stain on it , thought [Lily Briscoe]86-lily , still standing and looking out over [the bay]446-the bay . [The sea]220-the sea stretched like silk across [the bay]446-the bay . Distance had an extraordinary power ; they had been swallowed up in it , [she]86-lily felt , they were gone for ever , they had become part of the nature of things . It was so calm ; it was so quiet . [The steamer]2428-the steamer itself had vanished , but the great scroll of smoke still hung in the air and drooped like a flag mournfully in valediction .

11

It was like that then , [the island]402-the island , thought [Cam]91-cam , once more drawing [her]91-cam fingers through the waves . [She]91-cam had never seen it from out at [sea]1706-sea before . It lay like that on [the sea]220-the sea , did it , with a dent in the middle and two sharp crags , and [the sea]220-the sea swept in there , and spread away for miles and miles on [either side of [the island]402-the island]2433-either side of the island . [It]2435-it was very small ; shaped something like a leaf stood on end . So [we]2436-they took [a little boat]2437-a little boat , [she]91-cam thought , beginning to tell [herself]91-cam a story of adventure about escaping from [a sinking ship]2438-a sinking ship . But with the sea streaming through [her]91-cam fingers , a spray of seaweed vanishing behind [them]2439-them , [she]91-cam did not want to tell [herself]91-cam seriously a story ; it was the sense of adventure and escape that [she]91-cam wanted , for [she]91-cam was thinking , as [the boat]1676-the boat sailed on , how [[her]91-cam father]274-her father 's anger about the points of the compass , [James]93-james 's obstinacy about the compact , and [her]91-cam own anguish , all had slipped , all had passed , all had streamed away . What then came next ? Where were [they]2436-they going ? From [her]91-cam hand , ice cold , held deep in [the sea]220-the sea , there spurted up a fountain of joy at the change , at the escape , at the adventure that [she]91-cam should be alive , that [she]91-cam should be there . And the drops falling from this sudden and unthinking fountain of joy fell here and there on the dark , the slumbrous shapes in [her]91-cam mind ; shapes of a world not realised but turning in their darkness , catching here and there , a spark of light ; [Greece]59-greece , [Rome]32-rome , [Constantinople]60-constantinople . Small as it was , and shaped something like a leaf stood on its end with the gold- sprinkled waters flowing in and about it , it had , [she]91-cam supposed , [a place in [the universe]1755-the universe]2443-a place in the universe - even [that little island]2445-that little island ? [The old gentlemen in [the study]1829-the study [she]91-cam thought]2446-the old gentlemen in the study she thought could have told [her]91-cam . Sometimes [she]91-cam strayed in from [the garden]371-the garden purposely to catch [them]2436-they at it . There [they]2436-they were it might be [Mr. Carmichael]80-mr. carmichael or [Mr. Bankes]90-mr. bankes who was sitting with [[her]91-cam father]274-her father sitting opposite [each other]1157-each other in [their]2436-they low arm - chairs . [They]2436-they were crackling in front of [them]2436-they the pages of THE TIMES , when [she]91-cam came in from [the garden]371-the garden , all in a muddle , about something [some one]386-some one had said about [Christ]190-christ , or hearing that a mammoth had been dug up in [a London street]2453-a london street , or wondering what [Napoleon]152-napoleon was like . Then [they]2436-they took all this with [their]2436-they clean hands [they]2436-they wore grey - coloured clothes ; [they]2436-they smelt of heather and [they]2436-they brushed the scraps together , turning the paper , crossing [their]2436-they knees , and said something now and then very brief . Just to please [herself]91-cam [she]91-cam would take a book from the shelf and stand there , watching [[her]91-cam father]274-her father write , so equally , so neatly from one side of the page to another , with a little cough now and then , or something said briefly to [the other old gentleman]2455-the other old gentleman opposite . And [she]91-cam thought , standing there with [her]91-cam book open , [one]222-one could let whatever one thought expand here like a leaf in water ; and if it did well here , among [the old gentlemen]2457-the old gentlemen smoking and THE TIMES crackling then it was right . And watching [[her]91-cam father]274-her father as [he]274-her father wrote in [[his]274-her father study]1117-his study , [she]91-cam thought now sitting in [the boat]1676-the boat [he]274-her father was not vain , nor [a tyrant]515-a tyrant and did not wish to make [you]2462-you pity [him]274-her father . Indeed , if [he]274-her father saw [she]91-cam was there , reading a book , [he]274-her father would ask [her]91-cam , as gently as [any one]703-any one could , Was there nothing [he]274-her father could give [her]91-cam ?

Lest this should be wrong , [she]91-cam looked at [him]274-her father reading the little book with the shiny cover mottled like a plover 's egg . No ; it was right . Look at [him]274-her father now , [she]91-cam wanted to say aloud to [James]93-james . But [James]93-james had [his]93-james eye on the sail . [He]93-james is [a sarcastic brute]259-a sarcastic brute , [James]93-james would say . [He]93-james brings the talk round to [himself]93-james and [his]93-james books , [James]93-james would say . [He]93-james is intolerably egotistical . Worst of all , [he]93-james is [a tyrant]515-a tyrant . But look ! [she]91-cam said , looking at [him]274-her father . Look at [him]274-her father now . [She]91-cam looked at [him]274-her father reading the little book with [his]274-her father legs curled ; the little book whose yellowish pages [she]91-cam knew , without knowing what was written on them . It was small ; it was closely printed ; on the fly - leaf , [she]91-cam knew , [he]274-her father had written that [he]274-her father had spent fifteen francs on dinner ; the wine had been so much ; [he]274-her father had given so much to [the waiter]2466-the waiter ; all was added up neatly at the bottom of the page . But what might be written in the book which had rounded its edges off in [his]274-her father pocket , [she]91-cam did not know . What [he]274-her father thought [they]2467-they [none of [them]2467-they]2468-none of them knew . But [he]274-her father was absorbed in it , so that when [he]274-her father looked up , as [he]274-her father did now for an instant , it was not to see anything ; it was to pin down some thought more exactly . That done , [his]274-her father mind flew back again and [he]274-her father plunged into [his]274-her father reading . [He]274-her father read , [she]91-cam thought , as if [he]274-her father were guiding something , or wheedling a large flock of sheep , or pushing [his]274-her father way up and up a single narrow path ; and sometimes [he]274-her father went fast and straight , and broke [his]274-her father way through the bramble , and sometimes it seemed a branch struck at [him]274-her father , a bramble blinded [him]274-her father , but [he]274-her father was not going to let [himself]274-her father be beaten by that ; on [he]274-her father went , tossing over page after page . And [she]91-cam went on telling [herself]91-cam a story about escaping from [a sinking ship]2438-a sinking ship , for [she]91-cam was safe , while [he]274-her father sat there ; safe , as [she]91-cam felt [herself]91-cam when [she]91-cam crept in from [the garden]371-the garden , and took a book down , and [the old gentleman]2471-the old gentleman , lowering the paper suddenly , said something very brief over the top of it about the character of [Napoleon]152-napoleon .

[She]91-cam gazed back over [the sea]220-the sea , at [the island]402-the island . But the leaf was losing its sharpness . [It]2474-it was very small ; it was very distant . [The sea]220-the sea was more important now than [the shore]1155-the shore . Waves were all round them , tossing and sinking , with a log wallowing down one wave ; a gull riding on another . About here , [she]91-cam thought , dabbling [her]91-cam fingers in the water , [a ship]633-a ship had sunk , and [she]91-cam murmured , dreamily half asleep , how [we]2478-us perished , [each alone]2871-each alone .

12

So much depends then , thought [Lily Briscoe]86-lily , looking at [the sea]220-the sea which had scarcely a stain on [it]220-the sea , which was so soft that the sails and the clouds seemed set in its blue , so much depends , [she]86-lily thought , upon distance : whether [people]264-people are near [us]2478-us or far from [us]2478-us ; for [her]86-lily feeling for [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay changed as [he]67-mr. ramsay sailed further and further across [the bay]446-the bay . It seemed to be elongated , stretched out ; [he]67-mr. ramsay seemed to become more and more remote . [He]67-mr. ramsay and [[his]67-mr. ramsay children]202-his children seemed to be swallowed up in that blue , that distance ; but here , on [the lawn]310-the lawn , close at hand , [Mr. Carmichael]80-mr. carmichael suddenly grunted . [She]86-lily laughed . [He]67-mr. ramsay clawed [his]67-mr. ramsay book up from the grass . [He]67-mr. ramsay settled into [his]67-mr. ramsay chair again puffing and blowing like some sea monster . That was different altogether , because [he]67-mr. ramsay was so near . And now again all was quiet . [They]2485-they must be out of bed by this time , [she]86-lily supposed , looking at [the house]299-the house , but nothing appeared there . But then , [she]86-lily remembered , [they]2485-they had always made off directly a meal was over , on business of [their]2485-they own . It was all in keeping with this silence , this emptiness , and the unreality of the early morning hour . It was a way things had sometimes , [she]86-lily thought , lingering for a moment and looking at the long glittering windows and the plume of blue smoke : they became illness , before habits had spun themselves across the surface , [one]222-one felt that same unreality , which was so startling ; felt something emerge . Life was most vivid then . [One]222-one could be at [one]222-one 's ease . Mercifully [one]222-one need not say , very briskly , crossing [the lawn]310-the lawn to greet [old Mrs. Beckwith]180-mrs. beckwith , who would be coming out to find a corner to sit in , " Oh , good - morning , [Mrs. Beckwith]180-mrs. beckwith ! What a lovely day ! Are [you]180-mrs. beckwith going to be so bold as to sit in the sun ? [Jasper]72-jasper 's hidden the chairs . Do let [me]180-mrs. beckwith find [you]180-mrs. beckwith one ! "[180-mrs. beckwith] and all the rest of the usual chatter . [One]222-one need not speak at all . [One]142-one glided , one shook [one]222-one 's sails there was a good deal of movement in [the bay]446-the bay , [boats]2495-boats were starting off between things , beyond things . [Empty]61-empty [it]61-empty was not , but full to the brim . [She]86-lily seemed to be standing up to the lips in some substance , to move and float and sink in it , yes , for [these waters]2496-these waters were unfathomably deep . Into them had spilled so many lives . [The Ramsays]82-the ramsays ' ; [the children]258-the children 's ; and all sorts of waifs and strays of things besides . [A washer - woman]2498-a washer - woman with [her]2498-a washer - woman basket ; a rook , a red - hot poker ; the purples and grey - greens of flowers : some common feeling which held the whole together .

It was some such feeling of completeness perhaps which , ten years ago , standing almost where [she]86-lily stood now , had made [her]86-lily say that [she]86-lily must be in love with [the place]888-the place . Love had a thousand shapes . There might be [lovers whose gift it was to choose out the elements of things and place them together]2500-lovers whose gift it was to choose out the elements of things and place them together and so , giving [them]2500-lovers whose gift it was to choose out the elements of things and place them together a wholeness not theirs in life , make of some scene , or meeting of [people all now gone and separate]2501-people all now gone and separate , one of those globed compacted things over which thought lingers , and love plays .

[Her]86-lily eyes rested on the brown speck of [[Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay 's sailing boat]2502-mr. ramsay 's sailing boat . [They]2503-they would be at [the Lighthouse]49-the lighthouse by lunch time [she]86-lily supposed . But the wind had freshened , and , as the sky changed slightly and [the sea]220-the sea changed slightly and [the boats]1037-the boats altered their positions , the view , which a moment before had seemed miraculously fixed , was now unsatisfactory . The wind had blown the trail of smoke about ; there was something displeasing about the placing of [the ships]2313-the ships .

The disproportion there seemed to upset some harmony in [her]86-lily own mind . [She]86-lily felt an obscure distress . It was confirmed when [she]86-lily turned to [her]86-lily picture . [She]86-lily had been wasting [her]86-lily morning . For whatever reason [she]86-lily could not achieve that razor edge of balance between two opposite forces ; [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay and the picture ; which was necessary . There was something perhaps wrong with the design ? Was it , [she]86-lily wondered , that the line of the wall wanted breaking , was it that the mass of the trees was too heavy ? [She]86-lily smiled ironically ; for had [she]86-lily not thought , when [she]86-lily began , that [she]86-lily had solved [her]86-lily problem ?

What was the problem then ? [She]86-lily must try to get hold of something tht evaded [her]86-lily . It evaded [her]86-lily when [she]86-lily thought of [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay ; it evaded [her]86-lily now when [she]86-lily thought of [her]86-lily picture . Phrases came . Visions came . Beautiful pictures . Beautiful phrases . But what [she]86-lily wished to get hold of was that very jar on the nerves , the thing itself before it has been made anything . Get that and start afresh ; get that and start afresh ; [she]86-lily said desperately , pitching [herself]86-lily firmly again before [her]86-lily easel . It was a miserable machine , an inefficient machine , [she]86-lily thought , the human apparatus for painting or for feeling ; it always broke down at the critical moment ; heroically , one must force it on . [She]86-lily stared , frowning . There was the hedge , sure enough . But [one]222-one got nothing by soliciting urgently . [One]222-one got only a glare in the eye from looking at the line of the wall , or from thinking - [she]86-lily wore a grey hat . [She]86-lily was astonishingly beautiful . Let it come , [she]86-lily thought , if it will come . For there are moments when [one]222-one can neither think nor feel . And if [one]222-one can neither think nor feel , [she]86-lily thought , where is [one]222-one ?

Here on the grass , on the ground , [she]86-lily thought , sitting down , and examining with [her]86-lily brush a little colony of plantains . For [the lawn]310-the lawn was very rough . Here sitting on [the world]300-the world , [she]86-lily thought , for [she]86-lily could not shake [herself]86-lily free from the sense that everything this morning was happening for the first time , perhaps for the last time , as [a traveller]2514-a traveller , even though [he]2514-a traveller is half asleep , knows , looking out of the train window , that [he]2514-a traveller must look now , for [he]2514-a traveller will never see [that town]2515-that town , or [that mule - cart]2516-that mule - cart , or [that woman at work in [the fields]762-the fields]2517-that woman at work in the fields , again . [The lawn]310-the lawn was [the world]300-the world ; [they]2521-they were up here together , on [this exalted station]2522-this exalted station , [she]86-lily thought , looking at [old [Mr. Carmichael]80-mr. carmichael , who seemed though [they]2521-they had not said a word all this time to share [her]86-lily thoughts]80-mr. carmichael . And [she]86-lily would never see [him]80-mr. carmichael again perhaps . [He]80-mr. carmichael was growing old . Also , [she]86-lily remembered , smiling at the slipper that dangled from [his]80-mr. carmichael foot , [he]80-mr. carmichael was growing famous . [People]264-people said that [his]80-mr. carmichael poetry was ' so beautiful . " [They]264-people went and published things [he]80-mr. carmichael had written forty years ago . There was [a famous man now called [Carmichael]80-mr. carmichael]2897-a famous man now called carmichael , [she]86-lily smiled , thinking how many shapes [one person]1763-one person might wear , how [he]80-mr. carmichael was that in the newspapers , but here the same as [he]80-mr. carmichael had always been . [He]80-mr. carmichael looked the same - greyer , rather . Yes , [he]80-mr. carmichael looked the same , but [somebody]335-somebody had said , [she]86-lily recalled , that when [he]80-mr. carmichael had heard of [Andrew Ramsay]71-andrew 's death [he]80-mr. carmichael was killed in a second by a shell ; [he]80-mr. carmichael should have been [a great mathematician]2900-a great mathematician [Mr. Carmichael]80-mr. carmichael had "[264-people] lost all interest in life . " What did it mean - that ? [she]86-lily wondered . Had [he]80-mr. carmichael marched through [Trafalgar Square]62-trafalgar square grasping a big stick ? Had [he]80-mr. carmichael turned pages over and over , without reading them , sitting in [[his]80-mr. carmichael room in [St. John 's Wood]63-st. john 's wood alone]2901-his room in st. john 's wood alone ? [She]86-lily did not know what [he]80-mr. carmichael had done , when [he]80-mr. carmichael heard that [Andrew]71-andrew was killed , but [she]86-lily felt it in [him]80-mr. carmichael all the same . [They]2902-they only mumbled at [each other]1157-each other on [staircases]2904-staircases ; [they]2902-they looked up at the sky and said it will be fine or it wo n't be fine . But this was one way of knowing [people]264-people , [she]86-lily thought : to know the outline , not the detail , to sit in [one 's garden]2906-one 's garden and look at [the slopes of a hill running purple down into the distant heather]2907-the slopes of a hill running purple down into the distant heather . [She]86-lily knew [him]80-mr. carmichael in that way . [She]86-lily knew that [he]80-mr. carmichael had changed somehow . [She]86-lily had never read a line of [his]80-mr. carmichael poetry . [She]86-lily thought that [she]86-lily knew how it went though , slowly and sonorously . It was seasoned and mellow . It was about [the desert]1719-the desert and the camel . It was about the palm tree and the sunset . It was extremely impersonal ; it said something about death ; it said very little about love . There was an impersonality about [him]80-mr. carmichael . [He]80-mr. carmichael wanted very little of [other people]332-other people . Had [he]80-mr. carmichael not always lurched rather awkwardly past the drawing - room window with some newspaper under [his]80-mr. carmichael arm , trying to avoid [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay whom for some reason [he]80-mr. carmichael did not much like ? On that account , of course , [she]86-lily would always try to make [him]80-mr. carmichael stop . [He]80-mr. carmichael would bow to [her]86-lily . [He]80-mr. carmichael would halt unwillingly and bow profoundly . No , [he]80-mr. carmichael wanted nothing . Here [he]80-mr. carmichael bowed . There was some quality in [her]86-lily which [he]80-mr. carmichael did not much like . It was perhaps [her]86-lily masterfulness , [her]86-lily positiveness , something matter - of - fact in [her]86-lily . [She]86-lily was so direct .[264-people]

A noise drew [her]2524-her attention to the drawing - room window - the squeak of a hinge . The light breeze was toying with the window .

There must have been people who disliked [her]2524-her very much , [Lily]86-lily thought Yes ; [she]86-lily realised that the drawing - room step was empty , but it had no effect on [her]2524-her whatever . [She]86-lily did not want [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay now . - People who thought [her]2524-her too sure , too drastic .

Also , [her]2524-her beauty offended [people]264-people probably . How monotonous , [they]264-people would say , and the same always ! [They]264-people preferred another type - the dark , the vivacious . Then [she]2524-her was weak with [[her]2524-her husband]234-her husband . [She]2524-her let [him]234-her husband make those scenes . Then [she]2524-her was reserved . [Nobody]216-nobody knew exactly what had happened to [her]2524-her . And to go back to [Mr. Carmichael]80-mr. carmichael and [his]234-her husband dislike one could not imagine [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay standing painting , lying reading , a whole morning on [the lawn]310-the lawn . It was unthinkable . Without saying a word , the only token of [her]2524-her errand a basket on [her]2524-her arm , [she]2524-her went off to [the town]231-the town , to [the poor]947-the poor , to sit in [some stuffy little bedroom]2531-some stuffy little bedroom . Often and often [Lily]86-lily had seen [her]2524-her go silently in the midst of some game , some discussion , with [her]2524-her basket on [her]2524-her arm , very upright . [She]86-lily had noted [her]2524-her return . [She]86-lily had thought , half laughing [she]2524-her was so methodical with the tea cups , half moved [her]2524-her beauty took [one]222-one 's breath away , eyes that are closing in pain have looked on [you]2533-you . [You]2533-you have been with [them]2534-them [there]236-there .

And then [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay would be annoyed because [somebody]335-somebody was late , or the butter not fresh , or the teapot chipped . And all the time [she]2524-her was saying that the butter was not fresh one would be thinking of [Greek temples]2537-greek temples , and how beauty had been with [them]2537-greek temples there in [that stuffy little room]2538-that stuffy little room . [She]2524-her never talked of it - [she]2524-her went , punctually , directly . It was [her]2524-her instinct to go , an instinct like the swallows for [the south]2539-the south , the artichokes for the sun , turning [her]2524-her infallibly to [the human race]1308-the human race , making [her]2524-her nest in its heart . And this , like all instincts , was a little distressing to [people who did not share it]2541-people who did not share it ; to [Mr. Carmichael]80-mr. carmichael perhaps , to [herself]2524-her certainly . Some notion was in both of [them]2542-them about the ineffectiveness of action , the supremacy of thought . [Her]2524-her going was a reproach to [them]2542-them , gave a different twist to [the world]300-the world , so that [they]2542-them were led to protest , seeing [their]2542-them own prepossessions disappear , and clutch at [them]2542-them vanishing . [Charles Tansley]68-charles tansley did that too : it was part of the reason why [one]222-one disliked [him]68-charles tansley . [She]2524-her raised a little mountain for [the ants]2559-the ants to climb over . [She]2524-her reduced [them]2559-the ants to a frenzy of indecision by this interference in [their]2559-the ants cosmogony . [Some]1757-some ran this way , others that .

[One]142-one wanted fifty pairs of eyes to see with , [she]2524-her reflected . Fifty pairs of eyes were not enough to get round [that one woman]2561-that one woman with , [she]2524-her thought . Among [them]2559-the ants , must be one that was stone blind to [her]2561-that one woman beauty . One wanted most some secret sense , fine as air , with which to steal through keyholes and surround [her]2561-that one woman where [she]2561-that one woman sat knitting , talking , sitting silent in the window alone ; which took to itself and treasured up like the air which held the smoke of [the steamer]2428-the steamer , [her]2561-that one woman thoughts , [her]2561-that one woman imaginations , [her]2561-that one woman desires . What did the hedge mean to [her]2561-that one woman , what did [the garden]371-the garden mean to [her]2561-that one woman , what did it mean to [her]2561-that one woman when a wave broke ? [Lily]86-lily looked up , as [she]86-lily had seen [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay look up ; [she]86-lily too heard a wave falling on [the beach]366-the beach . And then what stirred and trembled in [her]86-lily mind when [the children]258-the children cried , " How 's that ? How 's that ? "[258-the children] cricketing ? [She]86-lily would stop knitting for a second . [She]86-lily would look intent . Then [she]86-lily would lapse again , and suddenly [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay stopped dead in [his]67-mr. ramsay pacing in front of [her]86-lily and some curious shock passed through [her]86-lily and seemed to rock [her]86-lily in profound agitation on its breast when stopping there [he]67-mr. ramsay stood over [her]86-lily and looked down at [her]86-lily . [Lily]86-lily could see [him]67-mr. ramsay .

[He]67-mr. ramsay stretched out [his]67-mr. ramsay hand and raised [her]86-lily from [her]86-lily chair . It seemed somehow as if [he]67-mr. ramsay had done it before ; as if [he]67-mr. ramsay had once bent in the same way and raised [her]86-lily from [a boat]1340-a boat which , lying a few inches off [some island]2567-some island , had required that [the ladies]2568-the ladies should thus be helped on [shore]2569-shore by [the gentlemen]2570-the gentlemen . An old - fashioned scene that was , which required , very nearly , crinolines and peg - top trousers . Letting [herself]86-lily be helped by [him]67-mr. ramsay , [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay had thought [Lily]86-lily supposed the time has come now . Yes , [she]86-lily would say it now . Time after time the same thrill had passed between [them]2572-they - obviously it had , [Lily]86-lily thought , smoothing a way for [her]86-lily ants . [She]86-lily was not inventing ; [she]86-lily was only trying to smooth out something [she]86-lily had been given years ago folded up ; something [she]86-lily had seen . For in the rough and tumble of daily life , with [all those children]2573-all those children about , [all those visitors]2574-all those visitors , [one]222-one had constantly a sense of repetition - of one thing falling where another had fallen , and so setting up an echo which chimed in the air and made it full of vibrations .

But it would be a mistake , [she]86-lily thought , thinking how [they]2572-they walked off together , arm in arm , past [the greenhouse]955-the greenhouse , to simplify [their]2572-they relationship . It was no monotony of bliss - [she]86-lily with [her]86-lily impulses and quicknesses ; [he]67-mr. ramsay with [his]67-mr. ramsay shudders and glooms . Oh , no . The bedroom door would slam violently early in the morning . [He]67-mr. ramsay would start from the table in a temper . [He]67-mr. ramsay would whizz [his]67-mr. ramsay plate through the window . Then all through [the house]299-the house there would be a sense of doors slamming and blinds fluttering , as if a gusty wind were blowing and [people]264-people scudded about trying in a hasty way to fasten hatches and make things ship- shape . [She]86-lily had met [Paul Rayley]78-paul like that one day on [the stairs]2579-the stairs . [They]2572-they had laughed and laughed , like [a couple of [children]325-children]2580-a couple of children , all because [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay , finding an earwig in [his]67-mr. ramsay milk at breakfast had sent the whole thing flying through the air on to [the terrace outside]2582-the terrace outside . ' An earwig , [Prue]94-prue murmured , awestruck , ' in [his]67-mr. ramsay milk . ' [Other people]332-other people might find centipedes . But [he]67-mr. ramsay had built round [him]67-mr. ramsay such a fence of sanctity , and occupied [the space]2584-the space with such a demeanour of majesty that an earwig in [his]67-mr. ramsay milk was a monster .

But it tired [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay , it cowed [her]86-lily a little - the plates whizzing and the doors slamming . And there would fall between [them]2572-they sometimes long rigid silences , when , in a state of mind which annoyed [Lily]86-lily in [her]86-lily , half plaintive , half resentful , [she]86-lily seemed unable to surmount the tempest calmly , or to laugh as [they]2572-they laughed , but in [her]86-lily weariness perhaps concealed something . [She]86-lily brooded and sat silent . After a time [he]67-mr. ramsay would hang stealthily about the places where [she]86-lily was - roaming under the window where [she]86-lily sat writing letters or talking , for [she]86-lily would take care to be busy when [he]67-mr. ramsay passed , and evade [him]67-mr. ramsay , and pretend not to see [him]67-mr. ramsay . Then [he]67-mr. ramsay would turn smooth as silk , affable , urbane , and try to win [her]86-lily so . Still [she]86-lily would hold off , and now [she]86-lily would assert for a brief season some of those prides and airs the due of [her]86-lily beauty which [she]86-lily was generally utterly without ; would turn [her]86-lily head ; would look so , over [her]86-lily shoulder , always with [some Minta]77-minta , [Paul]78-paul , or [William Bankes]87-william bankes at [her]86-lily side . At length , standing outside the group the very figure of a famished wolfhound [Lily]86-lily got up off the grass and stood looking at the steps , at the window , where [she]86-lily had seen [him]67-mr. ramsay , [he]67-mr. ramsay would say [her]86-lily name , once only , for all [the world]300-the world like a wolf barking in the snow , but still [she]86-lily held back ; and [he]67-mr. ramsay would say it once more , and this time something in the tone would rouse [her]86-lily , and [she]86-lily would go to [him]67-mr. ramsay , leaving [them]2586-they all of a sudden , and [they]2586-they would walk off together among the pear trees , the cabbages , and the raspberry beds . [They]2586-they would have it out together . But with what attitudes and with what words ? Such a dignity was [theirs]2586-they in this relationship that , turning away , [she]86-lily and [Paul]78-paul and [Minta]77-minta would hide [their]2586-they curiosity and [their]2586-they discomfort , and begin picking flowers , throwing balls , chattering , until it was time for dinner , and there [they]2586-they were , [he]67-mr. ramsay at one end of the table , [she]86-lily at the other , as usual .

" Why do n't some of [you]2586-they take up botany ? .. With all those legs and arms why does n't one of [you]2586-they ... ? "[2586-they] So [they]2586-they would talk as usual , laughing , among [the children]258-the children . All would be as usual , save only for some quiver , as of a blade in the air , which came and went between [them]2586-they as if the usual sight of [the children]258-the children sitting round [their]258-the children soup plates had freshened itself in [their]258-the children eyes after that hour among the pears and the cabbages . Especially , [Lily]86-lily thought , [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay would glance at [Prue]94-prue . [She]94-prue sat in the middle between [brothers]340-brothers and [sisters]329-sisters , always occupied , it seemed , seeing that nothing went wrong so that [she]94-prue scarcely spoke [herself]94-prue . How [Prue]94-prue must have blamed [herself]94-prue for that earwig in the milk How white [she]94-prue had gone when [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay threw [his]67-mr. ramsay plate through the window ! How [she]94-prue drooped under those long silences between [them]2586-they ! Anyhow , [[her]94-prue mother]897-her mother now would seem to be making it up to [her]94-prue ; assuring [her]94-prue that everything was well ; promising [her]94-prue that one of these days that same happiness would be [hers]94-prue . [She]94-prue had enjoyed it for less than a year , however .

[She]94-prue had let the flowers fall from [her]94-prue basket , [Lily]86-lily thought , screwing up [her]86-lily eyes and standing back as if to look at [her]94-prue picture , which [she]94-prue was not touching , however , with all [her]94-prue faculties in a trance , frozen over superficially but moving underneath with extreme speed .

[She]94-prue let [her]94-prue flowers fall from [her]94-prue basket , scattered and tumbled them on to the grass and , reluctantly and hesitatingly , but without question or complaint - had [she]94-prue not the faculty of obedience to perfection ? - went too . [Down fields]2592-down fields , across [valleys]1404-valleys , white , flower - strewn - that was how [she]94-prue would have painted it . [The hills]2128-the hills were austere . [It]2128-the hills was rocky ; it was steep . The waves sounded hoarse on the stones beneath . [They]2595-they went , [the three of [them]2595-they]2596-the three of them together , [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay walking rather fast in front , as if [she]65-mrs. ramsay expected to meet [some one round the corner]307-some one round the corner .

Suddenly the window at which [she]94-prue was looking was whitened by some light stuff behind it . At last then [somebody]335-somebody had come into [the drawing - room]200-the drawing - room ; [somebody]335-somebody was sitting in the chair . For Heaven 's sake , [she]94-prue prayed , let [them]335-somebody sit still there and not come floundering out to talk to [her]94-prue . Mercifully , whoever it was stayed still inside ; had settled by some stroke of luck so as to throw an odd - shaped triangular shadow over the step . It altered the composition of the picture a little . It was interesting . It might be useful . [Her]94-prue mood was coming back to [her]94-prue . [One]222-one must keep on looking without for a second relaxing the intensity of emotion , the determination not to be put off , not to be bamboozled . [One]222-one must hold the scene - so - in a vise and let nothing come in and spoil it . [One]222-one wanted , [she]94-prue thought , dipping [her]94-prue brush deliberately , to be on a level with ordinary experience , to feel simply that 's a chair , that 's a table , and yet at the same time , It 's a miracle , it 's an ecstasy . The problem might be solved after all . Ah , but what had happened ? Some wave of white went over the window pane . The air must have stirred some flounce in [the room]213-the room . [Her]94-prue heart leapt at [her]94-prue and seized [her]94-prue and tortured [her]94-prue .

" [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay ! [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay ! "[94-prue] [she]94-prue cried , feeling the old horror come back - to want and want and not to have . Could [she]94-prue inflict that still ? And then , quietly , as if [she]94-prue refrained , that too became part of ordinary experience , was on a level with the chair , with the table . [Mrs. Ramsay]65-mrs. ramsay - it was part of [her]65-mrs. ramsay perfect goodness - sat there quite simply , in the chair , flicked [her]65-mrs. ramsay needles to and fro , knitted [her]65-mrs. ramsay reddish - brown stocking , cast [her]65-mrs. ramsay shadow on the step . There [she]65-mrs. ramsay sat .

And as if [she]65-mrs. ramsay had something [she]65-mrs. ramsay must share , yet could hardly leave [her]65-mrs. ramsay easel , so full [her]65-mrs. ramsay mind was of what [she]65-mrs. ramsay was thinking , of what [she]65-mrs. ramsay was seeing , [Lily]86-lily went past [Mr. Carmichael]80-mr. carmichael holding [her]65-mrs. ramsay brush to the edge of [the lawn]310-the lawn . Where was [that boat]2606-that boat now ? And [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay ? [She]86-lily wanted [him]67-mr. ramsay .

13

[Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay had almost done reading . One hand hovered over the page as if to be in readiness to turn it the very instant [he]67-mr. ramsay had finished it . [He]67-mr. ramsay sat there bareheaded with the wind blowing [his]67-mr. ramsay hair about , extraordinarily exposed to everything . [He]67-mr. ramsay looked very old . [He]67-mr. ramsay looked , [James]93-james thought , getting [his]67-mr. ramsay head now against [the Lighthouse]210-the lighthouse , now against the waste of waters running away into the open , like some old stone lying on the sand ; [he]67-mr. ramsay looked as if [he]67-mr. ramsay had become physically what was always at the back of both of [their]2608-them minds - that loneliness which was for both of [them]2608-them the truth about things .

[He]67-mr. ramsay was reading very quickly , as if [he]67-mr. ramsay were eager to get to the end . Indeed [they]2608-them were very close to [the Lighthouse]210-the lighthouse now . There it loomed up , stark and straight , glaring white and black , and [one]222-one could see the waves breaking in white splinters like smashed glass upon [the rocks]2611-the rocks . [One]222-one could see lines and creases in [the rocks]2611-the rocks . [One]222-one could see the windows clearly ; a dab of white on one of them , and a little tuft of green on [the rock]1143-the rock . [A man]1103-a man had come out and looked at [them]2608-them through a glass and gone in again . So it was like that , [James]93-james thought , [the Lighthouse [one]222-one had seen across [the bay]446-the bay]2617-the lighthouse one had seen across the bay all these years ; [it]210-the lighthouse was [a stark tower on [a bare rock]2620-a bare rock]2619-a stark tower on a bare rock . It satisfied [him]93-james . It confirmed some obscure feeling of [his]93-james about [his]93-james own character . [The old ladies]2621-the old ladies , [he]93-james thought , thinking of [the garden at [home]378-home]2622-the garden at home , went dragging [their]2621-the old ladies chairs about on [the lawn]310-the lawn . [Old Mrs. Beckwith]180-mrs. beckwith , for example , was always saying how nice it was and how sweet it was and how [they]2621-the old ladies ought to be so proud and [they]2621-the old ladies ought to be so happy , but as a matter of fact , [James]93-james thought , looking at [the Lighthouse]210-the lighthouse stood there on [[its]210-the lighthouse rock]2626-its rock , it 's like that . [He]93-james looked at [[his]93-james father]199-his father reading fiercely with [his]199-his father legs curled tight . [They]2628-they shared that knowledge . " [We]2628-they are driving before a gale - [we]2628-they must sink , "[93-james] [he]93-james began saying to [himself]93-james , half aloud , exactly as [[his]93-james father]199-his father said it .

[Nobody]216-nobody seemed to have spoken for an age . [Cam]91-cam was tired of looking at [the sea]220-the sea . Little bits of black cork had floated past ; the fish were dead in the bottom of [the boat]1676-the boat . Still [[her]91-cam father]274-her father read , and [James]93-james looked at [him]274-her father and [she]91-cam looked at [him]274-her father , and [they]2628-they vowed that [they]2628-they would fight tyranny to the death , and [he]274-her father went on reading quite unconscious of what [they]2628-they thought . It was thus that [he]274-her father escaped , [she]91-cam thought . Yes , with [his]274-her father great forehead and [his]274-her father great nose , holding [his]274-her father little mottled book firmly in front of [him]274-her father , [he]274-her father escaped . [You]2634-you might try to lay hands on [him]274-her father , but then like a bird , [he]274-her father spread [his]274-her father wings , [he]274-her father floated off to settle out of [your]2634-you reach somewhere far away on some desolate stump . [She]91-cam gazed at [the immense expanse of [the sea]220-the sea]2635-the immense expanse of the sea . [The island]402-the island had grown so small that [it]402-the island scarcely looked like a leaf any longer . [It]402-the island looked like the top of a rock which some wave bigger than the rest would cover . Yet in [its]402-the island frailty were all [those paths]2638-those paths , [those terraces]2639-those terraces , [those bedrooms]2640-those bedrooms - all those innumberable things . But as , just before sleep , things simplify themselves so that only one of all the myriad details has power to assert itself , so , [she]91-cam felt , looking drowsily at [the island]402-the island , all those paths and [terraces]2642-terraces and [bedrooms]1233-bedrooms were fading and disappearing , and nothing was left but a pale blue censer swinging rhythmically this way and that across [her]91-cam mind . It was [a hanging garden]2644-a hanging garden ; it was [a valley , full of birds , and flowers]2645-a valley , full of birds , and flowers , and antelopes ... [She]91-cam was falling asleep .

" Come now , "[67-mr. ramsay] said [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay , suddenly shutting [his]67-mr. ramsay book .

Come where ? To what extraordinary adventure ? [She]91-cam woke with a start . To land somewhere , to climb somewhere ? Where was [he]67-mr. ramsay leading [them]2646-them ? For after [his]67-mr. ramsay immense silence the words startled [them]2646-them . But it was absurd . [He]67-mr. ramsay was hungry , [he]67-mr. ramsay said . It was time for lunch . " [He]67-mr. ramsay 's doing very well , "[184-macalister] said [Macalister]184-macalister , praising [James]93-james . " [He]67-mr. ramsay 's keeping [her]2911-her very steady . "[184-macalister]

But [[his]93-james father]199-his father never praised [him]93-james , [James]93-james thought grimly .

[Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay opened the parcel and shared out the sandwiches among [them]2646-them . Now [he]67-mr. ramsay was happy , eating bread and cheese with [these fishermen]1623-these fishermen . [He]67-mr. ramsay would have liked to live in [a cottage]2649-a cottage and lounge about in [the harbour]1036-the harbour spitting with [the other old men]2651-the other old men , [James]93-james thought , watching [him]67-mr. ramsay slice [his]67-mr. ramsay cheese into thin yellow sheets with [his]67-mr. ramsay penknife .

This is right , this is it , [Cam]91-cam kept feeling , as [she]91-cam peeled [her]91-cam hard- boiled egg . At the same time [they]333-the old men were sailing so fast along by [the rocks]2611-the rocks that it was very exciting - it seemed as if [they]333-the old men were doing two things at once ; [they]333-the old men were eating [their]333-the old men lunch here in the sun and [they]333-the old men were also making for safety in a great storm after a shipwreck . Would the water last ? Would the provisions last ? [she]91-cam asked [herself]91-cam , telling [herself]91-cam a story but knowing at the same time what was the truth .

[They]333-the old men would soon be out of it , [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay was saying to [old Macalister]184-macalister ; but [[their]333-the old men children]2655-their children would see some strange things . [Macalister]184-macalister said [he]184-macalister was seventy - five last [March]191-march ; [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay was seventy - one . [He]274-her father said it so wisely , as if [he]274-her father knew so well all the things that happened in [the world]300-the world that [she]91-cam put it back at once , and then [he]274-her father gave [her]91-cam , from [his]274-her father own parcel , a gingerbread nut , as if [he]274-her father were [a great Spanish gentleman]2662-a great spanish gentleman , [she]91-cam thought , handing a flower to [a lady at a window so courteous [his]274-her father manner]2663-a lady at a window so courteous his manner was . " That was where [she]91-cam sunk , "[184-macalister] said [[Macalister]184-macalister 's boy]2041-macalister 's boy suddenly .

[Three men]2666-three men were drowned where [we]2667-we are now , [the old man]2170-the old man said . And [Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay taking a look at the spot was about , [James]93-james and [Cam]91-cam were afraid , to burst out :

" Well done ! "[67-mr. ramsay] [James]93-james had steered [them]2664-they like [a born sailor]2672-a born sailor .

There ! [Cam]91-cam thought , addressing [herself]91-cam silently to [James]93-james . [You]93-james 've got it at last . For [she]91-cam knew that this was what [James]93-james had been wanting , and [she]91-cam knew that now [he]93-james had got it [he]93-james was so pleased that [he]93-james would not look at [her]91-cam or at [[his]93-james father]199-his father or at [any one]703-any one . There [he]93-james sat with [his]93-james hand on the tiller sitting bolt upright , looking rather sulky and frowning slightly . [He]93-james was so pleased that [he]93-james was not going to let [anybody]416-anybody share a grain of [his]93-james pleasure . [[His]93-james father]199-his father had praised [him]93-james . [They]2677-they must think that [he]93-james was perfectly indifferent . But [you]2678-you 've got it now , [Cam]91-cam thought .

[They]2677-they had tacked , and [they]2677-they were sailing swiftly , buoyantly on long rocking waves which handed [them]2677-they on from one to another with an extraordinary lilt and exhilaration beside [the reef]2679-the reef . On the left a row of rocks showed brown through the water which thinned and became greener and on one , [a higher rock]2680-a higher rock , a wave incessantly broke and spurted a little column of drops which fell down in a shower . [One]222-one could hear the slap of the water and the patter of falling drops and a kind of hushing and hissing sound from the waves rolling and gambolling and slapping the rocks as if [they]2677-they were [wild creatures who were perfectly free and tossed and tumbled and sported like this for ever]2682-wild creatures who were perfectly free and tossed and tumbled and sported like this for ever .

Now [they]2677-they could see [two men on the Lighthouse]2683-two men on the lighthouse , watching [them]2677-they and making ready to meet [them]2677-they .

[Mr. Ramsay]67-mr. ramsay buttoned [his]67-mr. ramsay coat , and turned up [his]67-mr. ramsay trousers . [He]67-mr. ramsay took the large , badly packed , brown paper parcel which [Nancy]75-nancy had got ready and sat with it on [his]67-mr. ramsay knee . Thus in complete readiness to [land]2684-land [he]67-mr. ramsay sat looking back at [the island]402-the island . With [his]67-mr. ramsay long - sighted eyes perhaps [he]67-mr. ramsay could see the dwindled leaf - like shape standing on end on a plate of gold quite clearly . What could [he]67-mr. ramsay see ? [Cam]91-cam wondered . It was all a blur to [her]91-cam . What was [he]67-mr. ramsay thinking now ? [she]91-cam wondered . What was it [he]67-mr. ramsay sought , so fixedly , so intently , so silently ? Then [he]67-mr. ramsay put on [his]67-mr. ramsay hat .

" [He]67-mr. ramsay must have reached it , "[86-lily] said [Lily Briscoe]86-lily aloud , feeling suddenly completely tired out . For [the Lighthouse]210-the lighthouse had become almost invisible , had melted away into a blue haze , and the effort of looking at it and the effort of thinking of [him]67-mr. ramsay landing there , which both seemed to be one and the same effort , had stretched [her]86-lily body and mind to the utmost . Ah , but [she]86-lily was relieved . Whatever [she]86-lily had wanted to give [him]67-mr. ramsay , when [he]67-mr. ramsay left [her]86-lily that morning , [she]86-lily had given [him]67-mr. ramsay at last .

" [He]67-mr. ramsay has landed , "[86-lily] [she]86-lily said aloud . " It is finished . "[86-lily] Then , surging up , puffing slightly , [old Mr. Carmichael]80-mr. carmichael stood beside [her]86-lily , looking like [an old pagan god]2695-an old pagan god , shaggy , with weeds in [his]80-mr. carmichael hair and the trident it was only a French novel in [his]80-mr. carmichael hand . [He]80-mr. carmichael stood by [her]86-lily on the edge of [the lawn]310-the lawn , swaying a little in [his]80-mr. carmichael bulk and said , shading [his]80-mr. carmichael eyes with [his]80-mr. carmichael hand : " [They]2697-they will have landed , "[80-mr. carmichael] and [she]86-lily felt that [she]86-lily had been right . [They]2697-they had not needed to speak . [They]2697-they had been thinking the same things and [he]67-mr. ramsay had answered [her]86-lily without [her]86-lily asking [him]67-mr. ramsay anything . [He]67-mr. ramsay stood there as if [he]67-mr. ramsay were spreading [his]67-mr. ramsay hands over all the weakness and suffering of [mankind]1730-mankind ; [she]86-lily thought [he]67-mr. ramsay was surveying , tolerantly and compassionately , [their]2697-they final destiny . Now [he]67-mr. ramsay has crowned the occasion , [she]86-lily thought , when [his]67-mr. ramsay hand slowly fell , as if [she]86-lily had seen [him]67-mr. ramsay let fall from [his]67-mr. ramsay great height a wreath of violets and asphodels which , fluttering slowly , lay at length upon [the earth]2699-the earth .

Quickly , as if [she]86-lily were recalled by something over there , [she]86-lily turned to [her]86-lily canvas . There it was - [her]86-lily picture . Yes , with all its greens and blues , its lines running up and across , its attempt at something . It would be hung in [the attics]1552-the attics , [she]86-lily thought ; it would be destroyed . But what did that matter ? [she]86-lily asked [herself]86-lily , taking up [her]86-lily brush again . [She]86-lily looked at the steps ; they were empty ; [she]86-lily looked at [her]86-lily canvas ; it was blurred . With a sudden intensity , as if [she]86-lily saw it clear for a second , [she]86-lily drew a line there , in the centre . It was done ; it was finished . Yes , [she]86-lily thought , laying down [her]86-lily brush in extreme fatigue , [I]0-i have had [my]0-i vision .

[THE END]2701-the end
